analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the bodhisattva practice itself,

original: dad pa bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dad pa bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni /

translated: The arising of faith in the accomplishment of benefiting others through hearing the uncommon teachings of those who are hostile, middling, and supreme is called the mind that is full of enthusiasm.

original: de sngon du song ba las yon tan dang ldan pa rnams la gus pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de sngon du song ba las yon tan dang ldan pa rnams la gus pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

original: skyo bskyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skyo bskyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In order to generate weariness,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ngan 'gros @86b bsdus pa'i skye ba blangs pa thob pa na da 'di lta bu'i skyo ba skyed par 'gyur te /

analyzed: de lta bu'i sems can chen po rnams la yang skye ba 'di lta bu 'thob pa'i gnas skabs yong par 'gyur na /

original: gzhan dag lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes yid la byas nas 'khor ba ni sdug bsngal ba /
analyzed: gzhan dag lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes yid la byas nas 'khor ba ni sdug bsngal ba /

analyzed: yid brtan du mi rung ba'o zhes skyo ba skyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having reflected on this, he generates sadness, thinking that samsara is suffering and is unreliable.🔽He generates enthusiasm by teaching the various perfections such as generosity, and so on, which are included in the practice.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa sna tshogs la sbyor bas bsdus pa yang dag par ston pa ni spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sngon byung ba'i las sna tshogs kyi gtam las dang 'bras bu rnam par smin pa'i sgo🔽nas rgud pa dang / 'byor ba'i dbang du byas pa thos pa dang ; bdag dang gzhan gyi rgud pa dang / 'byor pa la yang yid 'byung ba skyed par 'gyur te /

translated: He generates disgust by teaching the various stories of past events, the doors of karma and the maturation of karma,🔽in terms of decline and prosperity, and by teaching about the decline and prosperity of self and others.

original: gzhan gyi rgud pa 'gyod pa skye ba'i gnas su gyur pa dang / bdag rgud pa la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgud pa 'gyod pa skye ba'i gnas su gyur pa dang / bdag rgud pa la zhes bya ba'o //

original: shes pa 'di ni rig par gtogs pa'ang yin pa'i phyir rig pa 'di ni sngon gyi mi shes pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs nyid yin la sngar gyi mi shes pa ni rtag par lta ba las skye bar 'gyur ro //

translated: This knowledge is also included in the knowledge of the scriptures, and so this knowledge is the antidote to the former ignorance. The former ignorance arises from the view of permanence.

original: de'i phyir lta ba spong ba nyid 'bras bu nyid du bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir lta ba spong ba nyid 'bras bu nyid du bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /

original: rtag par lta ba rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rtag par lta ba rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “For those who have the view of permanence, etc.”

original: rtag par lta ba'i gang zag bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: rtag par lta ba'i gang zag bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /

original: sngon gyi mthar rtog pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sngon gyi mthar rtog pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: “The speculation about the past.”

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /

original: ma lus par rtag par 'dod pa dang / 'ga' zhig rtag par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: ma lus par rtag par 'dod pa dang / 'ga' zhig rtag par 'dod pa'o //
translated: the assertion that everything is permanent and the assertion that something is permanent.

original: lha'i rna ba'i mkhyen pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lha'i rna ba'i mkhyen pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //

original: gang yang rten gyi dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: gang yang rten gyi dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: Moreover, in terms of the basis, it is said:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lha'i rna bas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lha'i rna bas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The divine ear of the bodhisattva.”

original: mngon par shes pas rab tu phye ba'i rna ba'i dbang po ni rten yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon par shes pas rab tu phye ba'i rna ba'i dbang po ni rten yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The ear faculty that is distinguished by the supernormal knowledge is the basis.

original: dmigs pa ni rnam pa brgyad du rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni rnam pa brgyad du rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //

analyzed: 'gro ba'i rten ni gang yang lha dang mi'i sgra 'og dang steng du zhes bya'o //
translated: The basis of the world is the sound of gods and humans, above and below.

original: legs par bshad pa dang / legs par bshad pa ma yin pa'i dbang du byas nas ni /
analyzed: legs par bshad pa dang / legs par bshad pa ma yin pa'i dbang du byas nas ni /
translated: In terms of being well-spoken and not well-spoken,

analyzed: 'phags pa rnams dang 'phags pa ma yin pa rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: there are the sounds of noble beings and non-noble beings.

original: rnam pa'i dbye ba nyid ni sgra chen po rnams dang / sgra chung ngu rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa'i dbye ba nyid ni sgra chen po rnams dang / sgra chung ngu rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: The distinction in terms of type is the sounds of great and small.

original: don dang bcas pa dang / don dang bcas pa ma yin pa'i dbye ba smras pa /🔽gsal ba @87a * //
analyzed: don dang bcas pa dang / don dang bcas pa ma yin pa'i dbye ba smras pa / gsal ba @87a * //
translated: The distinction in terms of having meaning and not having meaning is

original: rnams dang / mi gsal ba rnams zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnams dang / mi gsal ba rnams zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the sounds of the manifest and unmanifest.

original: mthu dang mthu med pa'i dbye ba smras pa /
analyzed: mthu dang mthu med pa'i dbye ba smras pa /
translated: The distinction in terms of power and lack of power is

original: sprul pa rnams dang / sprul pa ma yin pa rnams zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sprul pa rnams dang / sprul pa ma yin pa rnams zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the sounds of emanations and non-emanations.

original: gang yang yul gyi dbye ba bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gang yang yul gyi dbye ba bstan pa ni /
translated: The classification of objects is taught.

original: rgyang ring po dang / drung na 'dug pa rnams zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyang ring po dang / drung na 'dug pa rnams zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Those who are far away and those who are near.

original: lha'i 'gro bar gtogs pa rnams lha zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lha'i 'gro bar gtogs pa rnams lha zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that the gods belong to the class of beings, he says:

original: lha zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs kyi khams su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: lha zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs kyi khams su gtogs pa'o //
translated: The word gods refers to those belonging to the desire realm and the form realm.

original: gnas kyi dbye bas ni rnam pa du ma nyid do zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gnas kyi dbye bas ni rnam pa du ma nyid do zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to teach that there are many kinds due to the classification of abodes, he says:

original: gong du 'og min gyi mthar thug pa man chang du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gong du 'og min gyi mthar thug pa man chang du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Up to Akaniṣṭha, below.

original: de bzhin du stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams su gtogs pa'i lha'i sgra rnams 'bad pa med par thos so //
analyzed: de bzhin du stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams su gtogs pa'i lha'i sgra rnams 'bad pa med par thos so //
translated: In the same way, the sounds of the gods belonging to the trichiliocosm are heard without effort.

original: 'bad pa dang bcas na ni /
analyzed: 'bad pa dang bcas na ni /
translated: If there is effort,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan gyi yang thos par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan gyi yang thos par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: in order to teach that the sounds of other world systems are also heard, he says:

original: ci ste 'jug pa mdzad na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ci ste 'jug pa mdzad na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: If he engages in it, etc.

original: mi rnams su gtogs pa rnams ni mi nyid du bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /🔽gling bzhi pa thams cad du sems can skyes pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi rnams su gtogs pa rnams ni mi nyid du bstan pa'i phyir smras pa / gling bzhi pa thams cad du sems can skyes pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase all sentient beings born in the four continents is stated to indicate that they belong to the human species.

original: mi'i 'gro ba'i snod ni thad kar yin pas thad kar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi'i 'gro ba'i snod ni thad kar yin pas thad kar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word directly means that the human life-form is upright, not bent over like the life-forms of animals that move on the earth.

original: sangs rgyas rnams dang / nyan thos rnams kyis bstan pa'i sgra ni 'phags pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams dang / nyan thos rnams kyis bstan pa'i sgra ni 'phags pa ste /
translated: The word noble means the sound of the teachings of the Buddhas and the Disciples.

original: 'phags pas gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pas gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called noble because it is spoken by noble beings.

original: yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa dang / rjes su mthun par gyur pas rang nyid kyang 'phags pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa dang / rjes su mthun par gyur pas rang nyid kyang 'phags pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Alternatively, it is called noble because it is the antidote to the afflictions and to purification, and because it is conducive to them.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /🔽mngon sum dang gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa 'jug par gyur pa'o zhes byas nas so //🔽gcig nas gcig tu 'jug pa'i don yang bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te / mngon sum dang gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa 'jug par gyur pa'o zhes byas nas so // gcig nas gcig tu 'jug pa'i don yang bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: It is of two types: that which is directly perceived and that which is indirectly perceived.🔽The phrase having heard it from others is stated to indicate the indirect transmission.

original: de dag las thos nas zhes bya bal /
analyzed: de dag las thos nas zhes bya bal /
translated: The phrase having heard it from others means that one hears it from others.

original: gang rang nyid kyis smra ba yin yang sangs rgyas kyi bka' zhes bya bar smras pa yin no //
analyzed: gang rang nyid kyis smra ba yin yang sangs rgyas kyi bka' zhes bya bar smras pa yin no //
translated: Even though it is spoken by oneself, it is called the word of the Buddha.

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyi kha nas nges par byung ba yin yang sgra ni yi ge dang / dbyangs kyi lugs tsam gyi lugs 'dra bas dang / yul gcig la 'jug par byed pa'i phyir de'i ming rab tu 'thob po //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyi kha nas nges par byung ba yin yang sgra ni yi ge dang / dbyangs kyi lugs tsam gyi lugs 'dra bas dang / yul gcig la 'jug par byed pa'i phyir de'i ming rab tu 'thob po //
translated: Therefore, even though it arises from the mouths of others, the sound is called the name of the Buddha because it is similar to the system of letters and tones, and because it causes one to engage in the same object.

original: sems can de dag kyang 'phags pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: sems can de dag kyang 'phags pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to show that those sentient beings are noble, he says:

original: yang dag par ston pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: yang dag par ston pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “Correctly teaching,” and so on.

original: de ni shin tu khyad par du 'phags pa rnam pa bzhi'i dgongs pa sgrub par byed @87b pa'i phyir 'phags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni shin tu khyad par du 'phags pa rnam pa bzhi'i dgongs pa sgrub par byed @87b pa'i phyir 'phags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called noble because it accomplishes the intention of the four kinds of excellence.

original: de la mi shes pa dang ldan pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid la rmongs pa la sogs pa rmongs pa rnams la yang dag par ston pa'o //
analyzed: de la mi shes pa dang ldan pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid la rmongs pa la sogs pa rmongs pa rnams la yang dag par ston pa'o //
translated: There, for those who are confused about the characteristics of phenomena due to ignorance, it is the correct teaching.

original: le lo can dang 'dun pa med pa dang / bya ba ngan pas 'brel pa rnams bag med par gyur pa la yang dag par skul bar byed pa ni yang dag par len du 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: le lo can dang 'dun pa med pa dang / bya ba ngan pas 'brel pa rnams bag med par gyur pa la yang dag par skul bar byed pa ni yang dag par len du 'jug pa ste /
translated: The correct instigation is the instigation of the lazy, the unaspiring, and those who are attached to evil actions, to the practice of heedfulness.

original: de'i don du yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de'i don du yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
translated: The correct engagement is the engagement in the meaning of that.

original: dman pa la mos pa dang / bdag nyid la smod pa dang / snyom las can dang / 'jigs pa dang bcas pa dang 'gyod pa mang ba rnams la yang dag par gzengs bstod pa ste /
analyzed: dman pa la mos pa dang / bdag nyid la smod pa dang / snyom las can dang / 'jigs pa dang bcas pa dang 'gyod pa mang ba rnams la yang dag par gzengs bstod pa ste /
translated: The correct encouragement is the encouragement of those who aspire to the inferior, those who are self-deprecating, the indolent, the fearful, and the doubting.

original: spro ba skyed par byed pa'o //🔽dngos po de dang de la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams yang dag par dga' bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: spro ba skyed par byed pa'o // dngos po de dang de la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams yang dag par dga' bar byed pa ste /
translated: The correct exaltation is the exaltation of those who are diligent.🔽The correct satisfaction is the satisfaction of those who are engaged in this and that.

original: dga' ba skyed par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: dga' ba skyed par byed pa nyid do //
translated: The correct delight is the delight of those who are satisfied.

original: dgos pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: dgos pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: The correct speech is the speech given for the sake of that.

original: dge ba yang dag par blang ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dge ba yang dag par blang ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The correct undertaking of virtue and so on are the undertakings of virtue, the undertakings of what is not evil, and the undertakings of what is not mixed with evil.

original: de ltar yang dag par dga' bar byed pa'i bar dang ldan na mi dge ba'i chos rnams ni spong bar byed /🔽dge ba'i chos rnams ni sgom par byed do zhes bya bas sdig pa rnams ni spong bar byed la /
analyzed: de ltar yang dag par dga' bar byed pa'i bar dang ldan na mi dge ba'i chos rnams ni spong bar byed / dge ba'i chos rnams ni sgom par byed do zhes bya bas sdig pa rnams ni spong bar byed la /
translated: Thus, when one is endowed with the correct rejoicing, one abandons unwholesome dharmas.🔽One cultivates wholesome dharmas.

original: bsod nams ni yang dag par len par byed ces bya bar nges pas so //
analyzed: bsod nams ni yang dag par len par byed ces bya bar nges pas so //
translated: Thus, one abandons evil and takes up merit.

original: rjes su thob pa rnams kyang 'phags pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: rjes su thob pa rnams kyang 'phags pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the subsequent attainments are also noble, he says:

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With a mind that is not afflicted, etc.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi sems ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la sogs pa 'dod pas ston pa la sogs pa la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi sems ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la sogs pa 'dod pas ston pa la sogs pa la zhugs pa'o //
translated: Therein, an afflicted mind is one that is engaged in teaching, etc. out of desire for gain, honor, etc.

original: de las bzlog pa ni bdag dang gzhan rnam par grol ba nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir zhugs par gyur pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni bdag dang gzhan rnam par grol ba nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir zhugs par gyur pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems zhes bya'o //
translated: The opposite of that is a mind that is not afflicted, which is engaged in order to attain liberation for oneself and others.

original: bskul ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bskul ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Exhortation is also of two kinds:

original: don la bskul ba dang / don med pa la bskul ba'o //
analyzed: don la bskul ba dang / don med pa la bskul ba'o //
translated: exhortation to the meaningful and exhortation to the meaningless.

original: de la don la bskul ba ni dkar po'i phyogs kyi tshig gi lam lnga dang ldan pa la zhugs pa ni bdag dang gzhan dang bstan pa la phan pa byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de la don la bskul ba ni dkar po'i phyogs kyi tshig gi lam lnga dang ldan pa la zhugs pa ni bdag dang gzhan dang bstan pa la phan pa byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Among them, exhortation to the meaningful is the one who is engaged in the five paths of the side of virtue, because he is engaged in benefiting himself, others, and the teaching.

original: / de las bzlog pa kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyis bskul bar gtogs pa ni 'phags pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: / de las bzlog pa kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyis bskul bar gtogs pa ni 'phags pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The opposite of that is the one who is engaged in the afflicted exhortation, who is not a noble being.

original: gang zag 'das pa'i ltung ba rnams ston par byed pa ni dran par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag 'das pa'i ltung ba rnams ston par byed pa ni dran par byed pa'o //
translated: The one who reveals the downfalls of the past of a person is the one who reminds.

original: da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi ltung ba mi 'byung zhing sdom par byed pa ni 'doms pa dang rjes su ston @88a * //
analyzed: da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi ltung ba mi 'byung zhing sdom par byed pa ni 'doms pa dang rjes su ston @88a * //
translated: The one who does not let downfalls of the present and future arise and who binds them is the one who instructs and teaches.

original: pa'o ; / gzhan yang legs par smras pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: pa'o ; / gzhan yang legs par smras pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Moreover, the one who speaks well is the one who speaks pleasantly.

original: 'dir legs par byon nam zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsdus pa rnams dang / ngag gi nyes par spyod pa las log pas bsdus pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'dir legs par byon nam zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsdus pa rnams dang / ngag gi nyes par spyod pa las log pas bsdus pa rnams so //
translated: Here, the sounds that are included in the words “Have you come here well?” and so on, and the sounds that are included in the words “Turn away from verbal misconduct!”

original: rgya cha ba'i 'phags pa las bzlog pa rnams ni 'phags pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: rgya cha ba'i 'phags pa las bzlog pa rnams ni 'phags pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: The sounds that are the opposite of the noble sounds are taught as the non-noble sounds.

original: ngag gi nyes par spyod pa rnam pa bzhis bsdus pa'i sgra gang yin pa rnams zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: ngag gi nyes par spyod pa rnam pa bzhis bsdus pa'i sgra gang yin pa rnams zhes bya ba yang /
translated: The sounds that are included in the four types of verbal misconduct are called “the sounds that are included in the four types of verbal misconduct.”

original: rtsa ba la la las ni 'og dang / thad kar dang steng du zhes 'don par byed pa de'i dbang du byas nas 'og tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rtsa ba la la las ni 'og dang / thad kar dang steng du zhes 'don par byed pa de'i dbang du byas nas 'og tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Some texts recite “below, horizontally, and above,” and in consideration of that, it is said “below” and so on.

original: sngar bstan pa'i lha dang mi'i sgra las gzhan pa'i rnam par gzhag pa 'am /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i lha dang mi'i sgra las gzhan pa'i rnam par gzhag pa 'am /
translated: The sounds that are other than the sounds of gods and humans that were previously taught are posited as non-noble sounds.

original: yang na de nyid kyi rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang na de nyid kyi rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: Or, they are a division of those very sounds.

original: rnam pa gnyis kyis chen por rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyis chen por rig par bya ste /
translated: They should be known as great in two ways:

original: kun nas slong bar byed pa nyid dang / rten nyid kyis so //
analyzed: kun nas slong bar byed pa nyid dang / rten nyid kyis so //
translated: by being the motivator and by being the basis.

original: kun nas slong bar byed pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: kun nas slong bar byed pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The instigation is also of two kinds.

original: dga' ba'i rnam pa'i sems kyi dbang du byas nas smras pa /🔽sems can gyi tshogs chen po'i sgra zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dga' ba'i rnam pa'i sems kyi dbang du byas nas smras pa / sems can gyi tshogs chen po'i sgra zhes bya ba ni /
translated: With reference to the mind that has the aspect of joy, he says:🔽The sound of a great multitude of sentient beings.

original: sems can gyi tshogs chen po 'dus pa'i sgra zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can gyi tshogs chen po 'dus pa'i sgra zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: the sound of a great assembly of sentient beings.

original: yang na sems can gyi tshogs rnams kyi sgra chen po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na sems can gyi tshogs rnams kyi sgra chen po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or else, it is the great sound of the multitude of sentient beings.

original: de ltar na dga' ba drag pos bskyed pa'i dga' ba'i shugs kyis chen por bskyed pa zhes bya bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dga' ba drag pos bskyed pa'i dga' ba'i shugs kyis chen por bskyed pa zhes bya bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is taught that the sound is great because it is produced by a great force of joy, which is produced by intense joy.

original: sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba drag pos bskyed pa'i sgra yang chen po zhes bya bar bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba drag pos bskyed pa'i sgra yang chen po zhes bya bar bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to teach that the sound is great because it is produced by intense suffering and mental unhappiness, he says:

original: gnod pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnod pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: By various kinds of harm, etc.

original: rten mang po nyid bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: rten mang po nyid bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to teach the multiplicity of the basis, he says:

original: 'brug sgra grag pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'brug sgra grag pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Like the sound of thunder, etc.

original: sgra chung du yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sgra chung du yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Soft sound is also of two kinds:

original: shin tu phra ba'i rnam par gtogs pa nyid ni 'bad pa drag po'i sgrub pas thos pa nyid dang / sems can gcig gi rgyud kyis thos kyi gzhan gyis ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: shin tu phra ba'i rnam par gtogs pa nyid ni 'bad pa drag po'i sgrub pas thos pa nyid dang / sems can gcig gi rgyud kyis thos kyi gzhan gyis ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: very subtle, which is heard only through great effort, and which is heard by the mindstream of one being and not by another.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:🔽even the sound of a whisper in the ear.

original: tha na rna bar bshubs  pa'i sgra yan chad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tha na rna bar bshubs  pa'i sgra yan chad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that even the sound of a whisper in the ear is heard.

original: kha don dang rnam pa 'dren yang don la brdar byas pa'i sgras tshig dang yi ge gsal ba gang yin pa ni sgra gsal ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: kha don dang rnam pa 'dren yang don la brdar byas pa'i sgras tshig dang yi ge gsal ba gang yin pa ni sgra gsal ba zhes brjod do //
translated: Recitation and the bringing of aspects are also clear sounds, because the words and letters are made clear by the sounds that are conventionally created.

original: gang dag gis don go ba yin no zhes bya ba de las bzlog pa ni don mi gsal ba'o //
analyzed: gang dag gis don go ba yin no zhes bya ba de las bzlog pa ni don mi gsal ba'o //
translated: That which is understood as meaning is clear meaning. The opposite of that is unclear meaning.

original: sngags thams cad don dang ldan pa ma yin @88b na yang /
analyzed: sngags thams cad don dang ldan pa ma yin @88b na yang /
translated: Although all mantras do not have meaning,

original: 'gro lding ba'i sngags kho na smos pa de ni gsang ba'i sngags yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro lding ba'i sngags kho na smos pa de ni gsang ba'i sngags yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: only the mantras of the people of Dramiḍa are mentioned here because they are secret mantras.

original: ne tso dang ri skegs la sogs pa'i skad ni ma bslabs pa rnams kyis gzung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ne tso dang ri skegs la sogs pa'i skad ni ma bslabs pa rnams kyis gzung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The sounds of parrots, myna birds, etc. should be understood as those that are not learned.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par 'dus byas pa'i sgra ni sprul pa zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par 'dus byas pa'i sgra ni sprul pa zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sound of the supernormal manifestation of magical power is taught as the sound of the emanation.

original: yang de ni sprul pa de nyid la brten pa dang / rten gzhan dag la brten par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang de ni sprul pa de nyid la brten pa dang / rten gzhan dag la brten par rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, that sound is to be known as based on that very emanation and as based on other supports.

original: rang gi gnas la brten pa rnams ni nye ba zhes bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: rang gi gnas la brten pa rnams ni nye ba zhes bstan pa yin te /
translated: Those based on their own place are taught as nearby.

original: byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la go rims ji lta ba bzhin du grong dang / gtsug lag khang bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la go rims ji lta ba bzhin du grong dang / gtsug lag khang bstan pa yin no //
translated: The village and the monastery are taught as the places of the householder and the monk bodhisattvas, respectively.

original: de dag las gzhan par gyur pa ni rgyang ring po'i sgra ste /
analyzed: de dag las gzhan par gyur pa ni rgyang ring po'i sgra ste /
translated: The sound from elsewhere is the sound from afar.

original: de dag yongs su chad pa med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag yongs su chad pa med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that they are not limited,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: it is said: “in countless world systems. ”

original: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pa'i ye shes ni 'chi 'pho dang skye ba dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pa'i ye shes ni 'chi 'pho dang skye ba dgongs pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of death and rebirth is the knowledge of death and rebirth of sentient beings.

original: de dag gi gnas skabs yul du mdzad cing gzung zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag gi gnas skabs yul du mdzad cing gzung zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “taking the state of those as objects” is “grasping them.”

original: ye shes des thog ma dang tha ma smos pas bar gyi gnas skabs rnams kyang mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes des thog ma dang tha ma smos pas bar gyi gnas skabs rnams kyang mkhyen pa'o //
translated: Since the knowledge of death and rebirth is mentioned, the knowledge of the intermediate state is also included.

original: mdor bsdu na ye shes de rnam pa gsum du gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na ye shes de rnam pa gsum du gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: In brief, it should be understood that this knowledge is presented in three ways:

original: rten nyid dang / dmigs pa nyid dang / dmigs pa'i dbye ba nyid do ;
analyzed: rten nyid dang / dmigs pa nyid dang / dmigs pa'i dbye ba nyid do ;
translated: as the basis, as the object, and as the classification of the object.

original: / yang rten dang dmigs pa dang / rnam pa'o //
analyzed: / yang rten dang dmigs pa dang / rnam pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is the basis, object, and aspect.

original: rten gyi dbang du byas nas smras pa /🔽lha'i mig gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rten gyi dbang du byas nas smras pa / lha'i mig gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: From the perspective of the basis, it is said:🔽“Through the divine eye.”

original: da la brten pa'i ste /
analyzed: da la brten pa'i ste /
translated: The divine eye is based on the eye sense faculty of the god realm.

original: de la brten nas shes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la brten nas shes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that knowledge is based on that.

original: rten la brten par nye bar btags nas so //
analyzed: rten la brten par nye bar btags nas so //
translated: It is designated as based on the basis.

original: ji ltar mig gis rnam par shes par bya ba ni gzugs zhes bya ba lta bu dang / dril bu sgrogs zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mig gis rnam par shes par bya ba ni gzugs zhes bya ba lta bu dang / dril bu sgrogs zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: Just as it is said, “The object of visual consciousness is form,” and “The sound of a bell.”

original: lha'i 'gro bar gtogs pa'i phyir lha'i zhes bya ba'o //🔽mngon par shes pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lha'i 'gro bar gtogs pa'i phyir lha'i zhes bya ba'o // mngon par shes pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir /
translated: It is divine because it belongs to the class of gods.

original: rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: It is pure because it is distinguished by the superknowledges.

original: 'dis ni las las skyes pa dang / skye bas thob pa bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni las las skyes pa dang / skye bas thob pa bsal ba yin no //
translated: This excludes the divine eye that is born with the body and that which is produced by karma.

original: de'i phyir mi'i las 'das pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi'i las 'das pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, it is said to transcend the human.

original: thag ring ba dang / shin tu phra ba dang / bsgribs pa rnams kyang spyod yul nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thag ring ba dang / shin tu phra ba dang / bsgribs pa rnams kyang spyod yul nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also called divine because it is distant, subtle, and obstructed.

original: dmigs pa ni sems can rnams te /
analyzed: dmigs pa ni sems can rnams te /
translated: Its object is sentient beings.

original: gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: It is said:

original: sems can rnams 'chi 'pho ba'i ched dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽de yang gtso bo tsam smras @89a * //
analyzed: sems can rnams 'chi 'pho ba'i ched dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / de yang gtso bo tsam smras @89a * //
translated: “The divine eye sees sentient beings dying and being born.”

original: pa yin te /
analyzed: pa yin te /
translated: This is said in terms of the primary object.

original: sems can 'ba' zhig pas mi mthong ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sems can 'ba' zhig pas mi mthong ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: But it is not the case that only sentient beings are seen by the divine eye.

original: gzugs gzhan dag kyang mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: gzugs gzhan dag kyang mthong ba yin no //
translated: Other forms are also seen.

original: rnam pa bzhis sems can rnams gzung bar bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir ris mthun pa'i lus len cing gtong ba'i gnas skabs kyis gzung bar bya ba nyid ni gang yang 'chi 'pho ba'i tshe zhes bya ba ni 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i tshe zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhis sems can rnams gzung bar bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir ris mthun pa'i lus len cing gtong ba'i gnas skabs kyis gzung bar bya ba nyid ni gang yang 'chi 'pho ba'i tshe zhes bya ba ni 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i tshe zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “At the time of death” means at the time of dying.

original: shi 'phos pa na zhes bya ba ni skye bar 'gyur pa na sta /
analyzed: shi 'phos pa na zhes bya ba ni skye bar 'gyur pa na sta /
translated: “At the time of rebirth” means at the time of birth.

original: srid pa bar ma'i gnas skabs la skye bar 'gyur ba zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma'i gnas skabs la skye bar 'gyur ba zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the state of the intermediate existence is called “birth,”

original: sngon gyi ris mthun pa'i lus shi bar gyur nas skye ba gzhan ma blangs pa ni skye bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'o //🔽srid pa bar ma'i gnas skabs na yang kha dog nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: sngon gyi ris mthun pa'i lus shi bar gyur nas skye ba gzhan ma blangs pa ni skye bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'o // srid pa bar ma'i gnas skabs na yang kha dog nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: when the body of the same type from the past has died and another birth has not yet been taken up, it is called “birth.”

original: mdog sdug pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mdog sdug pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Since the state of the intermediate existence also has color, he says, “beautiful complexion,” etc.

original: bde 'gror 'gro ba'i srid pa bar ma ni ji ltar yar ngo'i zla ba'i 'od kyis bskor ba lta bur gsal bar snang ba yin no//
analyzed: bde 'gror 'gro ba'i srid pa bar ma ni ji ltar yar ngo'i zla ba'i 'od kyis bskor ba lta bur gsal bar snang ba yin no//
translated: The intermediate beings who are going to a happy migratory state appear bright, like the moon on the waxing moon.

original: ngan 'gror 'gro pa'i srid pa bar ma'i mtshan ma ni mun pa'i nang du zhugs pa lta bu'am /
analyzed: ngan 'gror 'gro pa'i srid pa bar ma'i mtshan ma ni mun pa'i nang du zhugs pa lta bu'am /
translated: The signs of the intermediate beings who are going to an unfortunate migratory state are like those who have entered darkness,

original: mdog shin tu mi sdug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdog shin tu mi sdug par 'gyur ro //
translated: or like a very ugly color.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: ngan pa dang / bzang po dang zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ngan pa dang / bzang po dang zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: “unfortunate and fortunate” and so on.

original: mdo'i tshig las /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig las /
translated: In the words of the sutra,

original: bde 'gro dang / ngan 'gro zhes bya ba der /
analyzed: bde 'gro dang / ngan 'gro zhes bya ba der /
translated: “happy migratory state and unfortunate migratory state” are mentioned.

original: ngan 'gro ni dman pa'o //
analyzed: ngan 'gro ni dman pa'o //
translated: An unfortunate migratory state is inferior.

original: bde 'gro ni bzang po'o //
analyzed: bde 'gro ni bzang po'o //
translated: A happy migratory state is fortunate.

original: de lta bu ni re zhig srid pa bar ma'i gnas skabs pa'i bye ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu ni re zhig srid pa bar ma'i gnas skabs pa'i bye ba'o //
translated: Such is the variety of the state of the intermediate beings.

original: sngon dus kyi srid pa la gnas pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: sngon dus kyi srid pa la gnas pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: With reference to the state of the prior life, it is said:

original: phyi ma'i mthar skyes shing zhes bya ba ni ji ltar las kyi dbang gis 'gro ba rnams zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mthar skyes shing zhes bya ba ni ji ltar las kyi dbang gis 'gro ba rnams zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig gis so //
translated: “born at the end of the future” and so on, as in the words of the sutra, “by the power of karma, the beings go.

original: de'i bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni /
translated: ” The explanation of that is:

original: skyes shing 'phel ba'i rgyus dbang po rnams yongs su smin pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skyes shing 'phel ba'i rgyus dbang po rnams yongs su smin pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The cause of birth and growth is the full development of the faculties.

original: lus kyi spyod pa zhes bya ba ni dang pa bstan pas lhag ma rnams kyang grub par rigs par bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi spyod pa zhes bya ba ni dang pa bstan pas lhag ma rnams kyang grub par rigs par bya'o //
translated: The phrase “bodily conduct” is mentioned first, and the rest are to be understood by analogy.

original: srid pa 'dir lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyis nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa dang / legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: srid pa 'dir lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyis nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa dang / legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig gis so //
translated: The meaning of the sutra passage is as follows: “In this world, there is misconduct and good conduct of body, speech, and mind.”

original: lung du ma bstan pa ma smos pas don gyis bstan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa ma smos pas don gyis bstan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Since the sutra does not mention the indeterminate, it should be understood that it is taught by implication.

original: mdor ma bstan pa ni mdo las bde 'gro dang / ngan 'gro'i rgyur shes par bya ba'i phyir nyes par spyod pa dang / legs par spyod pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mdor ma bstan pa ni mdo las bde 'gro dang / ngan 'gro'i rgyur shes par bya ba'i phyir nyes par spyod pa dang / legs par spyod pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The sutra does not teach the indeterminate because it is to be understood as the cause of good and bad destinies.

original: de bzhin du snang ba yang @89b zhes bya ba ni sems can ma yin pa'i lus ston pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du snang ba yang @89b zhes bya ba ni sems can ma yin pa'i lus ston pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa'o //
translated: The phrase “and so on” refers to the teaching of the body of non-sentient beings.

original: mig gi yul gang yin pa de mthong ngo zhes bya bar bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: mig gi yul gang yin pa de mthong ngo zhes bya bar bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: He says this in order to show that the object of the eye is seen.

original: cha phra ba yang zhes bya ba la de nyid bshad pa ni /
analyzed: cha phra ba yang zhes bya ba la de nyid bshad pa ni /
translated: The subtle part is also.

original: gzugs sprul pa gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs sprul pa gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The form that is emanated, etc.

original: yongs su rdzogs par ma gyur pa'i gnas skabs kyi gang yin pa dang sprul pa ni cha phra ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs par ma gyur pa'i gnas skabs kyi gang yin pa dang sprul pa ni cha phra ba'o //
translated: The subtle part is that which is in the state of not being fully completed and that which is emanated.

original: yang cha phra ba'i sprul pa'i dbang du byas nas bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: yang cha phra ba'i sprul pa'i dbang du byas nas bstan par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the subtle part of emanation should be taught.

original: ji ltar 'dul ba las ma 'gags pas smras pa /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dul ba las ma 'gags pas smras pa /
translated: As it is said in the Vinaya,

original: ngas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis lta na /
analyzed: ngas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis lta na /
translated: “I see with the eye of the Buddha

original: srid pa bar ma dang / sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa dpag tu med pa mthong ngo zhes smras pas de ltar byas na /
analyzed: srid pa bar ma dang / sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa dpag tu med pa mthong ngo zhes smras pas de ltar byas na /
translated: that there are innumerable intermediate existences and emanations of the Buddha.”

original: sangs rgya dang byang chub sems dpa'i sprul pa cha phra ba yang bstan par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgya dang byang chub sems dpa'i sprul pa cha phra ba yang bstan par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: If it is so, then the subtle part of the emanations of the Buddha and bodhisattvas is also taught.

original: lha'i 'gro bar gtogs pa ni mi la ltos nas cha phra ba yin no zhes bya bar smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i 'gro bar gtogs pa ni mi la ltos nas cha phra ba yin no zhes bya bar smras pa /
translated: The gods are subtle in comparison to humans.

original: lha'i gzugs dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lha'i gzugs dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The form of the gods.

original: gzugs na kun du spyod pa'i gzugs gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs na kun du spyod pa'i gzugs gang yin pa'o //
translated: The form that is experienced in the form realm.

original: srid pa bar ma'i skye ba cha phra bas cha phra ba'o //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma'i skye ba cha phra bas cha phra ba'o //
translated: The subtle form of the intermediate existence.

original: gzhig tu med pas dang ba'o //
analyzed: gzhig tu med pas dang ba'o //
translated: The clear form that is not destroyed.

original: thag ring ba dang / bsgribs pa spyod yul du gyur par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: thag ring ba dang / bsgribs pa spyod yul du gyur par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the domain of the eye is distant and obscured, he says:

original: 'og tu mnar med pa la thug pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'og tu mnar med pa la thug pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Below, up to Avici.

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i gzugs ston pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i gzugs ston pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa'o //
translated: This is said from the perspective of the form that is possessed by the desire realm.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa rnams ni /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi skus bsdus pa'i gzugs mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa rnams ni / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi skus bsdus pa'i gzugs mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: The pure buddha fields🔽are seen by the form that is included in the essential body of the tathagatas.🔽In order to demonstrate this, he says:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The tathagatas, etc.

original: mngon par shes pa gnyis ni las mtshungs pa nyid du bstan pas las bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa gnyis ni las mtshungs pa nyid du bstan pas las bstan par bya ste /
translated: The two higher knowledges are taught by the action of teaching, since they are taught as being similar to action.🔽They are the higher knowledge of action, since they are the establishment of those who are virtuous in virtue and the establishment of those who are nonvirtuous in virtue, after having been raised up from nonvirtue.🔽They are the higher knowledge of teaching, since they are the teaching of those who are not established in virtue and the teaching of those who are established in virtue.

original: dge ba byed pa'i sems can rnams yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya ba'i phyir rab tu 'god par byed pa dang / mi dge ba byed pa rnams mi dge ba las bslang nas dge ba la rab tu 'god par byed pas gang gis rab tu 'jog pa de ni yang dag par ston pa dag yang dag par ston pa dag yang dag par bskul ba dang /🔽yang dag par gzengs pa ston pa rnams dang / ji ltar rigs par ram /🔽go rims bzhin du yang rung ngo //🔽lha'i rna bas dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i ngag 'jug par gyur pa na thos shing shes par byas nas de dag la de bzhin du sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: dge ba byed pa'i sems can rnams yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya ba'i phyir rab tu 'god par byed pa dang / mi dge ba byed pa rnams mi dge ba las bslang nas dge ba la rab tu 'god par byed pas gang gis rab tu 'jog pa de ni yang dag par ston pa dag yang dag par ston pa dag yang dag par bskul ba dang / yang dag par gzengs pa ston pa rnams dang / ji ltar rigs par ram / go rims bzhin du yang rung ngo // lha'i rna bas dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i ngag 'jug par gyur pa na thos shing shes par byas nas de dag la de bzhin du sgrub par byed do //
translated: They are the higher knowledge of aspiration, since they are the aspiration for the Dharma of the three vehicles.🔽They are the higher knowledge of the divine eye, since they are the knowledge of the deaths and rebirths of beings.🔽They are the higher knowledge of the divine ear, since they are the hearing of the words of those who are virtuous and nonvirtuous.

original: sems @90a * //
analyzed: sems @90a * //
translated: They are the higher knowledge of the mental activity of others, since they are the knowledge of the mental activity of others.🔽They are the higher knowledge of the recollection of former existences, since they are the knowledge of former existences of oneself and others.🔽They are the higher knowledge of the destruction of the impurities, since they are the knowledge of the destruction of the impurities.

original: dang sems pa dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs te /
analyzed: dang sems pa dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs te /
translated: Mind, thought, and consciousness are synonyms.

original: de gcig nas gcig tu 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de gcig nas gcig tu 'jug pa'o //
translated: They are the one who passes on from one existence to another.

original: de 'dzin par byed pa'i shes pa ni sems kyi rnam grangs mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dzin par byed pa'i shes pa ni sems kyi rnam grangs mkhyen pa'o //
translated: The knowledge that apprehends that is the knowledge of the categories of mind.

original: nyon mongs pas kun nas dkris pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mdo'i rjes su 'brangs nas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pas kun nas dkris pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mdo'i rjes su 'brangs nas bstan pa ste /
translated: The phrase “the entanglements of the mental afflictions” and so on is presented in accordance with a sūtra.

original: gang gi phyir mdo las bstan pa ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mdo las bstan pa ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang zhes bya'o //
translated: For the sūtras state, “One who is accompanied by desire, accompanied by hatred, and accompanied by ignorance.”

original: nyon mongs pas kun nas dkris pa dang bral ba dang zhes bya ba ni gang yang mdo las /
analyzed: nyon mongs pas kun nas dkris pa dang bral ba dang zhes bya ba ni gang yang mdo las /
translated: The phrase “free from the entanglements of the mental afflictions” and so on is presented in accordance with a sūtra.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bral ba dang zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bral ba dang zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: For the sūtras state, “One who is free from desire, free from hatred, and free from ignorance.”

original: nyon mongs pa dang 'brel pa dang bcas pa ni nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang 'brel pa dang bcas pa ni nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is associated with the afflictions because it is accompanied by the latent afflictions.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: bag la nyal ba dang bcas pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bag la nyal ba dang bcas pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is accompanied by the latent afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang ; nyon mongs pa dang bral ba dang zhes bya ba'i mdo'i bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang ; nyon mongs pa dang bral ba dang zhes bya ba'i mdo'i bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is the commentary on the meaning of the sutra that states: “It is accompanied by the afflictions and free from the afflictions.”

original: phyin ci log dang bcas pa dang / phyin ci log dang bcas pa ma yin pa'i mdo'i don bshad pa ni /
analyzed: phyin ci log dang bcas pa dang / phyin ci log dang bcas pa ma yin pa'i mdo'i don bshad pa ni /
translated: The meaning of the sutra that states: “It is accompanied by error and free from error” is explained as follows:

original: smon lam legs par btab pa dang / smon lam legs par btab pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: smon lam legs par btab pa dang / smon lam legs par btab pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is accompanied by a good aspiration and free from a good aspiration.

original: smon lam log par btab pa ni srid par skye ba'i phyir yongs su bsngos pa ste /
analyzed: smon lam log par btab pa ni srid par skye ba'i phyir yongs su bsngos pa ste /
translated: A bad aspiration is a dedication to rebirth in existence.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: mu stegs can gyi sems dang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mu stegs can gyi sems dang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is accompanied by the mind of a tīrthika.

original: phyi rol pa thams cad kyi sems ni 'khor ba la mngon par dga' ba nyid kyi phyir byas nas so //
analyzed: phyi rol pa thams cad kyi sems ni 'khor ba la mngon par dga' ba nyid kyi phyir byas nas so //
translated: The mind of all non-Buddhists is accompanied by error because they delight in saṃsāra.

original: rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / rab tu dga' bar byas pa'i dbang su byas nas /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / rab tu dga' bar byas pa'i dbang su byas nas /
translated: Having been made powerful by gain, honor, and delight,

original: 'dod pa'i dbang gis mthong ba'i chos la dge ba'i phyogs la spyod pa dang ldan du zin kyang sems kyi smon lam log par btab pa'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dbang gis mthong ba'i chos la dge ba'i phyogs la spyod pa dang ldan du zin kyang sems kyi smon lam log par btab pa'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: and by the power of desire, even though one may be engaged in the side of virtue in this life, one's mental aspirations are perverted.

original: zang zing dang bcas pa'i bsam pa can gyi nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zang zing dang bcas pa'i bsam pa can gyi nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase a non-defiled mind that is accompanied by a desire for material possessions is used to indicate this.

original: de las bzlog pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase the opposite of that refers to

original: chos 'di pa'i mya ngan las 'das par gtogs ba'i sems dang / zang zing med pa'i bsam pa nyon mongs pa med pa'i sems ni smon lam legs par btab pa'o //
analyzed: chos 'di pa'i mya ngan las 'das par gtogs ba'i sems dang / zang zing med pa'i bsam pa nyon mongs pa med pa'i sems ni smon lam legs par btab pa'o //
translated: the mind that is included in the nirvana of this doctrine and the non-defiled mind that is accompanied by a desire for Dharma.

original: 'dod par gtogs pa'i sems ni dman pa'i khams pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod par gtogs pa'i sems ni dman pa'i khams pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase a mind that is included in the realm of desire refers to the fact that it is a mind of an inferior realm.

original: dman pa nyid du bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dman pa nyid du bstan pa ni /
translated: The phrase it is inferior indicates🔽that it is inferior to the mind that is included in the realm of form.

original: @90b 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa'i sems can zhes bya ba ni 'dod par gtogs pa rnams kyi yang kha cig rten skyon dang ldan pa la brten pas phra zhing rtogs par dka' ba yin na yang shes par 'gyur zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: @90b 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa'i sems can zhes bya ba ni 'dod par gtogs pa rnams kyi yang kha cig rten skyon dang ldan pa la brten pas phra zhing rtogs par dka' ba yin na yang shes par 'gyur zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The phrase “the minds of sentient beings born in the desire realm” refers to the fact that some minds belonging to the desire realm are subtle and difficult to discern because they are supported by a defective physical body.

original: tha na ri dgas dang bya yan chad kyi sems mkhyen zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha na ri dgas dang bya yan chad kyi sems mkhyen zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase “even the minds of animals and birds” is stated to indicate that the Buddha knows even these minds.

original: gzugs kyi khams su gtogs pa'i sems ni khams bar ma yin pas bar ma'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su gtogs pa'i sems ni khams bar ma yin pas bar ma'o //
translated: The phrase “the minds of sentient beings in the form realm” refers to the minds of sentient beings in the intermediate realm.

original: gzugs med par gtogs pa'i sems ni khams gya nom par skyes pas gya nom pa'i sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs med par gtogs pa'i sems ni khams gya nom par skyes pas gya nom pa'i sems zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase “the minds of sentient beings in the formless realm” refers to the minds of sentient beings who have been born in the most excellent realm.

original: khams gsum po 'di dag tu tshor ba rnam pa gsum dang ldan pa'i sems kyang ji ltar rigs par shes par bya'o zhes bya bar smras pa /
analyzed: khams gsum po 'di dag tu tshor ba rnam pa gsum dang ldan pa'i sems kyang ji ltar rigs par shes par bya'o zhes bya bar smras pa /
translated: The phrase “the minds of sentient beings who possess the three types of feelings” refers to the fact that the minds of sentient beings in the three realms possess the three types of feelings in whatever way is appropriate.

original: bde ba dang ldan pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang ldan pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase “the minds of sentient beings who possess pleasure” and so on is stated in this way.

original: dus gcig tu'am rim gyis 'dzin pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: dus gcig tu'am rim gyis 'dzin pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: The phrase “simultaneously and in sequence” is stated from the point of view of the order in which the minds are apprehended.

original: sems mkhyen pa gcig gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems mkhyen pa gcig gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “A single knowledge of minds” and so on.

original: sems kyi skad cig gcig gis sems kyi rgyun rab tu shes so //
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig gcig gis sems kyi rgyun rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows the stream of minds in a single moment of mind.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: gang gi sems gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gang gi sems gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “Whatever mind there is” and so on.

original: gang gi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang gi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Whatever” refers to

original: sems can gzhan dag go //
analyzed: sems can gzhan dag go //
translated: other sentient beings.

original: gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni sems so //
analyzed: gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni sems so //
translated: “There is” refers to the mind.

original: ji lta bu zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ji lta bu zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “What kind” refers to being with attachment and so on.

original: ci 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni dman pa dang gya nom pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni dman pa dang gya nom pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “What sort” refers to inferior, middling, and so on.

original: ji snyed pa zhes bya ba ni skad cig pa dang rgyun gyis 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: ji snyed pa zhes bya ba ni skad cig pa dang rgyun gyis 'jug pa'o //
translated: “How many” refers to momentary and continuous engagement.

original: rnam pa 'di dag dus gcig tu mkhyen pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di dag dus gcig tu mkhyen pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Because he knows these aspects simultaneously, it is said:

original: cig car zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: cig car zhes bya ba'am /
translated: “Simultaneously.”

original: 'dis ni sems can thams cad kyi sems kyang cig car 'dzin par byed de /
analyzed: 'dis ni sems can thams cad kyi sems kyang cig car 'dzin par byed de /
translated: This means that he also simultaneously apprehends the minds of all sentient beings,

original: mthu bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthu bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because his power is inconceivable.

original: mngon par shes pa 'di ni stobs rnam pa bzhi kun nas skyed par byed pa dang / 'phel bar byed pa'o zhes bya bas stobs kyi las kyi sgo nas de'i las bstan pa'i phyir dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa 'di ni stobs rnam pa bzhi kun nas skyed par byed pa dang / 'phel bar byed pa'o zhes bya bas stobs kyi las kyi sgo nas de'i las bstan pa'i phyir dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The power of the knowledge of what is possible and impossible, etc.

original: dbang po rnams ni dman pa dang / bar ma dang / mchog gi bye brag gis mchog dang mchog ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnams ni dman pa dang / bar ma dang / mchog gi bye brag gis mchog dang mchog ma yin pa'o //
translated: The faculties are superior and inferior due to the distinction of being weak, middling, and strong.

original: de mkhyen pa ni 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas so //🔽lam sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis sems can rnams bde 'gror 'gro ba dang / mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i @91a * //
analyzed: de mkhyen pa ni 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas so // lam sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis sems can rnams bde 'gror 'gro ba dang / mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i @91a * //
translated: The knowledge of them is in terms of their engagement.

original: lam la rab tu 'god par byed cing yang dag par spyod par byed do zhes bya bar smras pa /
analyzed: lam la rab tu 'god par byed cing yang dag par spyod par byed do zhes bya bar smras pa /
translated: By the power of the knowledge of the various paths, he establishes sentient beings in the path that leads to the happy realms and to nirvana, and he causes them to practice.

original: ci rigs par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci rigs par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: As is fitting.

original: zag pa rnams zad par mkhyen pa'am /
analyzed: zag pa rnams zad par mkhyen pa'am /
translated: The knowledge of the extinction of the contaminants, or

original: zag pa zad par byed pa ni zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa ste /
analyzed: zag pa zad par byed pa ni zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of the extinction of contaminants is the knowledge of the extinction of contaminants.

original: zad pa'i nga rgyal dang bral ba'am /
analyzed: zad pa'i nga rgyal dang bral ba'am /
translated: It is free from the pride of extinction or the pride of having something to extinguish,🔽and it is free from the knowledge of having something to extinguish.

original: zad par bya ba'i nga rgyal dang bcas pa'i shes pa dang bral ba ni zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /🔽bdag gis sam /
analyzed: zad par bya ba'i nga rgyal dang bcas pa'i shes pa dang bral ba ni zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa / bdag gis sam /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says, from the perspective of the Tathāgata,

original: gzhan dag gis thob pa 'am zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis thob pa 'am zhes bya ba la /
translated: “I have attained it” or “others have attained it.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams gzhan gyi zad pa shes pa yin no ;
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams gzhan gyi zad pa shes pa yin no ;
translated: Bodhisattvas have the knowledge of the extinction of others.

original: / de'i phyir 'og nas mngon sum du ni mi byed do zhes ston pa yin no //
analyzed: / de'i phyir 'og nas mngon sum du ni mi byed do zhes ston pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is taught below that they do not actualize it.

original: lam dang lam ma yin pa mkhyen pa yang zad pa shes pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'thob pa'i thabs kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: lam dang lam ma yin pa mkhyen pa yang zad pa shes pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'thob pa'i thabs kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the knowledge of the path and the knowledge of the absence of the path is also the knowledge of extinction, he says, “The means of attainment,” and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gzhan gyi rgyud kyi zag pa zad pa mngon sum du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen pa yin gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gzhan gyi rgyud kyi zag pa zad pa mngon sum du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen pa yin gyi /
translated: Bodhisattvas know directly and correctly the exhaustion of defilements in the mindstreams of others.

original: rang nyid kyis mngon sum du mi mdzad de /
analyzed: rang nyid kyis mngon sum du mi mdzad de /
translated: Bodhisattvas know the extinction of the contaminants in the mindstreams of others just as it is, but they do not manifest it themselves.

original: 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa rnams kyang byang chub la rjes su phan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa rnams kyang byang chub la rjes su phan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not abandon samsara, and because the afflictions are also conducive to enlightenment.

original: de'i phyir 'di skad du /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di skad du /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: khyod kyi nyon mongs byang chub rgyu ru gyur pa lags //
analyzed: khyod kyi nyon mongs byang chub rgyu ru gyur pa lags //
translated: Your afflictions become the cause of enlightenment.

original: zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is taught.

original: 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong ba nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong ba nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir / zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In order to demonstrate that they do not abandon samsara, it says:🔽They do not abandon contaminated things,

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa yang mi spong ba'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa yang mi spong ba'o //
translated: They do not abandon contaminated things and they do not abandon uncontaminated things.

original: de la zag pa dang bcas pa la spyod cing de kun nas 'phel bar byed pa dang / de dang yang dag par ldan pas gnas kyi zag pa med pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la zag pa dang bcas pa la spyod cing de kun nas 'phel bar byed pa dang / de dang yang dag par ldan pas gnas kyi zag pa med pas ni ma yin no //
translated: He practices with the outflows, and he increases them, and he dwells in association with them, but not in the nondiscursive state.

original: de la kun du spyod na yang 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal nyid kyis kyang mi gnod la /
analyzed: de la kun du spyod na yang 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal nyid kyis kyang mi gnod la /
translated: Even though he practices with them, he is not harmed by the suffering of cyclic existence.🔽Even though he has not abandoned the afflictions, he is not harmed by the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa ma spangs kyang nyon mongs pas kyang mi gnod pa'o zhes bstan pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa nyid do zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ma spangs kyang nyon mongs pas kyang mi gnod pa'o zhes bstan pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa nyid do zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: This is the non-abiding nirvana.

original: mthu thams cad kyi nang na ches mthu che ba yin te /
analyzed: mthu thams cad kyi nang na ches mthu che ba yin te /
translated: He has the greatest power of all,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is inconceivable.

original: zag pa zad pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes par byas kyang /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes par byas kyang /
translated: Even though he has understood the destruction of the outflows just as they are,

original: mngon sum du yang mi byed la /
analyzed: mngon sum du yang mi byed la /
translated: he does not manifest it,🔽and he is not defiled by cyclic existence.

original: 'khor ba na kun nas nyon @91b mongs par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni shin tu rtogs par dka' ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'khor ba na kun nas nyon @91b mongs par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni shin tu rtogs par dka' ba nyid do //
translated: This is the extreme difficulty of understanding.

original: chos kyi mthu ni sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pas bsdus pa rnam pa drug tu bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi mthu ni sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pas bsdus pa rnam pa drug tu bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: The power of Dharma should be understood as being comprised of six types, included within the perfections such as generosity.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bya ba gang yin pa de ni mthu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bya ba gang yin pa de ni mthu zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is the activity of generosity, etc. is called power.

original: nus pa'i khyad par zhes bya pa'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nus pa'i khyad par zhes bya pa'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the term is a special ability.

original: de dag re re yang rnam pa bzhi bzhi'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de dag re re yang rnam pa bzhi bzhi'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that each of these has four aspects, he says:

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i chos 'di dag gi mthu de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi bzhir rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i chos 'di dag gi mthu de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi bzhir rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The power of these dharmas such as generosity, etc. should be understood as being, in brief, of four types.

original: bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa dang / 'bras bu 'byin pa dang ; so sor rnam pa du mar 'gyur ba'i phyir mdor bsdu na zhes bya ba smras pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa dang / 'bras bu 'byin pa dang ; so sor rnam pa du mar 'gyur ba'i phyir mdor bsdu na zhes bya ba smras pa yin no //
translated: The phrase in brief is stated because of the benefit to oneself and others, the production of results, and the manifold varieties.

original: mthu de ni yang mdor na ji ltar rigs par rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud la rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mthu de ni yang mdor na ji ltar rigs par rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud la rig par bya ste /
translated: That power should be understood, in brief, in one's own and others' mental continuum, as is appropriate.

original: phan 'dogs pa'i phyogs gcig na gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa'i phyogs gcig na gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'o //
translated: One part of the beneficial is in the mental continuum of another.

original: lhag ma ni rang gi rgyud kyis bsdus pa'o ;
analyzed: lhag ma ni rang gi rgyud kyis bsdus pa'o ;
translated: The rest is included in one's own mental continuum.

original: / yang na dus kyi dbye bas rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: / yang na dus kyi dbye bas rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Or else, the four powers are established as two kinds:

original: tshe 'di pa dang / phyi ma pa'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di pa dang / phyi ma pa'o //
translated: those that occur in this life and those in future lives.

original: de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba dang / phan 'dogs pa ni mthong ba'i chos la 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba dang / phan 'dogs pa ni mthong ba'i chos la 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The abandonment of adverse elements and the beneficial occur in this life.

original: lhag ma ni phyi ma la'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni phyi ma la'o //
translated: The rest occur in future lives.

original: yang mthu rnam pa bzhi ni rnam pa gnyis su gzhag par rig par bya ste ;🔽nyes pa nges par spong ba ni dang pos so //
analyzed: yang mthu rnam pa bzhi ni rnam pa gnyis su gzhag par rig par bya ste ; nyes pa nges par spong ba ni dang pos so //
translated: Again, the four powers should be understood as established as two kinds:

original: yon tan yang dag par sgrub pa ni gsum gyis so //
analyzed: yon tan yang dag par sgrub pa ni gsum gyis so //
translated: the abandonment of faults and the accomplishment of virtues.

original: yang na mthong ba'i chos kyi 'bras bu dang / tshe phyi ma'i dbang du byas nas mthu rnam pa bzhi rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na mthong ba'i chos kyi 'bras bu dang / tshe phyi ma'i dbang du byas nas mthu rnam pa bzhi rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Or else, the four powers should be established as the result in this life and in future lives.

original: yang mthong ba'i chos kyi 'bras bu dang / 'jig rten pha rol gyi dbang du byas nas mthu rnam pa bzhi rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: yang mthong ba'i chos kyi 'bras bu dang / 'jig rten pha rol gyi dbang du byas nas mthu rnam pa bzhi rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Also, the four powers should be established in terms of the result in this life and in terms of the next world.

original: mthong ba'i chos kyi 'bras bu yang rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos kyi 'bras bu yang rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: The result in this life is also twofold.

original: dge ba'i bar du gcod pa rnams yongs su spong ba ni gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: dge ba'i bar du gcod pa rnams yongs su spong ba ni gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: The abandonment of obstacles to virtue is mentioned in the verse above with the words

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba dang zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba dang zhes pa'o //
translated: “abandoning the counteragents.”

original: yang de ni dus re zhig par rig par bya'o ;
analyzed: yang de ni dus re zhig par rig par bya'o ;
translated: And that should be understood as temporary.

original: / kha na ma tho ba med pa'i bde ba dang / yid bde ba ni gang gi phyir yang smras pa /
analyzed: / kha na ma tho ba med pa'i bde ba dang / yid bde ba ni gang gi phyir yang smras pa /
translated: The happiness and mental pleasure that are free from remorse are mentioned in the verse above with the words

original: bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: “benefiting oneself and others.”

original: tshe phyi ma'i 'bras bu rnam pa gsum gyi dbang du byas par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: tshe phyi ma'i 'bras bu rnam pa gsum gyi dbang du byas par rig par bya ste /
translated: The result in a future life should be understood in terms of three kinds.

original: gtan du rnam par spangs pa'i 'bras bu ni gang yang tshogs yongs @92a * //
analyzed: gtan du rnam par spangs pa'i 'bras bu ni gang yang tshogs yongs @92a * //
translated: The result of complete abandonment is mentioned in the verse above with the words

original: su smin par byed pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: su smin par byed pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “bringing the stores to maturity.”

original: rnam par smin pa dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni gang yang phyi ma la 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa zhes bya ba'o //🔽kun la yang khyad par gyi tshig brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni gang yang phyi ma la 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa zhes bya ba'o // kun la yang khyad par gyi tshig brjod par bya ste /
translated: The result of conscious effort is the enjoyment of morality and the enjoyment of the rite of ordination.🔽The result of separation is the abandonment of the obscurations that can be eliminated by the path of seeing.🔽The result of natural outcome and the result of separation are the same as before.🔽The result of conscious effort is the enjoyment of patience and the enjoyment of harmlessness.🔽The result of separation is the abandonment of the obscurations that can be eliminated by the path of seeing.🔽The result of natural outcome and the result of separation are the same as before.🔽The result of conscious effort is the enjoyment of effort and the enjoyment of the increase of virtues.🔽The result of separation is the abandonment of the obscurations that can be eliminated by the path of seeing.

original: rnam par spangs pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rnam par spangs pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The result of natural outcome and the result of separation are the same as before.🔽The result of conscious effort is the enjoyment of meditation and the enjoyment of the increase of virtues.🔽The result of separation is the abandonment of the obscurations that can be eliminated by the path of seeing.

original: phyi ma la 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa'i khyad par nyid dang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyi ma la 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa'i khyad par nyid dang zhes bya'o //
translated: The result of natural outcome and the result of separation are the same as before.🔽The result of conscious effort is the enjoyment of wisdom and the enjoyment of the increase of virtues.🔽The result of separation is the abandonment of the obscurations that can be eliminated by the path of seeing.🔽The result of natural outcome and the result of separation are the same as before.🔽The result of conscious effort is the enjoyment of skill in the means and the enjoyment of the increase of virtues.🔽The result of separation is the abandonment of the obscurations that can be eliminated by the path of seeing.

original: sbyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: The result of natural outcome and the result of separation are the same as before.🔽The result of conscious effort is the enjoyment of the perfections and the enjoyment of the increase of virtues.🔽The result of separation is the abandonment of the obscurations that can be eliminated by the path of seeing.

original: yang de ni ser sna ste /🔽de yod na sbyin pa la mi 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: yang de ni ser sna ste / de yod na sbyin pa la mi 'jug pa ste /
translated: The result of natural outcome and the result of separation are the same as before.

original: ser sna dang / dngos po la chags pa dang / shin tu zhen pa zhes bya ba ni khyad par te /🔽sbyin pa dang 'gal ba'i sems las byung ba kun du 'dzin pas 'di bdag dang nam yang 'bral bar ma gyur cig ces bya ba'i rnam par zhugs pa ni ser sna'o //
analyzed: ser sna dang / dngos po la chags pa dang / shin tu zhen pa zhes bya ba ni khyad par te /🔽sbyin pa dang 'gal ba'i sems las byung ba kun du 'dzin pas 'di bdag dang nam yang 'bral bar ma gyur cig ces bya ba'i rnam par zhugs pa ni ser sna'o //
translated: The result of conscious effort is the enjoyment of the factors of enlightenment and the enjoyment of the increase of virtues.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa yin na yang /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa yin na yang /
translated: And all the afflictions and subsidiary afflictions are adverse elements.

original: ser sna kho na smos pa ni /
analyzed: ser sna kho na smos pa ni /
translated: But only stinginess is mentioned

original: mngon sum du mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa nye bar bzung nas bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mngon sum du mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa nye bar bzung nas bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is the adverse element that is directly opposed to generosity.

original: de'i rnam pa dang 'bras bu phyin ci log tu 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa dang 'bras bu phyin ci log tu 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: And its form and result should be understood as perverse.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa snying rje las byung ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu la ltos pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa snying rje las byung ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu la ltos pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: The generosity of the bodhisattva, which arises from compassion, is free of the grasping of both cause and result,

original: de gnyi ga'i 'dzin pa dang bral bas tshe 'di dang pha rol du yang rgyu dang 'bras bu la ser sna spangs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i 'dzin pa dang bral bas tshe 'di dang pha rol du yang rgyu dang 'bras bu la ser sna spangs par rig par bya'o //

analyzed: byang chub kyi tshogs su gyur pa yang yin la zhes bya ba ni byang chub sdud par byed pas na byang chub kyi tshogs te /
