original: yang dag par bdag gi dbang du gyur pas ji ltar 'dod pa'i bya ba byed pa nyid dang / phyi ma la nus pa ji lta ba bzhin du theg pa rnam pa gsum la 'jug par bya ba la rgyud snod du rung bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par bdag gi dbang du gyur pas ji ltar 'dod pa'i bya ba byed pa nyid dang / phyi ma la nus pa ji lta ba bzhin du theg pa rnam pa gsum la 'jug par bya ba la rgyud snod du rung bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since one has become their master, one can make them do whatever one wishes, and in the future, one makes one's mindstream a suitable vessel for engaging in the three vehicles in accordance with one's ability.

original: de ltar mdor bstan pas bdag dang gzhan rjes su gzung ba bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar mdor bstan pas bdag dang gzhan rjes su gzung ba bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the support of self and other in brief,

original: bdag nyid gzung ba rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag nyid gzung ba rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the support of self in detail,

original: dus gsum du yid dga' zhing rab tu dga' ba dang / rab tu mgu ba mang ba nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: dus gsum du yid dga' zhing rab tu dga' ba dang / rab tu mgu ba mang ba nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: it is said, because one has much delight, joy, and satisfaction in the three times.

original: sbyor ba dang / dngos gzhi dang mjug gis bsdus pa'am /
analyzed: sbyor ba dang / dngos gzhi dang mjug gis bsdus pa'am /
translated: This is because one is included in the preparation, the actual basis, and the conclusion,

original: thog ma dang / bar dang / tha mas yang dag par bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: thog ma dang / bar dang / tha mas yang dag par bsdus pa ste /
translated: or because one is included in the beginning, the middle, and the end.

original: thog mar rnam par brtag pa la sogs pa dang bral bas rtsod pa dang bral ba'i sbyin pa las nges pa thob pa na yid dga' la /
analyzed: thog mar rnam par brtag pa la sogs pa dang bral bas rtsod pa dang bral ba'i sbyin pa las nges pa thob pa na yid dga' la /
translated: First, when one attains certainty through giving free from dispute, free from investigation, and so on, one has delight.

original: bar du dngos gzhi'i dus su rang gi rgyud la 'dod pa dang / ser sna spong ba dang / gzhan gyi rgyud la phan 'dogs pa la zhugs pa'i sgro nas byams pa thob pa'i sems dang bar byed cing /
analyzed: bar du dngos gzhi'i dus su rang gi rgyud la 'dod pa dang / ser sna spong ba dang / gzhan gyi rgyud la phan 'dogs pa la zhugs pa'i sgro nas byams pa thob pa'i sems dang bar byed cing /
translated: In the middle, at the time of the main practice, it is the mind that is made joyful by the attainment of love, which is engaged in the abandonment of greed and stinginess in one's own stream of consciousness and in the bestowal of benefit in the stream of consciousness of another.

original: mjug gi dus su ste mthar yang 'gyod par mi byed pas na 'gyod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mjug gi dus su ste mthar yang 'gyod par mi byed pas na 'gyod pa med pa'o //
translated: In the end, at the time of the conclusion, it is the absence of regret.

original: 'gyod pa med na sems dga' bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'gyod pa med na sems dga' bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: If there is no regret, the mind is made joyful by nature.

original: de lta bu'i 'gro ba rnam pa gsum sbyin bdag dang / gtong ba po la skyed pa'i phyir lan pa po la bcom ldan 'das kyi bya ba rnam pa gsum gnas te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i 'gro ba rnam pa gsum sbyin bdag dang / gtong ba po la skyed pa'i phyir lan pa po la bcom ldan 'das kyi bya ba rnam pa gsum gnas te /
translated: The Blessed Lord has three activities for the benefactor who generates these three kinds of beings, i.e., the giver, the one who gives, and the one who is made joyful.

original: bdag gir bya ba'i bya ba dang / nye bar btags pa'i bya ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba'i bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gir bya ba'i bya ba dang / nye bar btags pa'i bya ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba'i bya ba'o //
translated: They are the activity of appropriation, the activity of designation, and the activity of rejoicing.

original: gzhan dag la yang gtso bor gyur pa rnam pa gnyis kyis phan 'dogs pa rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang gtso bor gyur pa rnam pa gnyis kyis phan 'dogs pa rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the benefit to others is twofold, through the two principal activities.

original: yongs su spyod pa'i sbyin pas ni bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / nad kyi sdug bsngal sel bar byed do //
analyzed: yongs su spyod pa'i sbyin pas ni bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / nad kyi sdug bsngal sel bar byed do //
translated: The generosity of enjoyment removes the suffering of hunger, thirst, and disease.

original: de la bza' ba dang / btung ba longs spyod pas ni bkres pa dang / skom pa'i sdug bsngal sel to //
analyzed: de la bza' ba dang / btung ba longs spyod pas ni bkres pa dang / skom pa'i sdug bsngal sel to //
translated: Therein, the enjoyment of food and drink removes the suffering of hunger and thirst.

original: gos dang / khyim sbyin par byas pas ni grang ba dang tsha ba'i sdug bsngal sel te /
analyzed: gos dang / khyim sbyin par byas pas ni grang ba dang tsha ba'i sdug bsngal sel te /
translated: The giving of clothing and shelter removes the suffering of cold and heat.

original: sman dang nye bar longs spyod pa byin pas ni nad kyi sdug bsngal sel to //
analyzed: sman dang nye bar longs spyod pa byin pas ni nad kyi sdug bsngal sel to //
translated: The giving of medicine and the enjoyment of it removes the suffering of disease.

original: yongs su gtong pa'i sbyin pas ni /
analyzed: yongs su gtong pa'i sbyin pas ni /
translated: The generosity of relinquishment

original: 'dod pas phongs pa'i sdug bsngal sel bar byed pas phan 'dogs par byed de /
analyzed: 'dod pas phongs pa'i sdug bsngal sel bar byed pas phan 'dogs par byed de /
translated: is helpful because it removes the suffering of the loss of what is desired.

original: mngon par 'dod pa grub pas sems yang dag par dga' ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //🔽mi 'jigs pa'i @93a * //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa grub pas sems yang dag par dga' ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro // mi 'jigs pa'i @93a * //
translated: Because it generates a pure and joyful mind through the accomplishment of what is desired.🔽The generosity of freedom from fear

original: sbyin pas ni 'chi bas 'jigs shing skrag pa rnams sel bar byed do //
analyzed: sbyin pas ni 'chi bas 'jigs shing skrag pa rnams sel bar byed do //
translated: removes the suffering of fear of death.

original: de ltar yongs su longs spyod pa yongs su gtong ba dang / mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pas pha rol po la bde ba dang / yid bde ba skyed par byed pa'i sgo nas lus dang sems la phan 'dogs pa gsal bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yongs su longs spyod pa yongs su gtong ba dang / mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pas pha rol po la bde ba dang / yid bde ba skyed par byed pa'i sgo nas lus dang sems la phan 'dogs pa gsal bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, by the gift of enjoyment and the gift of freedom from fear, he benefits the body and mind of others by causing them to experience pleasure and mental happiness.

original: gang dang gang du skyes par zhes bya ba ni lha rnams su'am /
analyzed: gang dang gang du skyes par zhes bya ba ni lha rnams su'am /
translated: Wherever he is born means in the celestial realms,

original: mi rnams su'am /
analyzed: mi rnams su'am /
translated: in the human realm,

original: rgyal rigs la sogs pa shing s'a la chen po lta bu rnams so //
analyzed: rgyal rigs la sogs pa shing s'a la chen po lta bu rnams so //
translated: and in the great sāla tree-like royal and other such families.

original: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu chen po rnam pa gsum gyis longs spyod chen por 'gyur ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu chen po rnam pa gsum gyis longs spyod chen por 'gyur ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that he becomes one of great wealth through the three great fruits of generosity,

original: gang la longs spyod pa dang / gang dag longs spyod pa dang / gang dag gis mngon par bsgrubs pa de dag thams cad longs spyod ces byas nas so //
analyzed: gang la longs spyod pa dang / gang dag longs spyod pa dang / gang dag gis mngon par bsgrubs pa de dag thams cad longs spyod ces byas nas so //
translated: he says, “Whatever he enjoys, wherever he enjoys it, and whatever he has accomplished, all of that is enjoyed.”

original: phan 'dogs pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: From the perspective of benefiting others, he says,

original: phyug pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de'i nye bar longs spyod pa'i dngos po yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: phyug pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de'i nye bar longs spyod pa'i dngos po yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The phrase wealth and possessions refers to two kinds of objects that are used:

original: nor dang 'bru'o //
analyzed: nor dang 'bru'o //
translated: wealth and grain.

original: de dag gnyi ga bsags ba chen po dang ldan pa ni phyug pa ste /🔽ji skad du /
analyzed: de dag gnyi ga bsags ba chen po dang ldan pa ni phyug pa ste / ji skad du /
translated: One who possesses a great accumulation of both is called wealthy.

original: nor dang / 'bru dang / mdzod dang / bang mdzod mang po phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya bas bstan pa yin no //🔽nye bar longs spyod pas ni /
analyzed: nor dang / 'bru dang / mdzod dang / bang mdzod mang po phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya bas bstan pa yin no // nye bar longs spyod pas ni /
translated: This is indicated by the phrase he is endowed with abundant wealth, grain, treasures, and storehouses.

original: kha zas dang / snod spyad dang / nye bar mkho ba la sogs pa chen po dang ldan pa ni longs spyod chen po'o //
analyzed: kha zas dang / snod spyad dang / nye bar mkho ba la sogs pa chen po dang ldan pa ni longs spyod chen po'o //
translated: The phrase great possessions refers to the fact that he has a great quantity of food, drink, utensils, and other necessities.

original: des na nor dang / longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa zhes gang bstan pa yin no //🔽grogs bshes la sogs pa mang ba ni rtsa 'jing che ba bzhi'o //
analyzed: des na nor dang / longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa zhes gang bstan pa yin no // grogs bshes la sogs pa mang ba ni rtsa 'jing che ba bzhi'o //
translated: This is indicated by the phrase he is endowed with abundant possessions.🔽The phrase great friends and supporters refers to the fact that he has many friends and supporters.

original: bran po la sogs pa mang ba ni g-yog 'khor la sogs sogs pa mang bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bran po la sogs pa mang ba ni g-yog 'khor la sogs sogs pa mang bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The phrase great retinue refers to the fact that he has many servants and employees.

original: de dag gis ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu bstan to //
translated: These explain the ripened result.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: From the perspective of the result that corresponds with the cause, it says:🔽They will also be inclined to generosity.

original: sbyin pa la yang mos par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni phyi ma la yang sbyin pa la sems 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bya nas so //
analyzed: sbyin pa la yang mos par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni phyi ma la yang sbyin pa la sems 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bya nas so //
translated: This means that in the future their minds will be inclined to generosity.

original: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par rnams ni bstan pa de dag las lhag par sgrub pa'i nus pa med par smras pa /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par rnams ni bstan pa de dag las lhag par sgrub pa'i nus pa med par smras pa /
translated: The special results of generosity are explained as being beyond the power of those who do not practice generosity to achieve.

original: 'di las gong na yang med ces bya ba la sogs ba smras pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di las gong na yang med ces bya ba la sogs ba smras pa yin no //
translated: It says, “There is nothing higher than this” and so on.

original: yang tshul khrims 'chal ba ni kun nas slong ba dang bcas pa'i lus dang ngag gi nyes par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: yang tshul khrims 'chal ba ni kun nas slong ba dang bcas pa'i lus dang ngag gi nyes par spyod pa'o //
translated: Immorality is physical and verbal misconduct that is accompanied by motivation.

original: dmad pa'i tshul khrims ni 'chal pa'i @93b tshul khrims so //
analyzed: dmad pa'i tshul khrims ni 'chal pa'i @93b tshul khrims so //
translated: Morality that is despised is immoral.

original: de'i ngo bo ni tshul khrims 'chal ba nyid do //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni tshul khrims 'chal ba nyid do //
translated: The nature of that is immorality.

original: de dang ldan pa'i skyes bu ni tshul khrims 'chal pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i skyes bu ni tshul khrims 'chal pa nyid do //
translated: A person who possesses that is immoral.

original: tshul khrims ni 'dir lus dang ngag gi mnyam par spyod pa ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims ni 'dir lus dang ngag gi mnyam par spyod pa ste /
translated: Morality here is the even conduct of body and speech.

original: don de la mos pa nyid do //
analyzed: don de la mos pa nyid do //
translated: It is the very faith in that meaning.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi las ni tshul khrims don mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi las ni tshul khrims don mthun pa yin te /
translated: From among the four social practices, morality is the same objective.

original: gzhan dag tshul khrims la yang dag par gzhag par 'dod pa des bdag nyid tshul khrims la yang dag par gnas par byas pas so //
analyzed: gzhan dag tshul khrims la yang dag par gzhag par 'dod pa des bdag nyid tshul khrims la yang dag par gnas par byas pas so //
translated: By that one who desires to establish others in morality himself abides in morality.

original: de bzhin du don mthun pa gzhan dag la yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du don mthun pa gzhan dag la yang rig par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for the other social practices.

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do zhes bstan pas ni bdag dang gzhan la phan gdags pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do zhes bstan pas ni bdag dang gzhan la phan gdags pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: By the statement “he brings beings to maturity” the benefit for self and other is taught.

original: de bzhin du thams cad du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad du blta bar bya'o //
translated: And so it should be understood in all cases.

original: 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi rkyen gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi rkyen gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The condition of immorality, etc.

original: 'di la 'jigs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dgos pa ni 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la 'jigs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dgos pa ni 'jigs pa'o //
translated: Fear is the purpose here.

original: 'chal pa'i tshul khrims spangs pas de yang spong bar 'gyur pa ni bdag nyid la phan 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'chal pa'i tshul khrims spangs pas de yang spong bar 'gyur pa ni bdag nyid la phan 'dogs pa'o //
translated: The avoidance of immorality is also an avoidance of that, and that is beneficial to oneself.

original: kha na ma tho ba ni dpyas su byas pa ste /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba ni dpyas su byas pa ste /
translated: The avoidance of sin is blameless.

original: skyes bu dam pas da mad pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pas da mad pa'o //
translated: It is praised by the wise.

original: khon du 'dzin pa ni mthong ba'i chos nyid la gzhan gyis mi 'dod pa'i bya ba byed par 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: khon du 'dzin pa ni mthong ba'i chos nyid la gzhan gyis mi 'dod pa'i bya ba byed par 'brel pa'o //
translated: The avoidance of enmity is not a cause of future regret, because it is not connected with the performance of actions that are not desired by others in this very life.

original: de lta bu'i mi phan pa dang / mi bde ba yongs su spangs pa la phan pa'i don gyi sgo nas phan gdags pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i mi phan pa dang / mi bde ba yongs su spangs pa la phan pa'i don gyi sgo nas phan gdags pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The avoidance of such harm and unhappiness is beneficial, and the avoidance of that is stated to be beneficial to others.

original: da ni bde ba dang yid bde ba la gnas pas phan gdags pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: da ni bde ba dang yid bde ba la gnas pas phan gdags pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the benefit of abiding in happiness and mental pleasure, he says:

original: bde bar gnyid kyis log cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bde bar gnyid kyis log cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Having gone to sleep happily, etc.

original: tshul khrims ni lus dang sems gdung ba med par byed pa yin pas nyin dang mtshan du bde bar gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni lus dang sems gdung ba med par byed pa yin pas nyin dang mtshan du bde bar gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Morality is the cause of the absence of remorse, and the absence of remorse is the cause of mental pleasure. Therefore, it is said that one dwells happily by day and night.🔽 🔽One awakes happily because one is free from the fault of sleep.

original: de la bde bar gnyid kyis log ces bya bas ni mtshan mo gdung ba med pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: de la bde bar gnyid kyis log ces bya bas ni mtshan mo gdung ba med pa nyid bstan to //
translated: The phrase he sleeps happily indicates that he is not tormented at night.

original: bde bar sang par 'gyur zhes bya bas ni nyin mo bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bde bar sang par 'gyur zhes bya bas ni nyin mo bstan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase he awakens happily indicates that he is not tormented during the day.

original: de'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa las bstan pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa las bstan pa /
translated: Therefore, the verse states:

original: tshul khrims yang dag blangs pa bde //
analyzed: tshul khrims yang dag blangs pa bde //
translated: There is happiness in taking up morality.🔽The body is not tormented,

original: lus kyang gdung pa med pa dang // mtshan mo'ang bde bar gnyid kyis log //
analyzed: lus kyang gdung pa med pa dang // mtshan mo'ang bde bar gnyid kyis log //
translated: and he sleeps happily at night.

original: sad pa na'ang dga' bar 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sad pa na'ang dga' bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: He awakens happily.

original: tshul khrims ni ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyud pa'i rgyu yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshul khrims ni ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyud pa'i rgyu yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The verse was spoken in this way in order to show that morality is the cause of the meditative development of concentration.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase in the same way refers to the following:

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa ni 'gyod pa med par 'gyur la zhes bya ba'i @94a * //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa ni 'gyod pa med par 'gyur la zhes bya ba'i @94a * //
translated: One who possesses morality does not have regret.

original: rim gyis ting nge 'dzin 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rim gyis ting nge 'dzin 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: In due course, he attains concentration.

original: de las dben pa las skyes pa'i bde ba 'byung bar 'gyur bas de ltar na bdag nyid la phan 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de las dben pa las skyes pa'i bde ba 'byung bar 'gyur bas de ltar na bdag nyid la phan 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: Since the pleasure that arises from the seclusion that is based upon that concentration occurs, in this way, he benefits himself.

original: gzhan la phan 'dogs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan la phan 'dogs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To show that he benefits others,

original: sems can thams cad la yang zhas bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la yang zhas bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: he says, “He also gives fearlessness to all sentient beings.”

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa la ni /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa la ni /
translated: He gives fearlessness to those who possess morality.

original: gzhan dag 'dis bdag lag pa dang / dbyug pa dang / bong ba la sogs pas sam /🔽sbyor ba dang dngos gzhi dang / mjug gi dus su'am /
analyzed: gzhan dag 'dis bdag lag pa dang / dbyug pa dang / bong ba la sogs pas sam / sbyor ba dang dngos gzhi dang / mjug gi dus su'am /
translated: Others do not suspect that he will harm them with his hands, sticks, clods of earth, etc.

original: lus dang ngag gi gnod pa byed cing sdug bsngal skyed par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa skye bar mi 'gyur bas mi 'jigs pa sbyin par byed pa yang yin no //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi gnod pa byed cing sdug bsngal skyed par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa skye bar mi 'gyur bas mi 'jigs pa sbyin par byed pa yang yin no //
translated: He does not harm them with his body or speech at the time of preparation, the actual action, or the conclusion.

original: de'i phyir sbyin pa chen po ni lnga ste zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sbyin pa chen po ni lnga ste zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the great giving is fivefold.

original: tshul khrims la yang mos par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni phyi ma la ste /🔽dbang phyug chen po'i rgyus kyang /
analyzed: tshul khrims la yang mos par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni phyi ma la ste / dbang phyug chen po'i rgyus kyang /
translated: He also becomes devoted to morality.

original: 'dul dang 'gal bar 'jug mi mdzad //
analyzed: 'dul dang 'gal bar 'jug mi mdzad //
translated: He does not violate the rules of moral training even for the sake of a great lord.

original: ces bstan pas so ;
analyzed: ces bstan pas so ;
translated: As it is taught:🔽Even for the sake of a great lord🔽he does not violate the rules of moral training.

original: / mi bzod pa zhes bya ba ni gnod pa byed pa la brten nas de la khong khro ba'i rgyun 'jug par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: / mi bzod pa zhes bya ba ni gnod pa byed pa la brten nas de la khong khro ba'i rgyun 'jug par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The term intolerance refers to the continuity of anger that is based on the occurrence of harm.

original: bzod pa ni khon zhi bar byed pa yin pas gzhan dag gis gnod pa byed pa dang / 'ching bal sogs ba'i sdug bsngal mi byed pas bdag yongs su skyob par byed pa nyid do //

translated: Patience is the antidote to that. It is the protector of oneself because it prevents one from committing the wrongful actions of harming others and retaliating against their harm, etc., and because it prevents one from experiencing the suffering of the undesirable results of those actions.

analyzed: skye bo dam pa'i bzod pa'i rang bzhin go cha yis // skye bo ngan pa'i tshig gi mda' ni log gyur nas //

analyzed: de lta bu'i bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i rgyu mthun ba'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The verse states, The arrows of the words of evil beings are turned back.

original: phyi ma la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: phyi ma la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The verse states, The arrows of the words of evil beings are turned back.🔽 The verse states, The arrows of the words of evil beings

original: de la khon mang bar mi 'gyur ba ni phyi ma la dgra'i phyogs med par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de la khon mang bar mi 'gyur ba ni phyi ma la dgra'i phyogs med par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: He does not have many enemies, because in the future he will not have an enemy faction.

original: dman par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dman par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: Or else, he will be lowly.

original: 'byed pa mi mang ba ni grogs dang 'khor dang mi phyed par 'gyur ba'o //🔽de'i phyir gzhan dag gis mi 'dod pa byed par dogs pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'byed pa mi mang ba ni grogs dang 'khor dang mi phyed par 'gyur ba'o // de'i phyir gzhan dag gis mi 'dod pa byed par dogs pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: He does not have many divisions, because his friends and retinue will be inseparable.

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba mang bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba mang bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, he does not have many sorrows and sufferings, because he is not afraid that others will do what he does not want.🔽In this very life, he does not have regret, because he practices with a pure physical and verbal action, since his resentment is pacified.

original: tshe 'di nyid la yang khon du 'dzin pa rab tu zhi bas lus dang ngag gi las dpyas med pa kun du spyod pas 'gyod pa med bar 'gyur ba'o / brten pa na zhes bya ba ni byang chub pa'i dus na @94b yang brtson 'grus dang lhan cig🔽'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la yang khon du 'dzin pa rab tu zhi bas lus dang ngag gi las dpyas med pa kun du spyod pas 'gyod pa med bar 'gyur ba'o / brten pa na zhes bya ba ni byang chub pa'i dus na @94b yang brtson 'grus dang lhan cig 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: He is supported by it, because at the time of enlightenment, he engages in it together with effort.

original: byang chub thob pa'i dus na'ang brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang bcas pa yin pas de nyid kyis de thob par byed pas so //
analyzed: byang chub thob pa'i dus na'ang brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang bcas pa yin pas de nyid kyis de thob par byed pas so //
translated: At the time of attaining enlightenment, he is endowed with the practice of effort, because he attains it through that alone.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa ni gcig tu dge ba byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa ni gcig tu dge ba byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: One who has begun striving will act only in a wholesome way.

original: de rtag tu gus pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i sbyor ba nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa kun du spyod pa'i skabs med pa yin no //
analyzed: de rtag tu gus pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i sbyor ba nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa kun du spyod pa'i skabs med pa yin no //
translated: And because of his constant, uninterrupted application, he has no opportunity to indulge in the addictions.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: bde ba la reg par gnas pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bde ba la reg par gnas pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “When he is abiding in the comfort of his own mind, he is not a nuisance to others.”

original: de ltar reg par bya ba ma yin pa la gnas pa yongs su spangs pa'i phyar bdag nyid la phan 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar reg par bya ba ma yin pa la gnas pa yongs su spangs pa'i phyar bdag nyid la phan 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, by avoiding the unenjoyable, he benefits himself.

original: de ni brtson 'grus kyi sgo nas gong ma'i khyad par 'thob par 'gro ba'i dga' bas phan 'dogs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni brtson 'grus kyi sgo nas gong ma'i khyad par 'thob par 'gro ba'i dga' bas phan 'dogs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To show that he benefits others by the joy of attaining the special excellences through striving, it is said:

original: sngon las gong du dogs par zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sngon las gong du dogs par zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “He is not a nuisance to others.”

original: rgyun mi 'chad par dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i phyir gzhan dag la nye bar 'tshe ba'i skabs med pa nyid do //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i phyir gzhan dag la nye bar 'tshe ba'i skabs med pa nyid do //
translated: Because he is constantly engaged in the wholesome side, he has no opportunity to harm others.

original: de ltar nye bar 'tshe ba mi byed pa nyid kyis gzhan la phan 'dogs pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ltar nye bar 'tshe ba mi byed pa nyid kyis gzhan la phan 'dogs pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Thus, in order to demonstrate that he benefits others by not harming them,

original: rnam pa gnyi gas kyang bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa yin pa ni nye bar 'tshe bar mi byed pa dang / phan 'dogs pa la mngon sum du phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyi gas kyang bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa yin pa ni nye bar 'tshe bar mi byed pa dang / phan 'dogs pa la mngon sum du phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: he shows that he benefits both himself and others by not harming and by benefiting, because he is directly engaged in not harming and in benefiting.

original: da lta bur zhugs pa des gzhan dag kyang brtson 'grus brtsams pas 'dun pa bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da lta bur zhugs pa des gzhan dag kyang brtson 'grus brtsams pas 'dun pa bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: By engaging in this way, he causes others to generate enthusiasm for undertaking effort.

original: de lta bus kyang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bus kyang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he benefits others.

original: sngon dge ba'i chos la goms par byas pa ni rgyu'i stobs can no //
analyzed: sngon dge ba'i chos la goms par byas pa ni rgyu'i stobs can no //
translated: One who has previously cultivated virtuous qualities has the power of cause.

original: brtsams pa thams cad la spro ba mang ba nyid de /
analyzed: brtsams pa thams cad la spro ba mang ba nyid de /
translated: He has abundant enthusiasm for all undertakings.

original: skyes bu'i rtsal la mngon par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: skyes bu'i rtsal la mngon par dga' ba'o //
translated: He delights in human abilities.

original: bsam gtan gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi nyon mongs pa ni rten gyis dang / ring gi sa pa'i ma thob pa dang / thob pa las yongs su nyams pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir bsam gtan gyi nyon mongs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi nyon mongs pa ni rten gyis dang / ring gi sa pa'i ma thob pa dang / thob pa las yongs su nyams pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir bsam gtan gyi nyon mongs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: The afflictions that are adverse to the meditative development of the meditative absorptions are mentioned in terms of the adverse side of the meditative absorptions, because they are the cause for the non-acquisition of the meditative absorptions that are distant on account of the basis and the cause for the complete degeneration of that which has been acquired.

original: tshig gi rtog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽tshig gi rnam par rtog pa ni /🔽rtog pa dang dpyod pa ste /
analyzed: tshig gi rtog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / tshig gi rnam par rtog pa ni / rtog pa dang dpyod pa ste /
translated: The conceptual differentiation of verbal expression etc.🔽The conceptual differentiation of verbal expression is the affliction of the first meditative absorption.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: Conceptual differentiation refers to both applied and sustained thought.

original: dga' ba ni gnyis pa'i'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ni gnyis pa'i'o //
translated: Joy is that of the second.

original: bde ba ni gsum pa'i'o //
analyzed: bde ba ni gsum pa'i'o //
translated: Pleasure is that of the third.

original: gzugs kyi 'du shes ni bzhi ba'i'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'du shes ni bzhi ba'i'o //
translated: The ideation of form is that of the fourth.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni thogs pa'i 'du shes la sogs pa yang rig par bya'o //🔽rten du gyur pa yang yin la @95a * //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni thogs pa'i 'du shes la sogs pa yang rig par bya'o // rten du gyur pa yang yin la @95a * //
translated: The phrase 'and so on' refers to the ideation of resistance etc.🔽It is the basis for the meditative development of the path to liberation.

original: zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'jug pa ni byang chub kyi lam nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'jug pa ni byang chub kyi lam nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The path to liberation refers to the path of vision and the path of meditative development.

original: nyon mongs pa'i nyes par spyod pa spangs pa ni zhi zhing ngo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i nyes par spyod pa spangs pa ni zhi zhing ngo //
translated: The abandonment of the misdeeds of the afflictions is peace.

original: nyon mongs pa'i kun du spyod pa spangs pi ni rab tu zhi ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i kun du spyod pa spangs pi ni rab tu zhi ba'o //
translated: The abandonment of the conduct of the afflictions is complete peace.

original: de dag gi gnyen po'i phyogs thob pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid do //
analyzed: de dag gi gnyen po'i phyogs thob pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid do //
translated: The attainment of the side that is the antidote to those is freedom from attachment.

original: de ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i phyogs spangs pa dang thob pas lus dang ngag la gnod pa med cing sems rnam par mi 'khrugs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i phyogs spangs pa dang thob pas lus dang ngag la gnod pa med cing sems rnam par mi 'khrugs pa'o //
translated: Thus, by abandoning the adverse side and attaining the side that is the antidote, there is no harm to body and speech and the mind is not disturbed.

original: bsam gtan la goms par byas nas stobs kyi ye shes thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsam gtan la goms par byas nas stobs kyi ye shes thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, having become accustomed to meditative concentration, one attains the wisdom of power, it is said:

original: ye shes rnam bar dag pa dang // zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes rnam bar dag pa dang // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The purity of wisdom.

original: nye ba dang shin tu nye ba'i sbyor pas goms par byas pa'i bsam gtan gyi sbyor ba med par yang mngon par shes pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: nye ba dang shin tu nye ba'i sbyor pas goms par byas pa'i bsam gtan gyi sbyor ba med par yang mngon par shes pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, without the application of meditative concentration that is the result of repeated practice and familiarity, one attains the superknowledges, it is said:

original: mngon par shes pa mngon par bsgrubs pa dang // zhes bya ba la ji skad du /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa mngon par bsgrubs pa dang // zhes bya ba la ji skad du /
translated: Here, it is said:🔽“By the attainment of freedom from attachment, they are attained.”

original: goms par 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid kyis zhes bstan pas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid kyis thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: goms par 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid kyis zhes bstan pas 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid kyis thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, they are attained by freedom from attachment.🔽After dying from here, they are born in the form and formless realms.

original: 'di nas shi nas gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su skye'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: 'di nas shi nas gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su skye'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to teach this, he says:

original: rnam bar dag pa'i lhar zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam bar dag pa'i lhar zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the pure gods.

original: lha ni gsum ste /
analyzed: lha ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of gods:

original: tha snyad kyi lha dang / skyes pas thob pa'i lha dang / rnam par dag pa'i lha'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi lha dang / skyes pas thob pa'i lha dang / rnam par dag pa'i lha'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: gods by convention, gods by birth, and pure gods.

original: de la rnam par dag pa'i lha ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na kun du spyod pa dang / dgra bcom pa ste /
analyzed: de la rnam par dag pa'i lha ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na kun du spyod pa dang / dgra bcom pa ste /
translated: Among them, the pure gods are those who experience the form and formless realms and the arhats.

original: rten gyis pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rten gyis pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du'o //
translated: This is because they have abandoned the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation and because they have abandoned all afflictions, respectively.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs dang lam thams cad ni shes rab kyis yongs su gzung ba nyid do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs dang lam thams cad ni shes rab kyis yongs su gzung ba nyid do //
translated: The entire host and path of the bodhisattva is held by wisdom.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: sbyin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “Generosity and so on are held by wisdom.”

original: gang gi tshe shes rab yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa na bzhi po yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes rab yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa na bzhi po yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When wisdom is perfected, the four perfections are perfected.

original: kun du rmongs pa'i sdug bsngal dang bral bar gyur cing /
analyzed: kun du rmongs pa'i sdug bsngal dang bral bar gyur cing /
translated: One becomes free from the suffering of confusion,

original: shes bya'i dngos po don ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba rgya chen po mang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes bya'i dngos po don ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba rgya chen po mang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and one has the joy and supreme joy of discerning the object of knowledge just as it is.

original: des na 'di dang pa rol thams cad du bdag nyid la phan btags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'di dang pa rol thams cad du bdag nyid la phan btags par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, one benefits oneself in this and all future lives.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: tshe 'di dang @95b phyi ma la phan pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshe 'di dang @95b phyi ma la phan pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Beneficial in this life and the next.”

original: tshe 'di la ni rigs pa nye bar bstan pas bde bar phan 'dogs par byed do //
analyzed: tshe 'di la ni rigs pa nye bar bstan pas bde bar phan 'dogs par byed do //
translated: In this life, one benefits by being happy through the teaching of reason.

original: skye ba gzhan la ni rigs pa nye bar bstan pas phan pa dang bde ba dag bsgrub ste /
analyzed: skye ba gzhan la ni rigs pa nye bar bstan pas phan pa dang bde ba dag bsgrub ste /
translated: In other lives, he accomplishes benefit and happiness by teaching the rational🔽method.

original: dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro ba ni shes rab yin par smras pa /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro ba ni shes rab yin par smras pa /
translated: It was said that wisdom is the forerunner of all good qualities.

original: des dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: des dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “By it, all the roots of virtue are increased.”

original: shes rab kyi stobs kyis ni sangs rgyas nyid kyang 'thob bo zhes bya bar smras pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi stobs kyis ni sangs rgyas nyid kyang 'thob bo zhes bya bar smras pa /
translated: It was said that by the power of wisdom, even buddhahood is attained.

original: phyi ma la yang sgrib pa rnam pa gnyis dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ma la yang sgrib pa rnam pa gnyis dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “In the future, the two obscurations are removed.”

original: ji skad bstan pa'i bsod nams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la gnas pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byin gyi rlabs gang yin pa de ni lhan cig skyes pa'i mthu yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i bsod nams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la gnas pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byin gyi rlabs gang yin pa de ni lhan cig skyes pa'i mthu yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The power of the buddhas and bodhisattvas that is based on the maturation of the results of the previously explained merits is to be understood as the innate power.

original: yang de ni rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud dag la bya ba byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang de ni rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud dag la bya ba byed par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, that power acts in one’s own and others’ mind streams.

original: bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it benefits oneself and others.

original: yang de ni gnas skabs gsum du rnam par gzhag par bya'o //🔽sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ci rigs par bya ste /
analyzed: yang de ni gnas skabs gsum du rnam par gzhag par bya'o // sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ci rigs par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, it is to be established in three states:🔽in the state of cause, in the state of effect, and in the state of activity which benefits sentient beings.🔽The bodhisattva's recollection of former rebirths is of two kinds: natural and through prayer.🔽The natural recollection of former rebirths is the bodhisattva's natural ability to recall former rebirths.

original: rgyu'i gnas skabs dang / 'bras bu'i gnas skabs dang sems can rnams la phan pa byed pa'i bya ba'i gnas skabs so //🔽smon lam dang las kyi bye brag gis sbyangs pa med bzhin du yang 'das pa'i skye ba'i gnas rjes su dran pa ni rang bzhin gyis tshe rabs dgongs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i gnas skabs dang / 'bras bu'i gnas skabs dang sems can rnams la phan pa byed pa'i bya ba'i gnas skabs so // smon lam dang las kyi bye brag gis sbyangs pa med bzhin du yang 'das pa'i skye ba'i gnas rjes su dran pa ni rang bzhin gyis tshe rabs dgongs pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: mthun pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i sems can rnams la yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir de yang mthu zhes bya'o //

original: de'i phyir gtso bor gyur pa'i bsod nams kyi las kyis der skye bar 'gyur zhing skyes par rgyur nas kyang gnas der skyes pa'i so sor nges pa tshe'i tshad la ltos pa med par shin tu nges pa'i gnas skabs kyis tshe'i tshad ji srid par der gnas pa

translated: Therefore, they are born there through the power of meritorious karma and, having been born there, they remain there for the duration of their lives, without regard to the lifespan of those born there, through the power of their own definite state.

analyzed: de nas 'grib par brtson pa na 'dir bltam par 'gyur te /
