original: dge ba'i chos kyi sa bon yod na zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i sa bon yin par dgongs so //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos kyi sa bon yod na zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i sa bon yin par dgongs so //
translated: If there is a seed of virtue means that here the seed of supramundane virtue is intended.

original: de dag ni 'khor ba dang ; mi dge ba'i gnyen po yin pa nyid kyis kha na ma tho ba med ba'i dge bar gtogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dag ni 'khor ba dang ; mi dge ba'i gnyen po yin pa nyid kyis kha na ma tho ba med ba'i dge bar gtogs pa nyid do //
translated: They are included in the wholesome because they are the antidote to samsara and nonvirtue.

original: 'di dag gis ni yongs su smin pa'i rgyu bstan to //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni yongs su smin pa'i rgyu bstan to //
translated: These are the causes of complete maturation.

original: bsten pa'i rgyus zhes bya ba ni chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i sbyor ba kun du bsten pas /
analyzed: bsten pa'i rgyus zhes bya ba ni chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i sbyor ba kun du bsten pas /
translated: The cause of reliance is the practice of the small, medium, and great stages of the path.

original: kun du bsten pa dang / bsgom pa dang / mang du bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gsum dang sbyar bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: kun du bsten pa dang / bsgom pa dang / mang du bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gsum dang sbyar bar bya ba'am /
translated: The three phrases “reliance, cultivation, and frequent practice” should be applied to each of the three stages.

original: thog ma dang / bar dang / tha ma'i gnas skabs te /
analyzed: thog ma dang / bar dang / tha ma'i gnas skabs te /
translated: Or, they are the beginning, middle, and final stages.

original: de lta bu'i rkyen thob nas yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rkyen thob nas yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Having obtained such conditions, one should practice.

original: rang gi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To indicate their essential nature, it says:🔽The cause of reliance is the three stages of the path: small, medium, and great.

original: rnam par dag pa dang mthun pa'i lus dang sems las su rung pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa dang mthun pa'i lus dang sems las su rung pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: and the fitness of body and mind that is conducive to purification.

original: @99a * // ji skad bstan pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rgyu dang rkyen thob nas phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid can gyi ming dang gzugs kyi rgyud yongs su gyur pa'i bye brag ni yongs su smin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: @99a * // ji skad bstan pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rgyu dang rkyen thob nas phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid can gyi ming dang gzugs kyi rgyud yongs su gyur pa'i bye brag ni yongs su smin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Having obtained the causes and conditions that have the characteristics that have been presented, the transformation of the continuum of name-and-form that has the characteristics of the five aggregates is called “maturation.”

original: bye brag bstan pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa dang mthun pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bye brag bstan pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa dang mthun pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In order to demonstrate the distinction, he says, “that is conducive to purification.”

original: nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba 'thob pa dang / rjes su mthun par ji ltar rigs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba 'thob pa dang / rjes su mthun par ji ltar rigs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is conducive to the attainment of liberation from the obscurations of affliction and the knowable. The meaning of “as is appropriate” is that it is conducive to the attainment of liberation from the obscurations of affliction and the knowable.

original: spong bar bzod pa'i lus gang yin ba'i lus las su rung ba nyid ni lus nyams bde ba'o //
analyzed: spong bar bzod pa'i lus gang yin ba'i lus las su rung ba nyid ni lus nyams bde ba'o //
translated: The fitness of body that is conducive to the abandonment of the obscurations of affliction is the comfort of the body.

original: sgom pa bzod pa'i sems las su rung ba gang yin pa ni sems nyams bde ba'o//
analyzed: sgom pa bzod pa'i sems las su rung ba gang yin pa ni sems nyams bde ba'o//
translated: The fitness of mind that is conducive to the abandonment of the obscurations of the knowable is the comfort of the mind.

original: de dag gi rgyud bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de dag gi rgyud bstan pa ni /
translated: The continuum of those two is taught.

original: yang dag pa'i sbyor ba mthar phyin pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i sbyor ba mthar phyin pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The culmination of correct application.

original: tshogs kyi lam gyis bsdus pa'i yang dag pa'i sbyor ba'i tha ma bdag gi lus yongs su rdzogs par grub pa ni mthar phyin pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs kyi lam gyis bsdus pa'i yang dag pa'i sbyor ba'i tha ma bdag gi lus yongs su rdzogs par grub pa ni mthar phyin pa'o //
translated: The culmination of correct application included in the path of accumulation is the completion of the formation of one's own body.

original: de ni rnam par dag pa'i sbyor ba'i mthar thug pa yin pas las su rung ba'o ;
analyzed: de ni rnam par dag pa'i sbyor ba'i mthar thug pa yin pas las su rung ba'o ;
translated: That is the culmination of the application of purification, and so it is fitness.

original: / de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: / de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: de la gnas na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la gnas na zhes bya ba la /
translated: Dwelling in that,🔽whether encountering a teacher or not,

original: ston pa dang phrad kyang rung zhes bya ba ni nyan thos rnams so //
analyzed: ston pa dang phrad kyang rung zhes bya ba ni nyan thos rnams so //
translated: means whether encountering the sravakas or not.

original: ston pa dang ma phrad kyang rung zhes bya ba ni rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
analyzed: ston pa dang ma phrad kyang rung zhes bya ba ni rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
translated: Whether encountering a teacher or not means whether encountering pratyekabuddhas and bodhisattvas or not.

original: de'i mod la zhes bya ba ni skye ba de nyid do //
analyzed: de'i mod la zhes bya ba ni skye ba de nyid do //
translated: At that very moment means in that very birth.

original: de bzhin du bdag gi lus kyi tha ma la theg pa gsum gyi sgo nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thob pa la rjes su mthun pa'i lus dang / sems kyi rgyud yongs su gyur pa'i bye brag ni yongs su smin pa'i ngo bo yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag gi lus kyi tha ma la theg pa gsum gyi sgo nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thob pa la rjes su mthun pa'i lus dang / sems kyi rgyud yongs su gyur pa'i bye brag ni yongs su smin pa'i ngo bo yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, the final body of the bodhisattva is the basis for the attainment of the supramundane perfections through the three vehicles. The transformation of the continuum of body and mind is the nature of complete maturation.

original: 'jig rten la grags pa'i yongs su smin pa'i dngos po rnams kyi chos mthun pa'i dpe nye bar bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: 'jig rten la grags pa'i yongs su smin pa'i dngos po rnams kyi chos mthun pa'i dpe nye bar bsgrubs nas /
translated: Having established the analogy of the things that are completely matured in the world,

original: dpe rnam pa gsum gyis don gyi bye brag gsum rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dpe rnam pa gsum gyis don gyi bye brag gsum rig par bya'o //
translated: one should understand the three varieties of the object through three examples.

original: rma'i nad ni gang gi tshe brtol nas btsir du rung ba de'i tshe yongs su smin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rma'i nad ni gang gi tshe brtol nas btsir du rung ba de'i tshe yongs su smin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: A boil is said to be completely matured when it is ready to be lanced and drained.

original: de bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams kyang bsal zhing spang du rung bar gnas par gyur pa ni yongs su smin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams kyang bsal zhing spang du rung bar gnas par gyur pa ni yongs su smin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Likewise, afflicted things are said to be completely matured when they are ready to be removed and abandoned.

original: sa'i rang bzhin gyi snod ni gang gi tshe las kyi bya ba yongs su rdzogs nas spyad la rag par sbyor ba mthar thug par gyur pa'i tshe nye bar spyod pa'i 'os yin pas de'i tshe tshos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa'i rang bzhin gyi snod ni gang gi tshe las kyi bya ba yongs su rdzogs nas spyad la rag par sbyor ba mthar thug par gyur pa'i tshe nye bar spyod pa'i 'os yin pas de'i tshe tshos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The vessel which is the nature of earth is fit to be used when the action of the potter is completed and the preparation of the vessel is finished; then it is called “ripe”.

original: de bzhin du yang dag pa'i sbyor ba'i mthar thug pa'i @99b gnas skabs thob pa'i lus dang sems dag ni yongs su smin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag pa'i sbyor ba'i mthar thug pa'i @99b gnas skabs thob pa'i lus dang sems dag ni yongs su smin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the body and mind which have attained the state of the completion of right preparation are called “matured”.

original: aa mra la sogs pa'i 'bras bu ni gang gi tshe ro khyad par du 'phags pa so sor thob par gyur pa na yongs su smin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: aa mra la sogs pa'i 'bras bu ni gang gi tshe ro khyad par du 'phags pa so sor thob par gyur pa na yongs su smin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The fruit of the mango, etc. is called “ripe” when it has attained the special taste.

original: de bzhin du rnam par grol ba'i bde ba so sor myong bar rung ba'i lus dang sems kyi gnas skabs thob pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par grol ba'i bde ba so sor myong bar rung ba'i lus dang sems kyi gnas skabs thob pa ni /
translated: Similarly, the body and mind which have attained the state of being fit for the experience of the bliss of liberation

original: yongs su smin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su smin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: are called “matured”.

original: dpe gsum po 'di dag gis ni spang bar bya ba 'thob pa la rjes su mthun pa'i lus dang / sems kyi gnas skabs dang / 'phags pa'i lam 'thob pa la rjes su mthun pa'i ngo bo ni yongs su smin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dpe gsum po 'di dag gis ni spang bar bya ba 'thob pa la rjes su mthun pa'i lus dang / sems kyi gnas skabs dang / 'phags pa'i lam 'thob pa la rjes su mthun pa'i ngo bo ni yongs su smin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: These three similes show that the state of body and mind that is favorable to the attainment of what is to be relinquished, and the nature that is favorable to the attainment of the noble path, is called maturity.

original: sgrub pa dang 'bras bu'i dbye bas gang zag bzhi zhes brjod do //
analyzed: sgrub pa dang 'bras bu'i dbye bas gang zag bzhi zhes brjod do //
translated: The four kinds of person are mentioned in terms of the classification of practice and result.

original: re re la yang dbye ba dpag tu med pa yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: re re la yang dbye ba dpag tu med pa yod pa'i phyir /
translated: But each of these is also immeasurable in terms of its subdivisions.

original: mdor bsdu na zhes bya ba la 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i nyan thos kyi lam ni nyan thos kyi theg pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na zhes bya ba la 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i nyan thos kyi lam ni nyan thos kyi theg pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In brief, the path of the śrāvaka together with its result is called the śrāvaka vehicle.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / theg pa chen po yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / theg pa chen po yang de bzhin te /
translated: The pratyekabuddha vehicle and the universal vehicle are also like this.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi lam dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam zhes bya ba yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi lam dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam zhes bya ba yang rig par bya'o //
translated: The path of the pratyekabuddha and the path of the bodhisattva should also be understood in the same way.

original: khams gsum du bde 'gror 'gro bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gyi mngon par mtho ba'i phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khams gsum du bde 'gror 'gro bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gyi mngon par mtho ba'i phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In order to go to good destinies in the three realms means in order to attain the excellence of high status in the three realms.

original: dngos po'i dbye ba nyid dang / rnam par dbye ba ni rnam pa drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i dbye ba nyid dang / rnam par dbye ba ni rnam pa drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: The classification of entities is sixfold.

original: dngos po'i dbye ba yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dngos po'i dbye ba yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The classification of entities is threefold.

original: so sor chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i dbye bas rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: so sor chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i dbye bas rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: It is established by the classification of small, medium, and great.

original: de la dbang po yongs su smin pa ni /
analyzed: de la dbang po yongs su smin pa ni /
translated: Among them, the full maturation of faculties is

original: dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus kyi rten te /
analyzed: dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus kyi rten te /
translated: the support of the body with faculties.

original: bdag gi lus zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag gi lus zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means one's own body.

original: yang dbang po yongs su smin pa de yon tan rnam pa brgyad dang ldan par bstan pa'i phyir dang / rnam pa thams cad du rnam par dag pa 'thob pa la rjes su mthun pa'i rten yongs su smin pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: yang dbang po yongs su smin pa de yon tan rnam pa brgyad dang ldan par bstan pa'i phyir dang / rnam pa thams cad du rnam par dag pa 'thob pa la rjes su mthun pa'i rten yongs su smin pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: Moreover, in order to show that the full maturation of faculties has eight qualities, and in order to attain complete purity, the full maturation of faculties is considered to be a suitable support.

original: de lta na yang nyan thos la sogs pa kha cig ni mdog phun sum tshogs pa la sogs pa med par yang yongs su smin par 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: de lta na yang nyan thos la sogs pa kha cig ni mdog phun sum tshogs pa la sogs pa med par yang yongs su smin par 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: However, some śrāvakas, etc. are fully matured even without the perfection of complexion, etc.

original: tshe phun sum tshogs pa ni mngon par 'phags pa'i tshe mang du 'jug pa nyid dang / rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug pa'i phyir gang gi tshe ring po dang / dus ring por gnas pa zhes brjod pa'o//
analyzed: tshe phun sum tshogs pa ni mngon par 'phags pa'i tshe mang du 'jug pa nyid dang / rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug pa'i phyir gang gi tshe ring po dang / dus ring por gnas pa zhes brjod pa'o//
translated: The perfection of life is the long life that is superior, because it is life that lasts a long time and continues for a long time.

original: @100a * // srid pa tha ma thams cad la bar ma dor 'chi ba ni med do zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: @100a * // srid pa tha ma thams cad la bar ma dor 'chi ba ni med do zhes byas nas so //
translated: It is said that all those in their last existence do not die in the interim.

original: de bzhin du dbang po'i rten khyad par can thob pa la dbang po yongs su smin pa zhes brjod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang po'i rten khyad par can thob pa la dbang po yongs su smin pa zhes brjod par 'gyur te /
translated: Similarly, the perfection of the faculties is said to be the attainment of a special support for the faculties.

original: de yod par gyur na dbang po yun ring du gnas par 'gyur bas so zhes byas nas sa //
analyzed: de yod par gyur na dbang po yun ring du gnas par 'gyur bas so zhes byas nas sa //
translated: When that exists, the faculties last a long time.

original: mdog phun sum tshogs pa ni dbang po la brten pa'i gzugs gang yin pa'i dbyibs su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mdog phun sum tshogs pa ni dbang po la brten pa'i gzugs gang yin pa'i dbyibs su rig par bya'o //
translated: The perfection of complexion should be understood as the shape of the form that is the support for the faculties.

original: rigs phun sum tshogs pa ni rigs mthon po rnams su skye ba gzung bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: rigs phun sum tshogs pa ni rigs mthon po rnams su skye ba gzung bar gyur pa ste /
translated: The excellence of lineage is the taking up of birth in high families.

original: rigs chen po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rigs chen po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “great family” is the same as “high family.”

original: longs spyod dang / bdag gi phyogs dang 'khor chen po dang ldan pa ni dbang phyug phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod dang / bdag gi phyogs dang 'khor chen po dang ldan pa ni dbang phyug phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The excellence of power is the possession of great wealth, great retinue, and great influence.

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin byed pa'i phyir tshig btsun pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin byed pa'i phyir tshig btsun pa'o //
translated: The excellence of speech is the possession of pure speech, which is the ability to speak in a way that is pleasing to others.🔽The excellence of action is the possession of a body that is an instrument of virtue, which is the ability to perform only virtuous actions.🔽The excellence of birth is the possession of a male body, which is the ability to be born as a male.🔽The excellence of life is the possession of a long life, which is the ability to live a long time.🔽The excellence of power is the possession of great power, which is the ability to have great power.🔽The excellence of resources is the possession of great wealth, which is the ability to have great wealth.🔽The excellence of intention is the possession of a virtuous mind, which is the ability to have a virtuous mind.🔽The excellence of wisdom is the possession of great wisdom, which is the ability to have great wisdom.

original: bzo dang rig pa'i gnas thams cad la mkhas pa'i grags pa thob pas dbang che bar grags pa'o //
analyzed: bzo dang rig pa'i gnas thams cad la mkhas pa'i grags pa thob pas dbang che bar grags pa'o //
translated: The excellence of lineage is the possession of a high family, which is the ability to be born in a high family.🔽The excellence of power is the possession of great power, which is the ability to have great power.🔽The excellence of resources is the possession of great wealth, which is the ability to have great wealth.🔽The excellence of intention is the possession of a virtuous mind, which is the ability to have a virtuous mind.🔽The excellence of wisdom is the possession of great wisdom, which is the ability to have great wisdom.🔽The excellence of lineage is the possession of a high family, which is the ability to be born in a high family.🔽The excellence of power is the possession of great power, which is the ability to have great power.🔽The excellence of resources is the possession of great wealth, which is the ability to have great wealth.

original: bud med dang / skyes pa'i dbang po dang rab tu ldan pa'i phyir mi nyid dang / stobs phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir spro ba che ba nyid de /🔽gang gi lus kyi stobs dang brtan pa dang ldan pas rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin mngon sum du mdzad nas zag pa thams cad zad pa yongs su mkhyen pa thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bud med dang / skyes pa'i dbang po dang rab tu ldan pa'i phyir mi nyid dang / stobs phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir spro ba che ba nyid de /🔽gang gi lus kyi stobs dang brtan pa dang ldan pas rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin mngon sum du mdzad nas zag pa thams cad zad pa yongs su mkhyen pa thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The excellence of intention is the possession of a virtuous mind, which is the ability to have a virtuous mind.🔽The excellence of wisdom is the possession of great wisdom, which is the ability to have great wisdom.

original: de dag gis ni rten du gtogs pa'i rnam par smin pa'i bye brag 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis ni rten du gtogs pa'i rnam par smin pa'i bye brag 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: He says this in order to show that one obtains a special evolutionary effect that is included in the life-stream.

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa'i lus de la brten nas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa'i lus de la brten nas zhes bya ba la /
translated: The evolutionary effect is the body that is the basis for the perfection of the evolutionary effect.

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bus bsdus pa'i rten phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bus bsdus pa'i rten phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is the perfection of the basis that is included in the evolutionary effect.

original: brtul ba ni spong ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i lus dang sems kyi gnas skabs su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: brtul ba ni spong ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i lus dang sems kyi gnas skabs su rig par bya ste /
translated: The term “effort” should be understood as a state of body and mind that is conducive to abandonment.

original: gang gis 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus nye bar bzung nas go rims bzhin du spong ba la dga' ba dang / spong ba la dga' ba nyid dang / spong ba la dga' bar gyur pa ni rnal 'byor dang ldan pas gnas pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gang gis 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus nye bar bzung nas go rims bzhin du spong ba la dga' ba dang / spong ba la dga' ba nyid dang / spong ba la dga' bar gyur pa ni rnal 'byor dang ldan pas gnas pa zhes brjod do //
translated: One who delights in abandonment, delights in abandonment, and delights in abandonment in the past, future, and present, respectively, is said to be “endowed with yoga and abides in it.”

original: dge ba'i chos bsgom pa la sbyor ba ni rjes su sbyor ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos bsgom pa la sbyor ba ni rjes su sbyor ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The term “application” means the application to the cultivation of virtuous qualities.

original: dus gsum po nyid kyi dbang du byas nas rnal 'byor la dga' ba dang / rnal 'byor la dga' ba nyid dang / rnal 'byor la dga' bar gyur pa nyid ni rnal 'byor @100b gyi rjes su mthun pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dus gsum po nyid kyi dbang du byas nas rnal 'byor la dga' ba dang / rnal 'byor la dga' ba nyid dang / rnal 'byor la dga' bar gyur pa nyid ni rnal 'byor @100b gyi rjes su mthun pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The one who is devoted to yoga, who is devoted to yoga itself, and who is devoted to yoga in the three times is called the one who is suitable for yoga.

original: yid yongs su skyo bar mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni spong ba dang / sgom pa la dga' ba dang ldan pas bzo dang rig pa'i gnas thams cad la goms par byed pa na lus ngal ba med pa dang / sems la gnod pa med pa dang /
analyzed: yid yongs su skyo bar mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni spong ba dang / sgom pa la dga' ba dang ldan pas bzo dang rig pa'i gnas thams cad la goms par byed pa na lus ngal ba med pa dang / sems la gnod pa med pa dang /
translated: The one who is not mentally weary is the one who is endowed with delight in renunciation and meditation. When he cultivates all the arts and sciences, he is without physical fatigue and without mental distress.

original: dran pa brjed pa med pa yin no zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: dran pa brjed pa med pa yin no zhes byas nas so //
translated: He is without loss of mindfulness.

original: nyon mongs pa chung ba ni nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa chung ba ni nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i gnas skabs so //
translated: The one with little defilement is the one in the stage of little defilement.

original: de'i bag chags kyang gnas skabs nyid kyis bsdus pa las ni nyon mongs pa mang por 'gyur ba las gsum gyi chung ngu'i chung ngus bsdus pa nyid kun du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bag chags kyang gnas skabs nyid kyis bsdus pa las ni nyon mongs pa mang por 'gyur ba las gsum gyi chung ngu'i chung ngus bsdus pa nyid kun du spyod pa'o //
translated: The one with much defilement is the one in the stage of much defilement. The one who is endowed with the three actions of little defilement is the one who is endowed with the three actions of little defilement. The one who is endowed with the three actions of much defilement is the one who is endowed with the three actions of much defilement. The one who is endowed with the three actions of medium defilement is the one who is endowed with the three actions of medium defilement.

original: thams cad kyi thams cad du nyes par spyod pa la 'jug pa'i nyon mongs pa la kun du mi spyod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad du nyes par spyod pa la 'jug pa'i nyon mongs pa la kun du mi spyod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that he never engages in the afflictions that cause one to engage in misdeeds, it says:🔽He does not engage in evil, nonvirtuous dharmas by nature.

original: de rang bzhin gyis sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams la sems mi 'jug cing zhes bya ba la phyi ma la mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu ster ba'i phyir dang / tshe 'di la gzhan la gnod pa byed pa la zhugs pa'i phyir dang / dam pa rnams kyis dmad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de rang bzhin gyis sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams la sems mi 'jug cing zhes bya ba la phyi ma la mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu ster ba'i phyir dang / tshe 'di la gzhan la gnod pa byed pa la zhugs pa'i phyir dang / dam pa rnams kyis dmad pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they give rise to undesirable effects in the future, because they are engaged in harming others in this life, and because they are despised by the holy,

original: nyes par spyod pa la sdig pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa la sdig pa zhes brjod de /
translated: misdeeds are called “evil.”

original: de la bsam pa yang 'jug par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: de la bsam pa yang 'jug par mi 'gyur na /
translated: If one does not engage in them even in thought,

original: sbyor bar lta ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: sbyor bar lta ga la 'gyur /
translated: how could one engage in them in action?

original: de ltar sbyor ba'i lam la sgrub par byed pa'i dus na yang /
analyzed: de ltar sbyor ba'i lam la sgrub par byed pa'i dus na yang /
translated: Thus, when one is practicing on the path of application,

original: nyon mongs pa'i bar chad las grol bar bstan nas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bar chad las grol bar bstan nas /
translated: having been taught how to be free from the obstacles of the afflictions,

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi sbyor ba'i dus kyi dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi sbyor ba'i dus kyi dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: in terms of the time of the application of samādhi, it says:

original: sgrib pa chung ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sgrib pa chung ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Having little obscuration and so on.

original: sgrib pa dang / rtog pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi mi mthun pa yin pas nyon mongs pa chung ba nyid ni gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa'i snod yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: sgrib pa dang / rtog pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi mi mthun pa yin pas nyon mongs pa chung ba nyid ni gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa'i snod yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Since obscuration and discursiveness are adverse to meditative concentration, it is said that having little defilement is the vessel for instruction and teaching.

original: de la bsam pas nan tan byed pa ni dran zhing ngo //🔽sbyor bas nan tan byed pa ni /
analyzed: de la bsam pas nan tan byed pa ni dran zhing ngo // sbyor bas nan tan byed pa ni /
translated: Here, making effort through reflection is remembering and understanding.

original: mthun par 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mthun par 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Making effort through application is holding in agreement.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa'i lung gi chos dang / rtogs pa'i chos la bya ba rnam pa gsum byed pa'i shes rab ni ye shes so zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa'i lung gi chos dang / rtogs pa'i chos la bya ba rnam pa gsum byed pa'i shes rab ni ye shes so zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that wisdom is the knowledge of the three activities with regard to the Dharma of scripture and the Dharma of realization taught by the Tathagata, it is said:

original: dran pa dang ldan pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dran pa dang ldan pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Endowed with mindfulness and so on.

original: byas nas ring du lon pa dang / smras nas ring du lon pa dran par byed pa gang yin pa ni dran pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: byas nas ring du lon pa dang / smras nas ring du lon pa dran par byed pa gang yin pa ni dran pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: One who remembers what was done a long time ago and what was said a long time ago is endowed with mindfulness.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i mdo sde sogs pa'i chos mang po @101a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i mdo sde sogs pa'i chos mang po @101a * //
translated: The sutras and other teachings spoken by the Tathagata are numerous.🔽

original: rnams myur du 'dzin par nus pa ni yid gzhungs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnams myur du 'dzin par nus pa ni yid gzhungs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The ability to quickly grasp the many teachings of the sutras and so forth spoken by the Tathagata is called mental acuity.

original: so sor rab tu 'byed par nus pa'i shas rab dang ldan pa'i phyir kun shes par bya bar nus pa yin no //
analyzed: so sor rab tu 'byed par nus pa'i shas rab dang ldan pa'i phyir kun shes par bya bar nus pa yin no //
translated: Because one possesses the wisdom that is able to discern each thing, one is able to understand everything.

original: gsum po nyid kyi bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gsum po nyid kyi bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the function of the three,🔽it is said:

original: blang bar bya ba dang / gzung bar bya ba dang ; rab tu rtogs par bya ba zhes bya ba rnams dang / ji ltar rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: blang bar bya ba dang / gzung bar bya ba dang ; rab tu rtogs par bya ba zhes bya ba rnams dang / ji ltar rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: that which is to be taken up, that which is to be grasped, and that which is to be fully understood, as is appropriate.

original: de dag thams cad kyang rnam par grol ba yongs su smin par byed pa'i shes rab dang yang dag par ldan par 'di dag thams cad 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang rnam par grol ba yongs su smin par byed pa'i shes rab dang yang dag par ldan par 'di dag thams cad 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that all of these are endowed with the wisdom that brings about the full maturation of liberation, it is said:

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The wisdom that is innate, and so forth.

original: thams cad nas zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i'o //
analyzed: thams cad nas zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i'o //
translated: Everything refers to the three realms.

original: gtan du zhes bya ba ni yang sgrib par mi 'gyur ba'i sbyor bas so //
analyzed: gtan du zhes bya ba ni yang sgrib par mi 'gyur ba'i sbyor bas so //
translated: Permanently means that they are not obscured again by the obscurations of the three kinds of full attainment.

original: yang mi nyung mi mang bar dngos po rnam pa gsum kho na yongs su smin par gang gi phyir bstan zhe na /
analyzed: yang mi nyung mi mang bar dngos po rnam pa gsum kho na yongs su smin par gang gi phyir bstan zhe na /
translated: Why are only three kinds of full attainment taught, neither less nor more?

original: de'i phyir smras pa ;
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa ;
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The obscurations to full attainment are the three kinds of full attainment.

original: 'phags pa'i lam dang / de la rab tu sbyor ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi mi mthun par 'gyur ba'i sgrib pa rnam pa gsum gyi gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa rnam pa gsum nyid la yongs su smin pa zhes bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam dang / de la rab tu sbyor ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi mi mthun par 'gyur ba'i sgrib pa rnam pa gsum gyi gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa rnam pa gsum nyid la yongs su smin pa zhes bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The three kinds of full attainment are the antidotes to the three kinds of obscurations that are adverse to the noble path and the roots of virtue that are applied to it.

original: de la rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa ni ngan song gsum dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams te /
analyzed: de la rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa ni ngan song gsum dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams te /
translated: The obscurations to full attainment are the three lower miserable destinies, Uttarakuru, and the beings devoid of discernment.

original: de dag tu skyes pa rnams la dbang po yongs su smin pa rnam pa brgyad po 'di dag shin tu rnyed par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag tu skyes pa rnams la dbang po yongs su smin pa rnam pa brgyad po 'di dag shin tu rnyed par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is very difficult for those born in those realms to obtain the eight fully ripened faculties.

original: nyon mongs pa chung ba'i phyir gzhan dag la brten nas kyang srog gcod pa'i las la sogs pa'i gnas skabs la kun du mi spyod na bla ma'i gnas su gyur pa rnams la lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya bas ni las kyi sgrib pa las rnam par
analyzed: nyon mongs pa chung ba'i phyir gzhan dag la brten nas kyang srog gcod pa'i las la sogs pa'i gnas skabs la kun du mi spyod na bla ma'i gnas su gyur pa rnams la lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya bas ni las kyi sgrib pa las rnam par
translated: And because they have few afflictions, they do not engage in the activities of killing, etc. even in dependence on others, much less in the states of guruhood.

original: grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, they are liberated from karmic obscurations.

original: de la mtshams med pa lnga ni las kyi sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: de la mtshams med pa lnga ni las kyi sgrib pa'o //
translated: The five heinous actions are karmic obscurations.

original: gzhan srid ba brgyad pa sgrub par byed pa'i las dag kyang yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gzhan srid ba brgyad pa sgrub par byed pa'i las dag kyang yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But aren't there also actions that establish an eighth existence?

original: mtshams med pa lnga kho na bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mtshams med pa lnga kho na bstan pa ni /
translated: The five heinous actions are taught

original: rgyu rnam pa lngas bstan par sla ba nyid dang / gdags par sla ba nyid kyi phyir zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: rgyu rnam pa lngas bstan par sla ba nyid dang / gdags par sla ba nyid kyi phyir zhes byas nas so //
translated: because they are easy to understand and easy to designate.

original: de la rgyu lnga ni /
analyzed: de la rgyu lnga ni /
translated: The five causes are:

original: rten nyid dang / 'gro ba nyid dang / 'bras bu nyid dang / rnam pa nyid @101b dang ; ngo bo nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rten nyid dang / 'gro ba nyid dang / 'bras bu nyid dang / rnam pa nyid @101b dang ; ngo bo nyid kyis so //
translated: by means of the basis, by means of going, by means of the result, by means of the aspect, and by means of the nature.🔽The afflictions that remain for a long time are removed by the maturity of knowledge, and one becomes liberated from the obscuration of the afflictions.🔽The maturity of the elements is the maturity of the faculties.🔽The maturity of the elements is the maturity of the faculties.🔽The maturity of the elements is the maturity of the faculties.

original: ye shes kyi khyad par gyi gnas skabs thob par 'gyur bas dus ring por gnas pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang bral ba ni shes pa yongs su smin pas ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //🔽khams brtas pa la sogs pa yongs su smin pa'i rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bdun la rtag tu sbyor ba dang bral bas /
analyzed: ye shes kyi khyad par gyi gnas skabs thob par 'gyur bas dus ring por gnas pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang bral ba ni shes pa yongs su smin pas ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro // khams brtas pa la sogs pa yongs su smin pa'i rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bdun la rtag tu sbyor ba dang bral bas /
translated: The maturity of the elements is the maturity of the faculties.🔽The maturity of the elements is the maturity of the faculties.🔽The maturity of the elements is the maturity of the faculties.🔽The maturity of the elements is the maturity of the faculties.🔽The maturity of the elements is the maturity of the faculties.🔽The maturity of the elements is the maturity of the faculties.🔽The maturity of the elements is the maturity of the faculties.🔽The maturity of the elements is the maturity of the faculties.🔽The maturity of the elements is the maturity of the faculties.🔽The maturity of the elements is the maturity of the faculties.

original: yun ring po nas ma goms pa ste /
analyzed: yun ring po nas ma goms pa ste /
translated: The maturity of the elements is the maturity of the faculties.

analyzed: sbyor ba dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The maturity of the elements is the maturity of the faculties.🔽The maturity of the elements is the maturity of the faculties.🔽The maturity of the elements is the maturity of the faculties.🔽The maturity of the elements is the maturity of the faculties.🔽The maturity of the elements is the maturity of the faculties.🔽The maturity of the elements is the maturity of the faculties.🔽The maturity of the elements is the maturity of the faculties.🔽The maturity of the elements is the maturity of the faculties.🔽The maturity of the elements is the maturity of the faculties.🔽The maturity of the elements is the maturity of the faculties.🔽The maturity of the elements is the maturity of the faculties.🔽The maturity of the elements is the maturity of the faculties.🔽The maturity of the elements is the maturity of the faculties.🔽The maturity of the elements is the maturity of the faculties.🔽The maturity of the elements is the maturity of the faculties.🔽The maturity of the elements is the maturity of the faculties.🔽The maturity of the elements is the maturity of the faculties.🔽The maturity of the elements is the maturity of the faculties.

original: dus mi ring bar goms par byas pa dang / rtag tu byed pa'i sbyor ba dang bral bar gyur pas /
analyzed: dus mi ring bar goms par byas pa dang / rtag tu byed pa'i sbyor ba dang bral bar gyur pas /
translated: The maturity of the elements is the maturity of the faculties.

original: rgyu ma brtas pa dang / chung ngu la goms pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ma brtas pa dang / chung ngu la goms pa'o //
translated: The maturity of the elements is the maturity of the faculties.🔽The maturity of the elements is the maturity

original: / de ltar yan lag gnyis dang bral ba'i phyir chung ngur yongs su gsal bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: / de ltar yan lag gnyis dang bral ba'i phyir chung ngur yongs su gsal bar byas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is made clear that the small stage is devoid of two members.

original: yan lag gcig ma tshang ba ni 'bring zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag gcig ma tshang ba ni 'bring zhes bya'o //
translated: The medium stage is said to be devoid of one member.

original: yan lag gnyis dang ldan pa ni chen po zhes gsal bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: yan lag gnyis dang ldan pa ni chen po zhes gsal bar byas pa yin no //
translated: The great stage is made clear as being endowed with two members.

original: yongs su smin pa'i thabs rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bdun ni ji ltar rigs par rnam pa bcur rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yongs su smin pa'i thabs rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bdun ni ji ltar rigs par rnam pa bcur rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: The means of ripening should be understood as being established in ten ways, according to the case, as the twenty-seven kinds of means of ripening.

original: rgyu dang rkyen bstan pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba la 'jug pa'i dbye ba dang / dus kyi dbye ba nyid dang / nges par 'byung ba'i tshul khrims kyi rgyu dag la yang dag par sgrub pa'i dbye ba nyid dang / rkyen gyi dbye ba nyid dang /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen bstan pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba la 'jug pa'i dbye ba dang / dus kyi dbye ba nyid dang / nges par 'byung ba'i tshul khrims kyi rgyu dag la yang dag par sgrub pa'i dbye ba nyid dang / rkyen gyi dbye ba nyid dang /
translated: The teaching of the causes and conditions, the classification of the engagement of the roots of virtue, the classification of the times, the classification of the practice of the causes of the morality of renunication, the classification of the conditions,

original: rnam pa'i dbye ba nyid dang / ye shes kyi dbye ba nyid dang / bya ba'i rab tu dbye ba nyid dang / rgyud kyi rab tu dbye ba nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa'i dbye ba nyid dang / ye shes kyi dbye ba nyid dang / bya ba'i rab tu dbye ba nyid dang / rgyud kyi rab tu dbye ba nyid do //
translated: the classification of the aspects, the classification of the knowledge, the classification of the actions, and the classification of the streams.

original: de lta bu'i yongs su smin pa'i thabs thams cad kyang rgyu dang rkyen gyis bsdus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i yongs su smin pa'i thabs thams cad kyang rgyu dang rkyen gyis bsdus par 'gyur ro //
translated: All the means of complete maturation are included in causes and conditions.

original: de ltar mdor bstan pa rnams nges par bstan pa ni rnam pa bcu'o //
analyzed: de ltar mdor bstan pa rnams nges par bstan pa ni rnam pa bcu'o //
translated: The brief presentation of complete maturation is explained in ten topics.

original: sa bon gzhan las rab tu khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir sa bon phun sum tshogs pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sa bon gzhan las rab tu khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir sa bon phun sum tshogs pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The excellence of the seed should be understood as the excellence of the seed due to the preeminence of the seed over other seeds.

original: yang na shin tu khyad par du 'phags pa'i dge ba'i chos kyi sa bon yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na shin tu khyad par du 'phags pa'i dge ba'i chos kyi sa bon yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Or, it is due to the excellence of the seed of virtuous qualities.

original: sa bon phun sum tshogs pa la brten nas zhes bya ba ni de yang yod la dge ba yang kun du brten pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas des dge ba'i rtsa ba'i chos kyi sa bon gong nas gong du skye ba'i dbang gis yongs su smin pa rab
analyzed: sa bon phun sum tshogs pa la brten nas zhes bya ba ni de yang yod la dge ba yang kun du brten pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas des dge ba'i rtsa ba'i chos kyi sa bon gong nas gong du skye ba'i dbang gis yongs su smin pa rab
translated: Based on the excellence of the seed means that, since it exists, the roots of virtue are nurtured by the aspects of reliance and so on. Due to the power of the arising of the seed of the roots of virtue, complete maturation arises,

original: dang rab mchog tu skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dang rab mchog tu skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: arising as the best of the best.

original: yongs su smin pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: yongs su smin pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: This is the excellence of complete maturation.

analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa rnams kyis ji ltar rigs par thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa rab tu thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The cause of the generation of the wholesome roots conducive to liberation is the generation of the wholesome roots conducive to liberation in this life.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i chos ston la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i chos ston la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The phrase he teaches the Dharma in an unerring way and so on.🔽The phrase he teaches the Dharma in an unerring way means that he teaches sentient beings in a way that accords with their faculties, their inclinations, and their temperaments.🔽The phrase he teaches the Dharma in a timely way means that he teaches the Dharma at a time when the disciples are attentive and their minds are receptive.

original: sems can rnams la dbang po dang / mngon par mos pa dang / khams kyi dbang gis ston pa nyid ni phyin ci ma log pa'i chos ston pa'o //🔽de dag gis ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa thob pa bstan pa yin no//
analyzed: sems can rnams la dbang po dang / mngon par mos pa dang / khams kyi dbang gis ston pa nyid ni phyin ci ma log pa'i chos ston pa'o // de dag gis ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa thob pa bstan pa yin no//
translated: The phrase he teaches the Dharma in a way that is free of worldly attachments means that he teaches the Dharma without any desire for gain, honor, or fame.🔽The phrase he teaches the Dharma in a way that is free of craving for personal gain means that he teaches the Dharma without any desire for his own personal welfare.🔽The phrase he teaches the Dharma in a way that is free of craving for honor means that he teaches the Dharma without any desire for the honor that comes from being revered.🔽The phrase he teaches the Dharma in a way that is free of craving for service means that he teaches the Dharma without any desire for the service that comes from being revered.🔽The phrase he teaches the Dharma in a way that is free of craving for the requisites of life means that he teaches the Dharma without any desire for the requisites of life.

original: de bzhin du legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la shes pa rnam pa gsum 'thob pa'i thabs nye bar bsgrub pa yin no //🔽de sngon du song ba las rgyud yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //🔽de'i phyir yang yongs su smin pa'i thabs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la shes pa rnam pa gsum 'thob pa'i thabs nye bar bsgrub pa yin no // de sngon du song ba las rgyud yongs su smin par 'gyur ro // de'i phyir yang yongs su smin pa'i thabs su 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase he teaches the Dharma in a way that is free of craving for the requisites of life means that he teaches the Dharma without any desire for the requisites of life.🔽The phrase he teaches the Dharma in a way that is free of craving for the requisites of life means that he teaches the Dharma without any desire for the requisites of life.🔽The phrase he teaches the Dharma in a way that is free of craving for the requisites of life means that he teaches the Dharma without any desire for the requisites of life.

original: khams brtas pa dang / da ltar gyi rkyen nye bar bsgrub pa la bye brag ci yod ce na /🔽de bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: khams brtas pa dang / da ltar gyi rkyen nye bar bsgrub pa la bye brag ci yod ce na / de bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: The phrase he teaches the Dharma in a way that is free of craving for the requisites of life means that he teaches the Dharma without any desire for the requisites of life.

original: de la khams brtas pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de la khams brtas pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The phrase he teaches the Dharma in a way that is free of craving for the requisites of life means that he teaches the Dharma without any desire for the requisites of life.

original: sngon gyi skye ba gzhan du gtogs pa'i rgyus da ltar gyi skye ba'i khams yongs su brtas pas bsdus pa nyid ni yongs su smin pa sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi skye ba gzhan du gtogs pa'i rgyus da ltar gyi skye ba'i khams yongs su brtas pas bsdus pa nyid ni yongs su smin pa sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: The cause that belongs to a previous birth and that is included in the development of the constituent element of the present birth is the establishment of complete maturity.

original: yongs su smin pa de nyid ni yongs su smin pa yin na yang khams brtas pas zhes brjod do //
analyzed: yongs su smin pa de nyid ni yongs su smin pa yin na yang khams brtas pas zhes brjod do //
translated: That very complete maturity is complete maturity, but it is called the development of the constituent element.

original: de nyid bden pa yin na yang yongs su smin pa zhes kyang rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de nyid bden pa yin na yang yongs su smin pa zhes kyang rnam par gzhag go //
translated: That very truth is also established as complete maturity.

original: da ltar gyi rkyen nye bar bsgrubs pas da ltar nyid kyi skye ba 'di'i yongs su smin pa'i rgyur gyur pa ni da ltar gyi yongs su smin pa'i rkyen nye bar bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: da ltar gyi rkyen nye bar bsgrubs pas da ltar nyid kyi skye ba 'di'i yongs su smin pa'i rgyur gyur pa ni da ltar gyi yongs su smin pa'i rkyen nye bar bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The establishment of the present condition as the cause of complete maturity in this very birth is called the establishment of the present condition of complete maturity.

original: de lta bu ni 'di dag gi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu ni 'di dag gi khyad par yin no //
translated: Such is the difference between them.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas bcas pa'i bslab pa'i gnas yang dag par blangs nas theg pa gsum gyi sgo nas nges par 'byung ba'i tshul khrims la yang dag par gnas pa ni 'jug pa zhes @102b brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas bcas pa'i bslab pa'i gnas yang dag par blangs nas theg pa gsum gyi sgo nas nges par 'byung ba'i tshul khrims la yang dag par gnas pa ni 'jug pa zhes @102b brjod do //
translated: One who has taken up the points of training prescribed by the Tathagata and who abides in the morality of restraint by the three vehicles is said to enter.

original: dad pa thob pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dad pa thob pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With respect to the attainment of faith, etc., it says: with respect to the attainment of faith, etc.

original: dad pa thob pa'i dbang du byas nas zhes bya ba ni dad pa thob pa dang yang dag par ldan par gyur cing sngar bstan pa'i shes pa gsum mngon par bsgrubs pas bsdus pa'i nyes par spyod pa las dben pa las brtsams pa'i bslab pa'i gnas skabs yang🔽dag par blangs nas gnas pa'am /
analyzed: dad pa thob pa'i dbang du byas nas zhes bya ba ni dad pa thob pa dang yang dag par ldan par gyur cing sngar bstan pa'i shes pa gsum mngon par bsgrubs pas bsdus pa'i nyes par spyod pa las dben pa las brtsams pa'i bslab pa'i gnas skabs yang dag par blangs nas gnas pa'am /
translated: One who has attained faith and is endowed with it, who has accomplished the three knowledges as previously explained, who has taken up the points of training that begin with seclusion which is the avoidance of misdeeds, and who abides in that,

original: khyim gyi gnas spangs nas 'dod pa las dben pa'i sgo nas rab tu byung ba'i bslab pa yang dag par blangs te gnas pa ni 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khyim gyi gnas spangs nas 'dod pa las dben pa'i sgo nas rab tu byung ba'i bslab pa yang dag par blangs te gnas pa ni 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: or who has taken up the training of going forth, having renounced the household life and having become secluded from desire, is said to enter.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam la ltos nas theg pa gsum gyis bsdus pa'i lam gyis ngan song gi srid pa las yongs su skyob pa'i phyir sdug bsngal thams cad las nges par 'byung ba nyid khong du chud par byas nas khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba'i phyogs kyi
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam la ltos nas theg pa gsum gyis bsdus pa'i lam gyis ngan song gi srid pa las yongs su skyob pa'i phyir sdug bsngal thams cad las nges par 'byung ba nyid khong du chud par byas nas khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba'i phyogs kyi
translated: In dependence on the mundane path, the path included in the three vehicles completely protects one from the existence of the miserable realms.🔽Having understood that it is the definite emergence from all suffering, one should enter the path of the middle way, the middle way that is free from the two extremes, the middle way that is the path of the middle way.

original: mtha' gnyis spangs pa'i rnam pas dbu ma'i lam de nyid nas dbu ma'i sgrub pa thugs su chud pa nyid kyis gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la mngon par mos pa dang / mngon par dga' ba dang / rab tu dang ba ni lam gyi phan yon mthong nas dga' bar 'dzin pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis spangs pa'i rnam pas dbu ma'i lam de nyid nas dbu ma'i sgrub pa thugs su chud pa nyid kyis gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la mngon par mos pa dang / mngon par dga' ba dang / rab tu dang ba ni lam gyi phan yon mthong nas dga' bar 'dzin pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Having understood that, one should have great interest in the Dharma and Vinaya that was taught, one should have great joy in it, and one should have great faith in it.

original: 'khor ba'i phung bo la yid 'byung bar bya ba'i chos bde 'gro dang ngan 'gros bsdus pa bdag dang gzhan la ji ltar rigs par rgud pa dang 'byor pa'i gnas kyis yang dag par bsdus pa 'di dag gi nyes dmigs mthong nas skyo ba'i 'du shes yid la
analyzed: 'khor ba'i phung bo la yid 'byung bar bya ba'i chos bde 'gro dang ngan 'gros bsdus pa bdag dang gzhan la ji ltar rigs par rgud pa dang 'byor pa'i gnas kyis yang dag par bsdus pa 'di dag gi nyes dmigs mthong nas skyo ba'i 'du shes yid la
translated: The Dharma of disgust with the aggregates of cyclic existence is the seeing of the faults of these states, which are included in good and bad destinies, and which are summarized by the states of misfortune and good fortune of self and others.

original: byed pas yid byung zhing rtogs nas 'khor ba'i nyes dmigs mthong bas bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed pas yid byung zhing rtogs nas 'khor ba'i nyes dmigs mthong bas bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having seen their faults, one should bring to mind the idea of disgust, and then, having become disgusted and understood, one should see the faults of cyclic existence.

original: rigs pa'i don dang / de'i sgrub pa ni lam gyi 'bras bu dang / lam nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs pa'i don dang / de'i sgrub pa ni lam gyi 'bras bu dang / lam nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the reason and its proof should be understood as the result of the path and the path itself.

original: de dag bzhis ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i phan yon bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag bzhis ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i phan yon bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: By these four, the benefits of nirvana are shown.

original: de lta bu'i 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i nyes dmigs dang / phan yon mthong nas yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i nyes dmigs dang / phan yon mthong nas yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having seen the faults of cyclic existence and nirvana in this way, one becomes fully mature.

original: de ltar de ltar gyi dus kyi rkyen nye bar bsgrub pa rnam pa gsum du phye nas bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar de ltar gyi dus kyi rkyen nye bar bsgrub pa rnam pa gsum du phye nas bstan to //
translated: Thus, the time condition is taught as having three aspects.

original: de nyid ma 'ongs pa'i khams yongs su brtas par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid ma 'ongs pa'i khams yongs su brtas par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: That very thing will cause the future element to grow.

original: dang po 'jug pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni dang po'i 'jug pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: dang po 'jug pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni dang po'i 'jug pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: That which is not the first entry is not the first entry.

original: 'das pa'i skye bar khams brtas par gyur pa'i rkyen gyis so //
analyzed: 'das pa'i skye bar khams brtas par gyur pa'i rkyen gyis so //
translated: By the condition of the element having grown in past births.

original: de'i phyir @103a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir @103a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: smras pa / zhugs zin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: smras pa / zhugs zin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: it is said: “Having entered, etc.”🔽Even if sentient beings who are in the present stage of full maturation meet with Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, they do not approach them because of the power of faults such as pride.

original: da ltar yongs su smin pa'i gnas skabs la gnas pa'i sems can sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang phrad na yang nga rgyal la sogs pa'i skyon gyi dbang gis de dag gi drung du nye bar mi 'gro ba de dag btang snyoms su mi 'jog
analyzed: da ltar yongs su smin pa'i gnas skabs la gnas pa'i sems can sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang phrad na yang nga rgyal la sogs pa'i skyon gyi dbang gis de dag gi drung du nye bar mi 'gro ba de dag btang snyoms su mi 'jog
translated: Those are not left indifferent.

original: gi / de'i phyir yang dang yang der gshegs nas sngar bstan pa'i gnas de nyid yang dang yang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ston to //
analyzed: gi / de'i phyir yang dang yang der gshegs nas sngar bstan pa'i gnas de nyid yang dang yang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ston to //
translated: Therefore, having gone there again and again, the very same topic taught previously is taught again and again by the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: des na rgyu de dang rkyen des gong nas gong du khyad par du yongs su smin par gyur pa ni dang po 'jug pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na rgyu de dang rkyen des gong nas gong du khyad par du yongs su smin par gyur pa ni dang po 'jug pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the complete ripening of the cause and condition is called the first non-entry.

original: le lo pa'am rkyen dang mi ldan pa la brten nas zhes bya ba ni gnyid kyi bde ba dang / glos 'bebs pa'i bde ba dang / nyal ba'i bde ba nyams su len cing le lo can gyi dngos po brgyad gsal bar ston pas sam /
analyzed: le lo pa'am rkyen dang mi ldan pa la brten nas zhes bya ba ni gnyid kyi bde ba dang / glos 'bebs pa'i bde ba dang / nyal ba'i bde ba nyams su len cing le lo can gyi dngos po brgyad gsal bar ston pas sam /
translated: Based on laziness or lack of conditions means practicing the bliss of sleep, the bliss of lying down, and the bliss of lying on one's side, or clearly demonstrating the eight things of the lazy.

original: rkyen dang mi ldan pa la brten nas te /
analyzed: rkyen dang mi ldan pa la brten nas te /
translated: Or based on lack of conditions.

original: bag med pa mang ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen ma yin pas yongs su gzung bas sam /
analyzed: bag med pa mang ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen ma yin pas yongs su gzung bas sam /
translated: Due to much heedlessness, being held by those who are not spiritual friends,

original: sdug bsngal nye par bab pa la brten nas so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal nye par bab pa la brten nas so //
translated: or based on suffering that has befallen.

original: dus thag ring ba bshad pa ni /
analyzed: dus thag ring ba bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of distant time:

original: dus yun ring po 'gyangs pa tshe rabs brjes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dus yun ring po 'gyangs pa tshe rabs brjes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: A long time has passed, lives have been changed, and so on.

original: de las bzlog pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The opposite of that is and so on.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa nyid dang / rkyen dang ldan pa nyid dang / dus yun thung du nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa nyid dang / rkyen dang ldan pa nyid dang / dus yun thung du nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: by the very undertaking of effort, by the possession of conditions, by the brevity of the period of time, and so on.

original: de ltar yongs su smin pa'i thabs thams cad kyi dus rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar yongs su smin pa'i thabs thams cad kyi dus rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the time of all the means of ripening is twofold:

original: rnam par dag pa thag ring ba dang / rnam par dag pa thag nye ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa thag ring ba dang / rnam par dag pa thag nye ba'o //
translated: far from purity and near to purity.

original: tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas nas sdom pa yang dag par blangs te nan tan byed pa ni sbyor ba zhes bya'o //🔽tshul khrims la dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad rab tu brten par shes par byas nas rgyu gnyis dang / rkyen rnam pa gnyis kyis bslab pa'i gnas rnams la gus par byed pa nyid ni sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas nas sdom pa yang dag par blangs te nan tan byed pa ni sbyor ba zhes bya'o // tshul khrims la dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad rab tu brten par shes par byas nas rgyu gnyis dang / rkyen rnam pa gnyis kyis bslab pa'i gnas rnams la gus par byed pa nyid ni sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: With regard to morality, the practice is called the undertaking of the vow of morality and the cultivation of it.🔽With regard to morality, the practice is called the cultivation of respect for the precepts through two causes and two conditions, having understood that all the roots of virtue are well established in morality.

original: tshul khrims la dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad rab tu brten pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: tshul khrims la dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad rab tu brten pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: With regard to morality, the practice is called the cultivation of respect for the precepts through two causes and two conditions, having understood that all the roots of virtue are well established in morality.

original: rang gi don thob par bya ba la 'dun pa drag po'am zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi don thob par bya ba la 'dun pa drag po'am zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The intense desire to attain one's own aim is called zeal.

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa ni dag pa'i chos rnams yongs su nyams pa'i rgyu nyid yin pas tshul khrims kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs tshul khrims 'chal pa'i ma 'ongs @103b pa'i dus kyi mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa ni dag pa'i chos rnams yongs su nyams pa'i rgyu nyid yin pas tshul khrims kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs tshul khrims 'chal pa'i ma 'ongs @103b pa'i dus kyi mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: Since immorality is the cause of the degeneration of pure dharmas, the future undesirable results of immorality, which is the adversary of morality, are mentioned:

original: phyi ma la log par lhung ba'i 'jigs pa la brten te zhes bya ba ni phyi ma la'o //🔽mthong ba'i chos la tshigs su bcad pa ma yin pa'i dbang du byas te de ltar re zhig rgyu smras nas /
analyzed: phyi ma la log par lhung ba'i 'jigs pa la brten te zhes bya ba ni phyi ma la'o // mthong ba'i chos la tshigs su bcad pa ma yin pa'i dbang du byas te de ltar re zhig rgyu smras nas /
translated: Based on the fear of falling into bad destinies in future lives.🔽 The undesirable results in the present life are mentioned: In this life, the fear of being blamed by others.

original: rnam pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having thus described the causes, in order to demonstrate the aspects, he says:🔽Always, respectfully, and with protection.

original: rtag tu byed pa dang / gus par byed pa dang / srung bar byed pa zhes bya ba la rjes su srung ba dang / gus par byed pa dang / gsal bar byed par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rtag tu byed pa dang / gus par byed pa dang / srung bar byed pa zhes bya ba la rjes su srung ba dang / gus par byed pa dang / gsal bar byed par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The aspects are three: protection, respect, and clarity.

original: de nyid bstan pa ni rtag tu byed pa dang / gus par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa ni rtag tu byed pa dang / gus par byed pa'o //
translated: The teaching of that is always doing and doing respectfully.

original: bsam pa ni legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba 'di la shes rab thob pa dang / dad pa thob pa zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ni legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba 'di la shes rab thob pa dang / dad pa thob pa zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The intention is the attainment of wisdom and the attainment of faith in this well-spoken Dharma and Vinaya, as taught.

original: yang dag par rtog pa'i bzod pa zhes bya ba ni chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang dag par rtog pa'i bzod pa zhes bya ba ni chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of patience that is right investigation is the patience of ascertaining the Dharma.

original: chos rnams la phyin ci ma log par byed pa'i bzod pa chen po'i chos la gnas pa'i ye shes ni yang dag par rtog pa'i bzod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos rnams la phyin ci ma log par byed pa'i bzod pa chen po'i chos la gnas pa'i ye shes ni yang dag par rtog pa'i bzod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The patience that is the great Dharma of not distorting the dharmas, the wisdom of abiding in the Dharma, is called patience that is right investigation.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: mi g-yo ba gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni de 'thob par gyur na bdud dang phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis chos 'dul ba 'di las 'phrogs par mi 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni de 'thob par gyur na bdud dang phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis chos 'dul ba 'di las 'phrogs par mi 'gyur pa'o //
translated: It is that which is unshakable. When one attains it, all māras and opponents cannot steal away this Dharma and Vinaya.

original: 'das pa dang da ltar gyi dus las brtsams nas gzhan dag gi rtog pa la yid ches par byas nas dad pa ston par byed pa dang / dkon mchog gsum la rab tu dang bar byed pa dang / rang gi bya ba la mngon par 'dod pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa dang da ltar gyi dus las brtsams nas gzhan dag gi rtog pa la yid ches par byas nas dad pa ston par byed pa dang / dkon mchog gsum la rab tu dang bar byed pa dang / rang gi bya ba la mngon par 'dod pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: Having begun with the past and present, he shows his faith by inspiring confidence in the thoughts of others and by his devotion to the Three Jewels.

original: de ltar 'dod pa rnam pa gsum gyis legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba 'di la bsam pa phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod pa rnam pa gsum gyis legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba 'di la bsam pa phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, through these three kinds of aspiration, he becomes endowed with the highest aspiration in this well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya.

original: bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa nyid ni bsam pa phun sum tshogs pas yongs su smin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa nyid ni bsam pa phun sum tshogs pas yongs su smin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Endowment with the highest aspiration is called the perfection of aspiration.

original: de bzhin du thabs thams cad la yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thabs thams cad la yang rig par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for all the other means.

original: gang zang zing gi sbyin pa ni zang zing nye bar sgrub pa zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zang zing gi sbyin pa ni zang zing nye bar sgrub pa zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The giving of material things is taught as the accomplishment of material things.

original: yang sbyin pa de ni tha mal pa dang / khyad par can gyi rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang sbyin pa de ni tha mal pa dang / khyad par can gyi rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, that giving is twofold: ordinary and extraordinary.

original: tha mal pa la sbyin pa ni sdug bsngal ba rnams dang / phongs pa rnams la sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: tha mal pa la sbyin pa ni sdug bsngal ba rnams dang / phongs pa rnams la sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving to ordinary beings is giving to the miserable and the poor.

original: khyad par can la sbyin pa ni yon gnas rnams la sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par can la sbyin pa ni yon gnas rnams la sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving to the special is giving to the worthy.

original: sbyin pa dang po'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang po'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: With reference to the first kind of giving, it is said:

original: thams cad kyi thams cad du med pa rnams la zas dang skom la sogs pa nye bar @104a * //
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad du med pa rnams la zas dang skom la sogs pa nye bar @104a * //
translated: To those who have nothing at all, one gives food, drink, etc.

original: sgrub pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so on.

original: gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: With reference to the second kind of giving, it is said:🔽To those who are in accord, one gives food, drink, etc.

original: mthun pa'i zas dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mthun pa'i zas dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: de ltar phongs pa rnams dang sdug bsngal ba'i sems can rnams la nyung du'am dman pa yang rung sbyin gnas rnams la mang po'am gya nom pa'i sbyin pas yongs su smin pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar phongs pa rnams dang sdug bsngal ba'i sems can rnams la nyung du'am dman pa yang rung sbyin gnas rnams la mang po'am gya nom pa'i sbyin pas yongs su smin pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, to the poor and miserable beings, even a little or inferior gift becomes a cause of their maturation, but to the worthy, a great or excellent gift.

original: chos nye bar sgrub pa ni chos kyi sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: chos nye bar sgrub pa ni chos kyi sbyin pa ste /
translated: The establishment of Dharma is the giving of Dharma.

original: thams cad kyi thams cad du mi shes pa rnams lung gi chos la gzhug pa'i dbang du byas nas so //
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad du mi shes pa rnams lung gi chos la gzhug pa'i dbang du byas nas so //
translated: In all cases, for those who do not know the Dharma of scripture, the Dharma is given in order to introduce them to the Dharma of scripture.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /🔽gang yi ge sbyin pa bstan pa smras pa /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te / gang yi ge sbyin pa bstan pa smras pa /
translated: And that is twofold:🔽The giving of the Dharma is that which is taught by means of the letters of the texts.🔽The giving of the meaning is that which is taught by means of the true connection with the meaning.

original: lung 'bogs pas sam zhes bya bas chos rnams sbyin par byed pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lung 'bogs pas sam zhes bya bas chos rnams sbyin par byed pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya'o //
translated: The nature of the giving of the Dharma is the giving of the Dharma.

original: don sbyin pa ni /🔽don yang dag par 'brel pas zhes bya bas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: don sbyin pa ni / don yang dag par 'brel pas zhes bya bas bstan pa yin no //
translated: The giving of the meaning is the giving of the meaning.🔽The giving of the Dharma is the giving of the Dharma.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyis 'dun par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rdzu 'phrul gyis 'dun par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyis 'dun par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rdzu 'phrul gyis 'dun par byed pa'o //
translated: The giving of the meaning is the giving of the meaning.🔽The giving of the Dharma is the giving of the Dharma.

original: rdzu 'phul dang ldan pas zhes bya ba ni mthu dang ldan pa'o //🔽de dag gis ni sngags dang sman la sogs pas 'dun par bya ba bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: rdzu 'phul dang ldan pas zhes bya ba ni mthu dang ldan pa'o // de dag gis ni sngags dang sman la sogs pas 'dun par bya ba bkag pa yin no //

original: yang 'dun par byed pa ni ji ltar rigs par bsam pa dag par sgrub pa la 'god pa'o //
analyzed: yang 'dun par byed pa ni ji ltar rigs par bsam pa dag par sgrub pa la 'god pa'o //
translated: The giving of the meaning is the giving of the meaning.🔽The giving of the Dharma is the giving of the Dharma.🔽The giving

original: snying brtse bas zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i ched du sems dang bar byed pa ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snying brtse bas zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i ched du sems dang bar byed pa ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Compassion means that one is not motivated by the desire for gain or honor.

original: gang la rdzu 'phrul bstan pas 'dun par bya ba'i rdzu 'phrul bstan pa'i yul de dag gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang la rdzu 'phrul bstan pas 'dun par bya ba'i rdzu 'phrul bstan pa'i yul de dag gang yin zhe na /
translated: What are the objects for whom miracles are demonstrated, in order to inspire them?

original: sems can rnams kyi bsam pa dag pa'am zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi bsam pa dag pa'am zhes bya ba la /
translated: The purity of the aspiration of sentient beings means

original: de dag kyang de bzhin du yang dag par sgrub par byed pa'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang de bzhin du yang dag par sgrub par byed pa'o zhes bya'o //
translated: that they are also established in that way.

original: gcig tu nges par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gcig tu nges par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says,

original: 'dun par byas pa'i yid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun par byas pa'i yid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: with a mind inspired by faith.

original: chos nye bar sgrub pa dang / ston pa la khyad par ci yod ce na /🔽mi shes pa rnams lung gi chos la gzhug pa'i dbang du byas pa ni /
analyzed: chos nye bar sgrub pa dang / ston pa la khyad par ci yod ce na / mi shes pa rnams lung gi chos la gzhug pa'i dbang du byas pa ni /
translated: What is the difference between the establishment of the Dharma and teaching?

original: chos nye bar sgrub pa yin la /
analyzed: chos nye bar sgrub pa yin la /
translated: The establishment of the Dharma is for the sake of engaging the ignorant in the Dharma of scripture.🔽The teaching is for the sake of engaging the faithful in the Dharma of realization.

original: zhugs par gyur pa rnams rtogs pa'i chos la gzhug pa'i dbang du byas nas chos dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos la nan tan byed du gzhug pa'i phyir lung 'bogs pas nye bar bstan pas chos ston pa ste /
analyzed: zhugs par gyur pa rnams rtogs pa'i chos la gzhug pa'i dbang du byas nas chos dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos la nan tan byed du gzhug pa'i phyir lung 'bogs pas nye bar bstan pas chos ston pa ste /
translated: The teaching of the Dharma by means of instruction is for the sake of causing those who have entered to engage in the Dharma that is to be realized, in order to cause them to practice the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma.

original: nyan thos kyi lam ni nye bar bstan pa dang 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽rgyu gnyis kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mdo'i rjes su @104b 'brangs nas so //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi lam ni nye bar bstan pa dang 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir ro // rgyu gnyis kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mdo'i rjes su @104b 'brangs nas so //
translated: The path of the śrāvaka is related to instruction.🔽The teaching of the Dharma by means of instruction is for the sake of causing those who have entered to engage in the Dharma that is to be realized, in order to cause them to practice the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma.

original: gsang ba'i gnas kyang rnam pa gnyis te /🔽dngos po nyid dang / dbang du bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: gsang ba'i gnas kyang rnam pa gnyis te / dngos po nyid dang / dbang du bya ba nyid do //
translated: The path of the śrāvaka is related to instruction.🔽The teaching of the Dharma by means of instruction is for the sake of causing those who have entered to engage in the Dharma that is to be realized, in order to cause them to practice the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma.🔽The path of the śrāvaka is related to instruction.🔽The teaching of the Dharma by means of instruction is for the sake of causing those who have entered to engage in the Dharma that is to be realized, in order to cause them to practice the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la ni nyan thos kyi theg pa la sogs pa dang mthun pa ma yin te /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la ni nyan thos kyi theg pa la sogs pa dang mthun pa ma yin te /
translated: The path of the śrāvaka is related to instruction.🔽The teaching of the Dharma by means of instruction is for the sake of causing those who have entered to engage in the Dharma that is to be realized, in order to cause them to practice the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma.

original: ji skad du tshigs su bcad pas /
analyzed: ji skad du tshigs su bcad pas /
translated: The path of the śrāvaka is related to instruction.🔽The teaching of the Dharma by means of instruction is for the sake of causing those who have entered to engage in the Dharma that is to be realized, in order to cause them to practice the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma.

original: de ni byis pa rnams la ngas ma bstan //
analyzed: de ni byis pa rnams la ngas ma bstan //
translated: The path of the śrāvaka is related to instruction.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs pa'i phyir de don ma yin par 'gyur pa'am /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs pa'i phyir de don ma yin par 'gyur pa'am /
translated: The teaching of the Dharma by means of instruction is for the sake of causing those who have entered to engage in the Dharma that is to be realized, in order

original: phan pa ci yang mi 'gyur pas zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: phan pa ci yang mi 'gyur pas zhes byas nas so //
translated: because it would be of no benefit.

original: dbang du bya ba nyid ni chos la bdag med pa la nyan thos la sogs pa dbang bam yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: dbang du bya ba nyid ni chos la bdag med pa la nyan thos la sogs pa dbang bam yin pa nyid do //
translated: The meaning of “control” is that the śrāvakas, etc. are not in control of the teaching of the selflessness of dharmas.

original: des na smras pa /
analyzed: des na smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: shin tu rgya che zhing zab pa'i don bcabs te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shin tu rgya che zhing zab pa'i don bcabs te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Having concealed the meaning that is extremely vast and profound.”

original: de'i phyir nyan thos kyi theg par shin tu zab cing rgya che ba'i chos rnams ma bstan te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyan thos kyi theg par shin tu zab cing rgya che ba'i chos rnams ma bstan te /
