translated: Therefore, the extremely profound and vast Dharma is not taught in the Śrāvaka Vehicle,

original: bden pa ma mthong pa'i nyan thos rnams ni byis pa'i shes rab can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa ma mthong pa'i nyan thos rnams ni byis pa'i shes rab can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the śrāvakas who have not seen the truth have the wisdom of fools.

original: bden pa mthong ba rnams kyis ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams las thos nas sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba rnams kyis ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams las thos nas sgrub par byed do //
translated: Those who have seen the truth, having heard it from the bodhisattvas, practice it.

original: de'i phyir de dag la tha dad du ma bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag la tha dad du ma bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is not taught separately to them.

original: des na de dag la rags pa'i chos ston pa yin te /
analyzed: des na de dag la rags pa'i chos ston pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the coarse Dharma is taught to them.

original: ji ltar rags pa'i dngos po nas ston pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rags pa'i dngos po nas ston pa'o //
translated: It is taught from coarse things.

original: 'jug par sla ba'i chos ston pa ni ji ltar 'byung ba'i dngos po'i chos ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug par sla ba'i chos ston pa ni ji ltar 'byung ba'i dngos po'i chos ston pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the Dharma that is easy to enter is the teaching of the Dharma of things as they arise.

original: thabs sla bas 'jug pa'i chos ni rtogs pa'i chos ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa ste /
analyzed: thabs sla bas 'jug pa'i chos ni rtogs pa'i chos ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa ste /
translated: The teaching of the Dharma that is easy to enter by means of the method is the teaching of the Dharma as it is to be understood.

original: dper na phung po dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa dang / bden pa rnams dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na phung po dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa dang / bden pa rnams dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: For example, the aggregates, the meditative concentrations, the formless states, and the truths, respectively.

original: rnam par phye ba ni gsal por byas nas chos ston pas na rnam par phye ste chos brjod pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par phye ba ni gsal por byas nas chos ston pas na rnam par phye ste chos brjod pa ste /
translated: The teaching of the Dharma that is well analyzed is the teaching of the Dharma after having made it clear.

original: kun du rjod par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kun du rjod par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “well analyzed” is “well expressed.”

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: shin tu rgya che zhing zab pa'i gnas rnam par 'grel ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shin tu rgya che zhing zab pa'i gnas rnam par 'grel ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: “The commentary on the extremely vast and profound topics.”

original: rnam par 'grel pa nyid dang / rab tu 'byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par 'grel pa nyid dang / rab tu 'byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of the very commentary and the very analysis.

original: yongs su smin pa'i rgyu chung du gang yin pa de ni chung ngur 'dod do //
analyzed: yongs su smin pa'i rgyu chung du gang yin pa de ni chung ngur 'dod do //
translated: The small cause of complete ripening is asserted to be small.

original: des na smras pa /
analyzed: des na smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: de la sbyor ba chung ngu gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni thabs kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: de la sbyor ba chung ngu gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni thabs kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: This is from the perspective of method.

original: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba thos pa la sogs pa'i shes pa thob pa nyid kyis gsung rab la lhag par mos pa ni thos pa zhes brjod kyi /
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba thos pa la sogs pa'i shes pa thob pa nyid kyis gsung rab la lhag par mos pa ni thos pa zhes brjod kyi /
translated: One who has attained knowledge through listening to the well-spoken Dharma and Vinaya has superior devotion to the scriptures and is called a listener.

original: gzhan dag dang rtsod pa gtsor byed pas ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir de yang thos pa la sbyor ba ni dang por te sngon du sbyor ba @105a * //
analyzed: gzhan dag dang rtsod pa gtsor byed pas ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir de yang thos pa la sbyor ba ni dang por te sngon du sbyor ba @105a * //
translated: This is taught because they primarily engage in debate with others, but not because they are foremost in terms of method.

original: yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: One should know that the preparation is first, that is, prior,🔽because it is the preparation for listening.

original: gang yang len pa dang / bar du ji ltar thos pa rnams mi brjed pa'i sbyor bas gnas pa ni gang yang smras pa 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang len pa dang / bar du ji ltar thos pa rnams mi brjed pa'i sbyor bas gnas pa ni gang yang smras pa 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One who maintains what is heard through the preparation of not forgetting what was heard in the middle is called one who upholds what is said.

original: mjug gi gnas skabs su tshig gis yang dang yang du goms par byed pa ni kha ton byed pa la mngon par brtson pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mjug gi gnas skabs su tshig gis yang dang yang du goms par byed pa ni kha ton byed pa la mngon par brtson pa zhes bya'o //
translated: At the final stage, one who cultivates through words again and again is called one who strives in recitation.

original: rab tu dben par zhes bya ba ni rab tu dben par song nas gcig pu dben par gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rab tu dben par zhes bya ba ni rab tu dben par song nas gcig pu dben par gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In the phrase in a secluded place, secluded means that one goes to a secluded place and stays there alone and in solitude.

original: chos nges par sems pa la mngon par dga' bas zhes bya ba ni ji ltar thos pa'i chos rnams kyi don rigs pa rnam pa bzhis nges par rtog par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos nges par sems pa la mngon par dga' bas zhes bya ba ni ji ltar thos pa'i chos rnams kyi don rigs pa rnam pa bzhis nges par rtog par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In the phrase delighting in reflecting on the Dharma, reflecting on the Dharma means reflecting on the meaning of the teachings one has heard by means of the four principles for examining the Dharma.

original: bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab chung du ni don la mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab chung du ni don la mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: The lesser wisdom that arises from reflection is the realization of the meaning.

original: 'bring po ni kun du dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'bring po ni kun du dpyod pa'o //
translated: The middling is thorough investigation.

original: chen po ni gtan la 'bebs pa'o //
analyzed: chen po ni gtan la 'bebs pa'o //
translated: The greater is ascertainment.

original: yang sngon dang phyi ma mi 'gal ba ni don la mngon par rtogs pa'o //🔽rigs pa dang mi 'gal ba ni kun du dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: yang sngon dang phyi ma mi 'gal ba ni don la mngon par rtogs pa'o // rigs pa dang mi 'gal ba ni kun du dpyod pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the realization of the meaning is not contradicting what comes before and after.🔽Thorough investigation is not contradicting reasoning.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad kyis zil gyis mnan par mi nus pa ni gtan la 'bebs pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad kyis zil gyis mnan par mi nus pa ni gtan la 'bebs pa'o //
translated: Ascertainment is not being overcome by any opposing factors.

original: yang bstan par sems pa dang / nges par sems pa dang / nag po bstan pa dang chen po bstan pa'i bsam pa dang / ji skad bstan pa'i tshig gsum rim pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang bstan par sems pa dang / nges par sems pa dang / nag po bstan pa dang chen po bstan pa'i bsam pa dang / ji skad bstan pa'i tshig gsum rim pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The three phrases, “to teach,” “to be intent on teaching,” and “to be intent on teaching the great doctrine” should be understood respectively as the three phrases, “to teach,” “to be intent on teaching,” and “to be intent on teaching the great doctrine.”

original: sems rgod pa'am rgod du dogs pa na zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems rgod pa'am rgod du dogs pa na zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma gzung bar bya'o //
translated: When the mind is excited or is tending to excitement, one should take hold of the sign of tranquility.

original: yang de ni rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yang de ni rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, that sign should be understood as threefold:

original: zhi gnas dang / zhi gnas kyi dmigs pa dang / zhi gnas kyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang / zhi gnas kyi dmigs pa dang / zhi gnas kyi rgyu'o //
translated: tranquility, the object of tranquility, and the cause of tranquility.

original: de la zhi gnas nyid ni zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la zhi gnas nyid ni zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma zhes bya ste /
translated: Among them, tranquility itself is called the sign of tranquility,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma bzhin no //
translated: like the sign of form, etc.

original: zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan la dmigs nas yid la byed pa ni zhi gnas la dmigs pa zhes bya ba mtshan ma gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan la dmigs nas yid la byed pa ni zhi gnas la dmigs pa zhes bya ba mtshan ma gnyis pa'o //
translated: The mental attention which has as its object the cause of tranquility is called the object of tranquility. This is the second sign.

original: zhi gnas kyi tshogs nges par sten par byed pa ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi tshogs nges par sten par byed pa ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The definite practice of the requisites of tranquility is the third.

original: sems zhum pa'am zhum du dogs pa na rab tu dga' ba'i dngos po'i mtshan ma rnams 'dir yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems zhum pa'am zhum du dogs pa na rab tu dga' ba'i dngos po'i mtshan ma rnams 'dir yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: When the mind is slack or threatened with slackness, the signs of the things that cause delight should be looked at, as before.

original: sems mnyam par gnas pa thob par gyur nas rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa ni mi btsal bar btang snyoms su gnas pa ni mtshan nyid gsum pa'o //
analyzed: sems mnyam par gnas pa thob par gyur nas rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa ni mi btsal bar btang snyoms su gnas pa ni mtshan nyid gsum pa'o //
translated: When one has attained the stability of mind, and it proceeds spontaneously, one should rest in equanimity without seeking anything, which is the third characteristic.

original: de lta bu'i mtshan ma gzung zhing zhi gnas kyi dus dang / lhag mthong gi @105b dus dang / btang snyoms kyi dus su mtshan ma de dag brten pa la mngon par dga' bas mtshan ma de dag la rnam par g-yeng ba med par sems kyis bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i mtshan ma gzung zhing zhi gnas kyi dus dang / lhag mthong gi @105b dus dang / btang snyoms kyi dus su mtshan ma de dag brten pa la mngon par dga' bas mtshan ma de dag la rnam par g-yeng ba med par sems kyis bsgom pa'o //
translated: Thus, one should cultivate those signs with a mind free from distraction, by delighting in the stability of those signs at the time of calm, at the time of analytical insight, and at the time of equanimity.

original: sdud pa ni phyogs yongs su gzung ba dang / phan btags pa'i bya ba khas blangs pa'o //
analyzed: sdud pa ni phyogs yongs su gzung ba dang / phan btags pa'i bya ba khas blangs pa'o //
translated: Gathering means accepting the appropriation of the side and the activity of benefit.

original: zang zing med pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba ni bsam pa yongs su dag pas tshogs sdud pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zang zing med pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba ni bsam pa yongs su dag pas tshogs sdud pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: With a disinterested mind means gathering the accumulations with a pure intention.

original: rten sbyin par byed pa zhes bya ba ni rab tu 'byung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs pa la sogs par blta bar bya'o //🔽de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: rten sbyin par byed pa zhes bya ba ni rab tu 'byung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs pa la sogs par blta bar bya'o // de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: The phrase giving support refers to going forth, full ordination, and so on.

original: slob dpon dang mkhan po'i tshul du zhes bya ba'o //🔽de ltar re zhig yongs su gzung ba'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: slob dpon dang mkhan po'i tshul du zhes bya ba'o // de ltar re zhig yongs su gzung ba'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said: in the manner of a preceptor and an instructor.

original: bsnyen bkur rnam pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsnyen bkur rnam pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thus, in this way, having taken possession into consideration, it is said: in various kinds of service.

original: zang zing med pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zang zing med pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this context, the phrase with a mind free of material desires is to be supplied.

original: nad pa rnams kyi g-yog bya ba'i bsnyen bkur dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyi sems mgu bar bya ba'i phyir chos kyi sgo nas zang zing bgo bsha' byed pa'i bsnyen bkur dang / sdug pa dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal mang po can rnams la mya ngan bsal ba'i bsnyen bkur dang /
analyzed: nad pa rnams kyi g-yog bya ba'i bsnyen bkur dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyi sems mgu bar bya ba'i phyir chos kyi sgo nas zang zing bgo bsha' byed pa'i bsnyen bkur dang / sdug pa dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal mang po can rnams la mya ngan bsal ba'i bsnyen bkur dang /
translated: The service of nursing the sick, the service of sharing material things through the Dharma in order to please the minds of one's spiritual companions, and the service of dispelling the sorrow of those who are suffering due to separation from loved ones.

original: bslab pa'i gnas rnams la shin tu gus pa'am gus pa rnams la 'gyod pa bsal ba'i bsnyen bkur dang / dge sbyong la gnod pa byed pa'i gnod pa rnams la nyon mongs pa bsal ba'i bsnyen bkur ro //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gnas rnams la shin tu gus pa'am gus pa rnams la 'gyod pa bsal ba'i bsnyen bkur dang / dge sbyong la gnod pa byed pa'i gnod pa rnams la nyon mongs pa bsal ba'i bsnyen bkur ro //
translated: The service of removing afflictions for those who have done harm to ascetics.

original: chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po ste gnod pa rnam pa gsum byas pa rnams la drag po'i bya ba kun du spyad pa ni tshar bcad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po ste gnod pa rnam pa gsum byas pa rnams la drag po'i bya ba kun du spyad pa ni tshar bcad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The punishment of those who have done the three kinds of harm, small, medium, and great, is called the performance of harsh actions.

original: de la drag po'i bya ba kun du spyod pa rnams kyis skyon gyi rgyu yongs su spang ba'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /🔽bdag la yod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de la drag po'i bya ba kun du spyod pa rnams kyis skyon gyi rgyu yongs su spang ba'i dbang du byas nas smras pa / bdag la yod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Regarding that, in terms of completely abandoning the cause of faults through the performance of harsh actions, it is said:🔽What exists for me and so on.

original: bdag la yod pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag la yod pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: What exists for me means what belongs to me.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams kun du bsrungs nas zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa kun du bsrungs nas gnod sems kyi mthar thug pa so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis bsal nas phan pa'i sems dang / bde ba'i sems kyis sman pa mkhas pas nad pa la ltar ram /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams kun du bsrungs nas zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa kun du bsrungs nas gnod sems kyi mthar thug pa so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis bsal nas phan pa'i sems dang / bde ba'i sems kyis sman pa mkhas pas nad pa la ltar ram /
translated: Having protected from the afflictions means that, having protected from the afflictions, he dispels malice by the power of discernment, and with a mind of benefit and a mind of happiness, like a skilled physician looking after the sick,

original: snying du sdug pa'i bu bya ba ma yin pa byed pa'i pha ltar nyes pa las bzlog pa 'ba' zhig gi phyir brtse ba dang bcas pa'i sems kyis drag @106a * //🔽po'i sbyor ba ston pa yin te /🔽bya ba yin pa chung du byed pas nyes pa can du gyur pa la ni bskul zhing gleng bar byed do //
analyzed: snying du sdug pa'i bu bya ba ma yin pa byed pa'i pha ltar nyes pa las bzlog pa 'ba' zhig gi phyir brtse ba dang bcas pa'i sems kyis drag @106a * // po'i sbyor ba ston pa yin te / bya ba yin pa chung du byed pas nyes pa can du gyur pa la ni bskul zhing gleng bar byed do //
translated: or like a father whose dear son is doing what should not be done, with a mind full of affection, he teaches the application of harshness.🔽He encourages and admonishes those who have become guilty by doing a small amount of what should not be done.

original: de bas nyes par spyod pa cher byas pa rnams la ni dmad pa dang ldan pa'i tshig gis spyo bar byed do //
analyzed: de bas nyes par spyod pa cher byas pa rnams la ni dmad pa dang ldan pa'i tshig gis spyo bar byed do //
translated: He reproaches with words of reproach those who have done much that should not be done.

original: skrod par byed pa ni gnas nas 'byin pa'o ;
analyzed: skrod par byed pa ni gnas nas 'byin pa'o ;
translated: He banishes those who are incorrigible.

original: / gzhan yang rnam grangs rnam par gzhag pa rig par bya ste /
analyzed: / gzhan yang rnam grangs rnam par gzhag pa rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, one should understand the arrangement of the categories.

original: chung ngu la ni gshe bar bya'o //
analyzed: chung ngu la ni gshe bar bya'o //
translated: In the case of a minor offense, one should scold.

original: 'bring la ni chad pa'i las so //
analyzed: 'bring la ni chad pa'i las so //
translated: In the case of a middling offense, one should punish.

original: chen po byas pa la ni bskrad pa'o //
analyzed: chen po byas pa la ni bskrad pa'o //
translated: In the case of a major offense, one should banish.🔽These three severe actions are established as beneficial and pleasant because they are motivated by the desire to benefit and bring happiness.

original: bya ba drag po gsum po 'di dag ni phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pas kun nas bslang pa yin pa'i phyir gzhan dag la yang phan pa dang bde bsgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: bya ba drag po gsum po 'di dag ni phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pas kun nas bslang pa yin pa'i phyir gzhan dag la yang phan pa dang bde bsgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says:

original: de la gleng ba gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de la gleng ba gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In this regard, whatever is said...

original: 'di dag gis ni da ltar gyi dus su sdug bsngal la yongs su gyur pa'i dus su bde bar 'gyur bar bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni da ltar gyi dus su sdug bsngal la yongs su gyur pa'i dus su bde bar 'gyur bar bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: By these [statements], it is shown that in the present time there is suffering, but in the future time there will be happiness.

original: de dag nyid la phan pa dang bde ba'i don du 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag nyid la phan pa dang bde ba'i don du 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are for the sake of benefit and happiness.

original: de dag la sbyor ba des bstan pa nyes pa byung ba rnams la nyes par mthong nas bshags shing phyin chad mi byed par sdom pa la sogs pa la gnas pas byas pa bshags shing phyis mi byed par sdom pas phan ba dang bde ba yang sgrub par🔽'gyur ro zhes bya bas phan pa dang bde ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag la sbyor ba des bstan pa nyes pa byung ba rnams la nyes par mthong nas bshags shing phyin chad mi byed par sdom pa la sogs pa la gnas pas byas pa bshags shing phyis mi byed par sdom pas phan ba dang bde ba yang sgrub par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas phan pa dang bde ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase and so on in the root text refers to the following: those who have committed offenses see them as faults and confess them by means of that practice. They then abide in the vow not to commit them again. Thus, they are established in benefit and happiness by confessing what they have done and by vowing not to do it again.

original: de las gzhan pa dag la yang phan pa dang bde ba'i don du 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de'i dus na nyes pa ma byas pa dag gis kyang de thos nas shin tu yang 'da' bar mi byed par sdom pa ni de dag la phan pa dag bde🔽ba sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dag la yang phan pa dang bde ba'i don du 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de'i dus na nyes pa ma byas pa dag gis kyang de thos nas shin tu yang 'da' bar mi byed par sdom pa ni de dag la phan pa dag bde ba sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: The phrase and so on in the root text refers to the following: those who have not committed offenses at that time also hear about this and refrain from committing offenses in the future. Thus, they are established in benefit and happiness.

original: bskrad pa yang gnyis te /🔽gtan du ba ma yin pa ni dus cung zhig nas phyir dgug pa'o //
analyzed: bskrad pa yang gnyis te / gtan du ba ma yin pa ni dus cung zhig nas phyir dgug pa'o //
translated: There are two kinds of banishment:🔽temporary and permanent. Temporary banishment is when one is banished for a period of time and then recalled.

original: gtan du ba ni phyis mi 'jug par gtan spangs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gtan du ba ni phyis mi 'jug par gtan spangs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Permanent banishment is when one is banished and never allowed to return.

original: nyes par spyad pa gang gis skal ba dang mi ldan par byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes par spyad pa gang gis skal ba dang mi ldan par byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are deprived of good fortune due to their misdeeds.

original: de la dang po ni de dag nyid dang gzhan la yang phan pa dang bde bar 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la dang po ni de dag nyid dang gzhan la yang phan pa dang bde bar 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The first is so called because it is beneficial and pleasurable for them and others.

original: phyis mi byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: phyis mi byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The second is so called because it is the cause for not committing them again.

original: gnyis pa ni gzhan dag nyid yang dang par bsrung bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni gzhan dag nyid yang dang par bsrung bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The third is so called because it protects others from committing them.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: slar mi dgug par bskrad pa gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: slar mi dgug par bskrad pa gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: “That which is expelled without being summoned again” means

original: rang yang nyams nas gzhan dag kyang nyams par byed par 'gyur @106b pas zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: rang yang nyams nas gzhan dag kyang nyams par byed par 'gyur @106b pas zhes byas nas so //
translated: that one’s own faults are destroyed and one causes the faults of others to be destroyed.

original: don de dag nyid kyi dbang du byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: don de dag nyid kyi dbang du byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: With regard to just these topics, the Bhagavān said:

original: sred dang 'dra ba'i nyams pa sol cig ces bka' stsal te /
analyzed: sred dang 'dra ba'i nyams pa sol cig ces bka' stsal te /
translated: “Destroy the loss that is like craving.”

original: sred zhes bya ba nas kyi rnam pa 'dra ba zhig dus gcig la skye ste /
analyzed: sred zhes bya ba nas kyi rnam pa 'dra ba zhig dus gcig la skye ste /
translated: Craving is like a type of loss that arises simultaneously.

original: de ma bsal na nas thams cad nyams par byed do //
analyzed: de ma bsal na nas thams cad nyams par byed do //
translated: If it is not eliminated, it destroys everything.

original: de bsal nas thams cad bzang por skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bsal nas thams cad bzang por skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When that is removed, everything will arise as excellent.

original: de bzhin du 'di yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in the same way.

original: yan lag gnyis dang ldan na rang gis yongs su smin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yan lag gnyis dang ldan na rang gis yongs su smin par 'gyur te /
translated: When endowed with two branches, one's own complete ripening occurs.

original: nus pa'i stobs dang / sgrub pa'i stobs kyis so //
analyzed: nus pa'i stobs dang / sgrub pa'i stobs kyis so //
translated: By the power of ability and the power of practice.

original: de la yan lag dang po'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: de la yan lag dang po'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: Regarding that, from the perspective of the first branch, it is said:

original: mthun pa'i chos kyang ston to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mthun pa'i chos kyang ston to zhes bya ba la /
translated: One also teaches the Dharma in accordance with that.

original: chos ston pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos ston pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means one is endowed with the ability to teach the Dharma.

original: gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the second, it is said:

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin du byed pa yang yin te zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin du byed pa yang yin te zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: One also acts in accordance with one's speech.

original: rang gi tshig dang mthun pa rang nyid rjes su zhugs pa ni chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la zhugs pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rang gi tshig dang mthun pa rang nyid rjes su zhugs pa ni chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la zhugs pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Being consistent with one's own words and personally engaged is called engaging in the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma.

original: de ltar na don dang mthun par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de ltar na don dang mthun par 'gyur gyi /
translated: In that way, it becomes consistent with the meaning.

original: gzhan du na mthun par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan du na mthun par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar smras pa /
translated: Otherwise, it would not be consistent.

original: de dang mthun par 'jug ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dang mthun par 'jug ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should engage in this in a manner that is consistent with that, as it is said.

original: mi mthun par zhugs par gyur na gzhan dag gi dpyas dang bzhad gad du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: mi mthun par zhugs par gyur na gzhan dag gi dpyas dang bzhad gad du 'gyur zhing /
translated: If one engages in a manner that is inconsistent with that, one will be the object of contempt and ridicule by others.

original: de'i tshig la gus pa byed par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras pa /
analyzed: de'i tshig la gus pa byed par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras pa /
translated: And, one's words will not be respected.

original: ci nas gzhan dag 'di skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ci nas gzhan dag 'di skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In order to avoid that, it is said, In such a way that others will say, etc.

original: rang nyid kyang gzhan gyis smin par bya ba yin na des gzhan dag smin par byed par ga la 'gyur zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang nyid kyang gzhan gyis smin par bya ba yin na des gzhan dag smin par byed par ga la 'gyur zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is not even able to ripen oneself, how can one possibly ripen others?

original: gzhan la bcol ba ni gang tshig gzung bar 'os pa dang / bla ma'i gnas su grags pa'i yan lag gnyis dang yang dag par ldan pa gzhan dag la gsol ba btab pas bcol bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan la bcol ba ni gang tshig gzung bar 'os pa dang / bla ma'i gnas su grags pa'i yan lag gnyis dang yang dag par ldan pa gzhan dag la gsol ba btab pas bcol bar bya'o //
translated: One should request others to teach, those who are worthy of being requested, who possess the two branches of being worthy of being heeded and being renowned as a teacher.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /🔽sems can rnams gang la shas cher dga' zhing gus pa yod par gyur la zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa / sems can rnams gang la shas cher dga' zhing gus pa yod par gyur la zhes bya ba la ;
translated: Therefore, it is said, In order to ripen sentient beings, etc.🔽 In order to ripen sentient beings, one should request others to teach, those who are worthy of being requested, who possess the two branches of being worthy of being heeded and being renowned as a teacher.

original: nus shing lcogs pa thabs dang ldan pa la bcol ba'o //
analyzed: nus shing lcogs pa thabs dang ldan pa la bcol ba'o //
translated: One should request others to teach, those who are worthy of being requested, who possess the two branches of being worthy of being heeded and being renowned as a teacher.🔽 One should request others to teach, those who are worthy of being requested, who possess the two branches of being worthy of being heeded and being renowned as a teacher.🔽 One should request others to teach, those who are worthy of being requested, who possess the two branches of being worthy of being heeded and being renowned as a teacher.🔽 One should request others to teach, those who are worthy of being requested, who possess the two branches of being worthy of being heeded and being renowned as a teacher.🔽 One should request others to teach, those who are worthy of being requested, who possess the two branches of being worthy of being heeded and being renowned as a teacher.🔽 One should request others to teach, those who are worthy of being requested, who possess the two branches of being worthy of being heeded and being renowned as a teacher.🔽 One should request others to teach, those who are worthy of being requested, who possess the two branches of being worthy of being heeded and being renowned as a teacher.🔽 One should request others to teach, those who are worthy of being requested, who possess the two branches of being worthy of being heeded and being renowned as a teacher.🔽 One should request others to teach, those

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: de yang chos bstan pa'i thabs shes shing zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de yang chos bstan pa'i thabs shes shing zhes bya ba la /
translated: And also knowing the means of teaching the Dharma.

original: legs par bslabs pa ni las de la mkhas par byas pas de lta bu'i rang bzhin ston pa'o //🔽bcol ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: legs par bslabs pa ni las de la mkhas par byas pas de lta bu'i rang bzhin ston pa'o // bcol ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Well-trained refers to the nature of one who is skilled in that activity.
In order to demonstrate the meaning of the request, he says:

original: ba'i phyir byed du 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ba'i phyir byed du 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to do that, one should engage in doing it.

original: de ltar bdag dang gzhan gnyi gas yongs su smin par bya ba yin no zhes gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar bdag dang gzhan gnyi gas yongs su smin par bya ba yin no zhes gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In this way, one should bring both oneself and others to full maturity. In order to clearly demonstrate this, he says:

original: bdag kyang byed cing gzhan la yang bcol nas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag kyang byed cing gzhan la yang bcol nas zhes bya ba la /
translated: Having done it oneself and having requested others to do it.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi yongs su smin pa'i thabs rnams yongs su smin pa ji lta bu zhig gi rgyur 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi yongs su smin pa'i thabs rnams yongs su smin pa ji lta bu zhig gi rgyur 'gyur zhe na /
translated: With regard to the question, “How does the means of bringing about full maturity, which has the characteristics that have been taught, become the cause of a certain kind of full maturity?,”

original: de nges par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de nges par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: in order to demonstrate this, he says:

original: rab tu dbye ba rnam pa drug go zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba rnam pa drug go zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: There are six kinds of full maturity.

original: thabs 'di dag gis ji ltar rigs par dbang po yongs su smin pa rnam pa gsum dang dge pa'i rtsa ba dang / shes pa la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: thabs 'di dag gis ji ltar rigs par dbang po yongs su smin pa rnam pa gsum dang dge pa'i rtsa ba dang / shes pa la yang de bzhin no //
translated: By these means, the faculties are fully matured in three ways, and so too are the roots of virtue and knowledge.

original: des na yongs su smin pa rnam pa smin pa drug gi rgyu dang thabs zhes brjod do //
analyzed: des na yongs su smin pa rnam pa smin pa drug gi rgyu dang thabs zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, the six kinds of full maturation are called causes and means.

original: sa drug la rnam par gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sgrib pa rnam pa gsum rab tu spangs pas phye ba yin te /
analyzed: sa drug la rnam par gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sgrib pa rnam pa gsum rab tu spangs pas phye ba yin te /
translated: The bodhisattvas who stand on the six stages are distinguished by the complete abandonment of three kinds of obscurations.

original: 'bras bu'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni gsum mo //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni gsum mo //
translated: The bodhisattvas who stand on the stage of result are the third.

original: sgrib pa rnam pa gsum ni pags pa la gnas pa lta bu dang / sha la gnas pa lta bu dang / rkang la gnas pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa rnam pa gsum ni pags pa la gnas pa lta bu dang / sha la gnas pa lta bu dang / rkang la gnas pa lta bu'o //
translated: The three kinds of obscurations are like skin diseases, like flesh diseases, and like bone diseases.

original: de dag spangs pas rab tu phye ba ni sa gsum la go rims bzhin te /
analyzed: de dag spangs pas rab tu phye ba ni sa gsum la go rims bzhin te /
translated: The three stages are distinguished by the abandonment of these three kinds of obscurations.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa dang nges pa'i sa la 'jug pa'i sa dang / mthar thug pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa dang nges pa'i sa la 'jug pa'i sa dang / mthar thug pa'i sa'o //
translated: They are the stage of pure universal responsibility, the stage of entering into the certainty of complete purity, and the stage of ultimate conclusion.

original: de dag la rab tu gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' lhag pa'i bsam pa ngag pa dang / nges pa'i sa la gnas pa dang / mthar thug par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de dag la rab tu gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' lhag pa'i bsam pa ngag pa dang / nges pa'i sa la gnas pa dang / mthar thug par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is well-established in those is of pure superior intention, is situated on the stage of certain, and is destined for ultimate perfection.

original: de dag gi spyod pa la nan tan byed pa'i sa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de dag gi spyod pa la nan tan byed pa'i sa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The stage of practice in their practice is also threefold.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa ni lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa la 'jug pa'i sbyor pa'i lam gyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa ni lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa la 'jug pa'i sbyor pa'i lam gyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The stage of devoted engagement is the nature of the path of preparation for entering the stage of pure superior intention.

original: spyod pa la nan tan byed pa'i sa dag ni nges pa'i sa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa la nan tan byed pa'i sa dag ni nges pa'i sa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: The stages of practice are for entering the stage of certainty.

original: nges pa'i spyod pa la nan tan byed pa'i sa la gnas pa ni mthar thug pa'i sa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i spyod pa la nan tan byed pa'i sa la gnas pa ni mthar thug pa'i sa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: The stage of practice in certain conduct is for entering the stage of ultimate perfection.

original: de dag bsdus na drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag bsdus na drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: When those are combined, there are six.

original: gang zag gi dbye bas gtan du yongs su smin pa dang / gtan du ma yin pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gang zag gi dbye bas gtan du yongs su smin pa dang / gtan du ma yin pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate the person who is definitely and indefinitely matured, it is said:

original: rigs la mi gnas pa dang / rigs la gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rigs la mi gnas pa dang / rigs la gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Those who are not situated in the lineage, those who are situated in the lineage, and so on.

original: rigs la mi gnas pa'i 'jig rten pa'i phun sum tshogs pa 'thob pa'i dbang du byas pa'i yongs su smin pa ni 'jig rten 'di pa tsam gyi phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: rigs la mi gnas pa'i 'jig rten pa'i phun sum tshogs pa 'thob pa'i dbang du byas pa'i yongs su smin pa ni 'jig rten 'di pa tsam gyi phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: The complete maturity that is the attainment of mundane excellence not based on the spiritual gene is the excellence of this mundane life alone.

original: de ni bde zhing @107b brtan par 'jug pa ma yin pas slar nyams par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni bde zhing @107b brtan par 'jug pa ma yin pas slar nyams par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Since it is not entered into with happiness and stability, it is subject to falling away.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: yang dang yang du phyir ldog cing yang dang yang du bya dgos pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang dang yang du phyir ldog cing yang dang yang du bya dgos pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: It must be done again and again, for it is subject to falling away.

original: yang dang yang du phyir ldog cing zhes bya ba de nyid kyi bshad pa ni yang dang yang du bya dgos ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang dang yang du phyir ldog cing zhes bya ba de nyid kyi bshad pa ni yang dang yang du bya dgos ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase “it must be done again and again” is explained by the phrase “it is subject to falling away.”

original: rigs la gnas pa rnams kyi ni snga ma las bzlog pa yin pas gtan du ba yin no //
analyzed: rigs la gnas pa rnams kyi ni snga ma las bzlog pa yin pas gtan du ba yin no //
translated: The complete maturity of those who possess the spiritual gene is the opposite of the above. Therefore, it is permanent.

original: mtshan nyid gang dang / mtshan ma gang dang / rtags gang gis sems can rnams kyi yongs su smin pa'i bye brag gcod cing nye bar mtshon par byed pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su smin pa'i mtshan nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gang dang / mtshan ma gang dang / rtags gang gis sems can rnams kyi yongs su smin pa'i bye brag gcod cing nye bar mtshon par byed pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su smin pa'i mtshan nyid du brjod do //
translated: What are the characteristics, what are the signs, what are the indications by which the distinctions in the full maturity of beings are discerned and revealed?

original: yang ma dor bsdu rgyu dang / 'bras bu'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: yang ma dor bsdu rgyu dang / 'bras bu'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Moreover, it is twofold, according to the distinction of the cause of full maturity and the result of full maturity.

original: rgyur gtogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rgyur gtogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The characteristic of that which is included in the cause is also twofold:

original: bsam pa dang / las kyi bye brag gis so //
analyzed: bsam pa dang / las kyi bye brag gis so //
translated: according to the distinction of aspiration and activity.

original: des na smras pa /
analyzed: des na smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: 'dun pa chung ba dang / sbyor ba chung ba yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dun pa chung ba dang / sbyor ba chung ba yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: weak aspiration and weak application.

original: 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dad pa chung ba'i sbyor ba gang yin pa de ni 'dun ba chung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dad pa chung ba'i sbyor ba gang yin pa de ni 'dun ba chung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: That application which is weak in aspiration, weak in vigor and weak in faith is weak aspiration.

original: rtag tu sbyor ba dang / gus par byed pa'i sbyor ba dang bral bas sbyor ba dman pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu sbyor ba dang / gus par byed pa'i sbyor ba dang bral bas sbyor ba dman pa'o //
translated: It is weak application because it is always devoid of respectful application.

original: 'bras bu yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The result is also twofold:

original: 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa'o //
translated: the undesirable and the desirable.

original: mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu 'thob pa dang / 'dod pa'i 'bras bu mi 'thob pa'i sbyor ba chung ngu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu 'thob pa dang / 'dod pa'i 'bras bu mi 'thob pa'i sbyor ba chung ngu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the small application that results in the undesirable result and the non-acquisition of the desirable result, he says:

original: ngan song rnams su'ang 'gro la /
analyzed: ngan song rnams su'ang 'gro la /
translated: he goes to the miserable realms

original: tshe 'di nyid la dge sbyong gi 'bras bu yang mi 'thob cing zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la dge sbyong gi 'bras bu yang mi 'thob cing zhes bya ba la /
translated: and does not obtain the result of the spiritual levels in this very life.

original: 'dun pa chung ba dang / sbyor ba chung ba'i phyir gnyen po'i phyogs chung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'dun pa chung ba dang / sbyor ba chung ba'i phyir gnyen po'i phyogs chung bar 'gyur la /
translated: Because of the small aspiration and the small application, the counteragent is small.

original: gnyen po'i phyogs chung ba'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mnan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs chung ba'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mnan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the small counteragent, he is overcome by the adverse elements.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mnan pas ngan song du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mnan pas ngan song du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because he is overcome by the adverse elements, he is reborn in the miserable realms.

original: smin pa 'bring la gnas par gyur pa ni nyan thos ni dus nges par mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: smin pa 'bring la gnas par gyur pa ni nyan thos ni dus nges par mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the śrāvaka who is situated in middling spiritual lineage obtains nirvāṇa at a specific time, he says:

original: tshe de nyid la dge sbyong gi 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshe de nyid la dge sbyong gi 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: In that very life, he attains the fruit of the sraddlia-ddhi.

original: tshe de nyid la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar ni mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshe de nyid la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar ni mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But he does not attain parinirviifJa in that very life.

original: yongs su smin pa'i mthar thug pa la gnas pa ni thams cad yod par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su smin pa'i mthar thug pa la gnas pa ni thams cad yod par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The one who is situated in the final stage of maturity has all of these.

original: rang sangs rgyas dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis yang rnam pa gsum du dbye bar bya ste /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis yang rnam pa gsum du dbye bar bya ste /
translated: The pratyekabuddha is also divided into three types.

original: de'i rjes su 'brangs nas 'dir yang tshul de bzhin du rig par @108a * //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'brangs nas 'dir yang tshul de bzhin du rig par @108a * //
translated: Following that, here also, the method should be understood in the same way.

original: bya'o // de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: bya'o // de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: ji lta ba de kho na bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ji lta ba de kho na bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: “One should understand it just as it is.”

original: gal te nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams yongs su smin pa'i 'bras bu 'thob pa mnyam par 'gyur na de dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bu la bye brag med pas gang zag gi dbye bas rnam par gzhag pa yang rigs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i🔽phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gal te nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams yongs su smin pa'i 'bras bu 'thob pa mnyam par 'gyur na de dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bu la bye brag med pas gang zag gi dbye bas rnam par gzhag pa yang rigs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: If the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas were to attain the same result of complete maturation, then there would be no difference between their causes and results, and it would not be reasonable to posit them as distinct types of persons.🔽To demonstrate this, he says:

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la /
translated: Why is that?

original: nyan thos kyi gtso bo dag dang / rang sangs rgyas dag la rgyu dang 'bras bu la bye brag med de /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi gtso bo dag dang / rang sangs rgyas dag la rgyu dang 'bras bu la bye brag med de /
translated: There is no difference between the causes and results of the principal śrāvakas and the pratyekabuddhas.

original: lam dang 'bras bu tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam dang 'bras bu tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because their paths and results are not distinct.

original: gnyi ga yang nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol ba'i rgyan dang ldan pa'i 'bras bu 'thob pa la bye brag med pa nyid do zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol ba'i rgyan dang ldan pa'i 'bras bu 'thob pa la bye brag med pa nyid do zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: To demonstrate that there is no difference in attaining the result endowed with the ornament of complete liberation from the afflictions, he says:

original: 'di yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is the case, etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams nyid ni gnas kyi khyad par mang ba'i phyir dang / yongs su smin pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po dang / sa'i sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams nyid ni gnas kyi khyad par mang ba'i phyir dang / yongs su smin pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po dang / sa'i sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The bodhisattvas themselves are taught in terms of the many different states, and in terms of their lesser, middling, and great evolutionary maturity, and the stages.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' mos pas spyod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' mos pas spyod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Again, the bodhisattva who is in the stage of action out of faith, etc.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa dang por gtogs pa zhes bya ba la bskal pa grangs med pa de rdzogs par 'gyur ba med pas de'i phyir bskal pa grangs med pa dang por gtogs pa zhes bya bas de'i mthar thug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa dang por gtogs pa zhes bya ba la bskal pa grangs med pa de rdzogs par 'gyur ba med pas de'i phyir bskal pa grangs med pa dang por gtogs pa zhes bya bas de'i mthar thug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Belonging to the first incalculable eon means that the first incalculable eon is not completed, and therefore it is called belonging to the first incalculable eon, because it is not completed.

original: dge ba rnam pa gsum dang bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge ba rnam pa gsum dang bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: He is deprived of the three kinds of virtue,

original: mngon par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has no realization.

original: de'i phyir de ngan 'gror yang res 'ga' 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ngan 'gror yang res 'ga' 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, he sometimes goes to the miserable destinies.

original: bsam pa khyad par can thob pa dang / spyod pa'i sa la rab tu zhugs pa'i phyir yongs su smin pa gnyis pa thob pa ni 'dun pa 'bring po dang / sbyor ba 'bring po dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam pa khyad par can thob pa dang / spyod pa'i sa la rab tu zhugs pa'i phyir yongs su smin pa gnyis pa thob pa ni 'dun pa 'bring po dang / sbyor ba 'bring po dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: One is endowed with middling aspiration and middling application.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu khyad par can dang / bral ba'i 'bras bu rtogs pa dang ldan pas ngan song du skye bar 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu khyad par can dang / bral ba'i 'bras bu rtogs pa dang ldan pas ngan song du skye bar 'gyur ba med do //
translated: One is not reborn in the lower realms, because one has realized the special result of the cause and the result of freedom.

original: de'i phyir mdo las /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo las /
translated: Therefore, a scripture declares:

original: de ni 'jigs pa lnga dang bral ba yin no zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'jigs pa lnga dang bral ba yin no zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: He is free from the five fears.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa dang po las 'das par gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro ;🔽/ gsum pa ni mthar thug pa thob par gyur cing /
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa dang po las 'das par gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro ; / gsum pa ni mthar thug pa thob par gyur cing /
translated: He has transcended the first incalculable eon.🔽The third is attained through obtaining the culmination of the path of application and the path of seeing.

original: bslab pa'i lam yongs su rdzogs par gyur nas dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam pa thams cad dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bslab pa'i lam yongs su rdzogs par gyur nas dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam pa thams cad dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: One is endowed with all the aspects of the roots of virtue.

original: rang bzhin gyis brling ba ni rab tu dang ba'i shugs kyis kun du bskyed pa'i phyir brling ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis brling ba ni rab tu dang ba'i shugs kyis kun du bskyed pa'i phyir brling ba'o //
translated: It is firm because it is generated by the force of faith.

original: rtag tu byed pa dang / gus par byed pa'i @108b sbyor ba las skyes pa'i phyir gsal ba'o //
analyzed: rtag tu byed pa dang / gus par byed pa'i @108b sbyor ba las skyes pa'i phyir gsal ba'o //
translated: It is clear because it arises from the application of constant and respectful practice.

original: yang bsam pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir brling ba'o //
analyzed: yang bsam pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir brling ba'o //
translated: Moreover, it is firm because it possesses the quality of intention.

original: spyor ba'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir gsal ba'o //
analyzed: spyor ba'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir gsal ba'o //
translated: It is clear because it possesses the quality of practice.

original: rgyu gnyi ga nyid kyis 'bras bu chen po nyid chen po zhes bya ba'i sgras sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu gnyi ga nyid kyis 'bras bu chen po nyid chen po zhes bya ba'i sgras sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The word “great” should be applied to both causes and to the effect.

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'i dbang du byas nas 'bras bu shin tu che ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'i dbang du byas nas 'bras bu shin tu che ba'o //
translated: The effect is a great maturation.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'i dbang du byas nas phan yon che ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'i dbang du byas nas phan yon che ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The benefit is great because of the concordant effect.

original: yang na skye ba gzhan gyi 'bras bu nyid ni 'bras bu shin tu che'o //
analyzed: yang na skye ba gzhan gyi 'bras bu nyid ni 'bras bu shin tu che'o //
translated: Or else, the effect in another life is a great effect.

original: mthong ba'i chos kyi 'bras bu nyid ni phan yon chen ba'i phyir zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos kyi 'bras bu nyid ni phan yon chen ba'i phyir zhes bya'o //
translated: The effect in this life is a great benefit.

original: mi brjed pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pas phyir mi ldog pa ste /
analyzed: mi brjed pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pas phyir mi ldog pa ste /
translated: It is irreversible because it is endowed with the practice of nonforgetting.

original: gnas pa'i cha dang mthun pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa'i cha dang mthun pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is conducive to stability.

original: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this meaning, he says:

original: yongs su mi nyams pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su mi nyams pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not subject to deterioration.

original: gong nas gong du khyad par gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir khyad par du 'gro ba'o //🔽de'i phyir mi g-yo ba zhes brjod de /
analyzed: gong nas gong du khyad par gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir khyad par du 'gro ba'o // de'i phyir mi g-yo ba zhes brjod de /
translated: It is progress because it is the cause of ever increasing distinction.

original: yongs su mi nyams pa nyid dang / khyad par du 'gro ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su mi nyams pa nyid dang / khyad par du 'gro ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is called immovable because it is the cause of nondeterioration and progress.

original: 'jig rten thams cad las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called extremely pure because it transcends all mundane states.

original: yongs su smin pa'i thabs 'di dag nyid las yongs su smin pa chung ngu'i rgyu nyid kyi ngo bo nyid dbye bas bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: yongs su smin pa'i thabs 'di dag nyid las yongs su smin pa chung ngu'i rgyu nyid kyi ngo bo nyid dbye bas bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate the essence of the cause of the small stage of complete maturation through a classification of these very means of complete maturation, he says:

original: zang zil las gyur pa'i yongs su smin pa gang yin pa de ni dman pa'i phyir dang / lus brtan par byed pa tsam gyi phyir dus ring por spyad kyang yongs su smin pa chung ngu'i rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: zang zil las gyur pa'i yongs su smin pa gang yin pa de ni dman pa'i phyir dang / lus brtan par byed pa tsam gyi phyir dus ring por spyad kyang yongs su smin pa chung ngu'i rgyu nyid do //
translated: That maturity which results from the influence of the elements is a cause of slight maturity because it is inferior and because it merely stabilizes the body, even though it may be practiced for a long time.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyis 'dun par byas pa yang dus re zhig tsam sems dad ba bskyed pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyis 'dun par byas pa yang dus re zhig tsam sems dad ba bskyed pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir de dang 'dra'o //
translated: That maturity which results from the influence of miracles is similar to that, because it is distinguished by the faith in the mind which is produced for a short time.

original: gsang ste chos brjod pa las gyur pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni zab mo ma yin pa'i chos brjod pa las gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gsang ste chos brjod pa las gyur pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni zab mo ma yin pa'i chos brjod pa las gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That maturity which results from the influence of the secret teaching of the Dharma refers to the influence of the teaching of the non-profound Dharma.

original: tha mal pa'i chos yongs su shes pa de yang de dag dang 'dra pa nyid do //
analyzed: tha mal pa'i chos yongs su shes pa de yang de dag dang 'dra pa nyid do //
translated: That knowledge of the ordinary Dharma is similar to that.

original: thos pa tsam gyis ba skyed pa thos pa'i rjes su 'brangs pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir de'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: thos pa tsam gyis ba skyed pa thos pa'i rjes su 'brangs pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir de'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: That maturity which results from the influence of the Dharma which is heard is of the nature of that, because it is distinguished by the faith which is produced by the mere hearing of the Dharma, and by the subsequent practice of that hearing.

original: de dag las gzhan dag ni dus kyi dbang gis chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen por yongs su smin pa'i rgyu nyid du bstan pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag las gzhan dag ni dus kyi dbang gis chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen por yongs su smin pa'i rgyu nyid du bstan pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: The others are taught as causes of complete ripening that are small, middling, or great due to the power of time.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi dbang gis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi dbang gis ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not taught as causes of complete ripening that are small, middling, or great due to their own nature.

original: de ltar re zhig rtsa ba'i dbye bas yongs su smin pa'i dbye ba rnam pa gsum bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig rtsa ba'i dbye bas yongs su smin pa'i dbye ba rnam pa gsum bstan nas /
translated: Thus, the three types of complete ripening have been taught in terms of their basic classification.

original: da ni rtsa ba'i rab tu bye bas so so'i dbye bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rtsa ba'i rab tu bye bas so so'i dbye bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the individual classifications in terms of their basic divisions,

original: re re la yang rnam pa gsum gsum gyi tshul du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: re re la yang rnam pa gsum gsum gyi tshul du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: it is said that each of them has three aspects.

original: @109a * // de dag la yang gong ma dang gong ma ma yin ba'i khyad par gyi dbye bas dbye ba dpag tu med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: @109a * // de dag la yang gong ma dang gong ma ma yin ba'i khyad par gyi dbye bas dbye ba dpag tu med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that they are classified as immeasurable due to the distinctions of higher and lower,🔽it is said that each of those three has three aspects.

original: gong nas gong du rab tu dbye ba'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba sa ni sems can dpag tu med pa yongs su smin par byed pa'i rgyu dang yon tan dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no
analyzed: gong nas gong du rab tu dbye ba'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba sa ni sems can dpag tu med pa yongs su smin par byed pa'i rgyu dang yon tan dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no
translated: The phrase “by the method of ever-increasing distinctions” indicates that the causes for the appearance of the Buddhas and bodhisattvas who are endowed with the virtues of bringing to maturity immeasurable sentient beings are the ten spiritual levels.🔽The phrase “by the method that has been taught” indicates that, except for the supplication by others, the bodhisattva’s spiritual qualities from the maturity of the faculties up to the maturity of knowledge and from the lesser maturity up to the great maturity bring to maturity the spiritual qualities that are conducive to becoming a Buddha.

original: // ji skad bstan pa'i thabs de dag gis gzhan gsol ba 'debs pa ma gtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rgyud la dbang po yongs su smin pa nas shes pa yongs su smin pa'i bar dang / yongs su smin pa chung du nas yongs su smin pa chen po'i bar gyis sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su smin par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /🔽de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: // ji skad bstan pa'i thabs de dag gis gzhan gsol ba 'debs pa ma gtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rgyud la dbang po yongs su smin pa nas shes pa yongs su smin pa'i bar dang / yongs su smin pa chung du nas yongs su smin pa chen po'i bar gyis sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su smin par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa / de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The phrase “in this regard” refers to the spiritual qualities that are conducive to becoming a Buddha.

original: de ltar na sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su smin par bya ba shugs kyis bstan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su smin par bya ba shugs kyis bstan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the phrase “in this regard” should be understood to indicate the spiritual qualities that are conducive to becoming a Buddha.

original: 'dra ba'i rgyu'i sbyor ba las byung ba mnyam par yongs su smin pa rnam pa gnyi ga rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dra ba'i rgyu'i sbyor ba las byung ba mnyam par yongs su smin pa rnam pa gnyi ga rig par bya'o //
translated: The maturation of both should be understood as occurring through the application of similar causes.

original: ji ltar byas nas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas nas she na /
translated: How is this?

original: spyor ba gang gis sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed cing /
analyzed: spyor ba gang gis sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed cing /
translated: The bodhisattva perfects sentient beings through a certain application,🔽and the continuum of sentient beings becomes a fit vessel for the attainment of the three vehicles.

original: sems can rnams theg pa gsum gyis 'thob pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i rgyud snod du rung bar gyur pa ltar sbyor ba de nyid kyis bdag nyid kyi rgyud kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su 'thob pa dang rjes su mthun pa nyid kyis gnas par byed par
analyzed: sems can rnams theg pa gsum gyis 'thob pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i rgyud snod du rung bar gyur pa ltar sbyor ba de nyid kyis bdag nyid kyi rgyud kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su 'thob pa dang rjes su mthun pa nyid kyis gnas par byed par
translated: Through that very application, the bodhisattva's own continuum becomes a fit vessel for the attainment of the qualities of a buddha.

original: 'gyur bas ni gnyi ga yongs su smin pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gyur bas ni gnyi ga yongs su smin pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, both become causes for the maturation of the other.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas las yongs su smin pa'i le'u bshad pa ste drug pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas las yongs su smin pa'i le'u bshad pa ste drug pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the sixth chapter of the Bodhisattvabhumi, called the “Maturation Chapter.”

original: // / sgrub pa dang rtsom pa thams cad kyi 'bras bu ni spang ba dang nye bar blang ba yin pas spangs pa dang nye bar blangs pa'i 'bras bu nyid 'dir yang bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: // / sgrub pa dang rtsom pa thams cad kyi 'bras bu ni spang ba dang nye bar blang ba yin pas spangs pa dang nye bar blangs pa'i 'bras bu nyid 'dir yang bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Since the fruit of all practice and undertaking is abandonment and taking up, in order to demonstrate the fruit of abandonment and taking up here, he says:

original: spangs pa rnam pa gnyis dang / ye shes rnam pa gnyis la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: spangs pa rnam pa gnyis dang / ye shes rnam pa gnyis la zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the two kinds of abandonment and the two kinds of intuition.

original: rnam pa gnyis smos pa ni byang chub gzhan rnam par bcad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis smos pa ni byang chub gzhan rnam par bcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The expression “two kinds” is for the purpose of excluding other kinds of enlightenment.

original: byang chub gzhan ni rnam pa gcig spangs pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: byang chub gzhan ni rnam pa gcig spangs pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Other kinds of enlightenment have the nature of intuition that abandons only one kind.

original: yang bla na med pa'i byang chub ni rten yongs su gyur par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: yang bla na med pa'i byang chub ni rten yongs su gyur par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, unsurpassed enlightenment should be described as the transformation of the basis.

original: rten yongs su gyur pa yang rnam pa gnyis kyis rab tu phye ba ste /
analyzed: rten yongs su gyur pa yang rnam pa gnyis kyis rab tu phye ba ste /
translated: And the transformation of the basis is distinguished in two ways:

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams dang bral ba'i rnam pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams la 'jug pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams dang bral ba'i rnam pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams la 'jug pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: as the aspect of freedom from the dharmas of affliction and as the aspect of entry into the dharmas of purification.

original: de'i phyir rnam @109b pa gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam @109b pa gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “two aspects.”

original: yang chos kyi sku gtso bor gyur pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub po zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: yang chos kyi sku gtso bor gyur pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub po zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Moreover, in order to teach that the Dharma Body is preeminent, it is said, “unsurpassed perfect full enlightenment.”

original: chos kyi sku ni de bzhin nyid yang dag pa'i ngo bo tsam ste yang dag pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni de bzhin nyid yang dag pa'i ngo bo tsam ste yang dag pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The Dharma Body is suchness, the mere essence of reality, called “pure exalted wisdom.”

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:🔽The exhaustion of all obscurations,

original: sgrib pa thams cad zad pa dang // dkar po'i chos kun gyis gang nyid //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad zad pa dang // dkar po'i chos kun gyis gang nyid //
translated: and being filled with all virtuous things,

original: de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid //🔽ye shes de ni gzhan du 'dod //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid // ye shes de ni gzhan du 'dod //
translated: is the essence of suchness.

original: ces bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bstan pa yin no //
translated: That is asserted to be wisdom.

original: de yang kun brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rnam par gzhag pa'i ngo bo nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang kun brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rnam par gzhag pa'i ngo bo nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, the transformation of the imagined and dependent natures into the perfected nature is taught to be the essence of unsurpassed perfect full enlightenment.

original: da la gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa ni spangs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: da la gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa ni spangs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The nature of the other-dependent that has become the nature of the perfected is called “abandonment.”

original: kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yongs su grub par gyur pa ni ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yongs su grub par gyur pa ni ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: The imagined nature that has become the perfected is called “gnosis.”

original: nyon mongs pa'i dri ma thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dri ma thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir dri ma med pa'o //
translated: It is stainless because it is free from all the stains of the afflictions.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is also twofold:

original: nyon mongs pa zad par byed pa'i ye shes dang / nyon mongs pa zad pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa zad par byed pa'i ye shes dang / nyon mongs pa zad pa'i ye shes so //
translated: the gnosis that eliminates the afflictions and the gnosis that is the elimination of the afflictions.

original: de la dang po ni ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par grol bas rnam par grol ba'i phyir dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: de la dang po ni ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par grol bas rnam par grol ba'i phyir dri ma med pa'o //
translated: The first is stainless because it is liberated through being liberated by nature.🔽The second is stainless because it is liberated through being liberated from the continuum.

original: yang gnyis pa ni rgyud rnam par grol bas rnam par grol ba'i phyir des na dri ma med pa'o zhes brjod nas dang po las rnam par bcad pa'i phyir smras pa ;
analyzed: yang gnyis pa ni rgyud rnam par grol bas rnam par grol ba'i phyir des na dri ma med pa'o zhes brjod nas dang po las rnam par bcad pa'i phyir smras pa ;
translated: Having stated this, in order to distinguish it from the first, it is said:

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad dang / rjes su 'brel ba med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad dang / rjes su 'brel ba med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not associated with any of the afflictions.

original: thogs pa med pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: In order to teach unobstructedness, he says, “with unobstructed knowledge.”

original: rnam grangs gnyis pa ni spangs pa'i bye brag gis ye shes kyi dbye ba byas nas byang chub bstan pa'i phyir des na smras pa /
analyzed: rnam grangs gnyis pa ni spangs pa'i bye brag gis ye shes kyi dbye ba byas nas byang chub bstan pa'i phyir des na smras pa /
translated: In the second enumeration, he teaches enlightenment by making a division of knowledge through a division of abandonment, and so he says:

original: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags thams cad yang dag par bcom pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags thams cad yang dag par bcom pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “having completely destroyed all the latent propensities of the afflictions,” and so on.🔽In order to teach the division of abandonment through four aspects, he says, “having completely abandoned the afflictions together with their latent propensities,” and so on.

original: rnam pa bzhis spangs pa'i bye brag bstan par bya ba'i phyir bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pas ni dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams las so //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhis spangs pa'i bye brag bstan par bya ba'i phyir bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pas ni dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams las so //
translated: The abandonment of the afflictions together with their latent propensities is the abandonment of the arhats and pratyekabuddhas.

original: spangs pa'i khyad par bstan pa nyid nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas ni slob pa rnams las so //
analyzed: spangs pa'i khyad par bstan pa nyid nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas ni slob pa rnams las so //
translated: The teaching of the difference in abandonment is the abandonment of all afflictions, which is the abandonment of the learners.

original: thams cad du spangs pas ni mi slob pa rnams las so //
analyzed: thams cad du spangs pas ni mi slob pa rnams las so //
translated: The abandonment of all is the abandonment of the nonlearners.

original: thams cad las spangs pa dang / shin tu thams cad du spangs pas 'jig rten pa rnams las te /
analyzed: thams cad las spangs pa dang / shin tu thams cad du spangs pas 'jig rten pa rnams las te /
translated: The abandonment of all and the complete abandonment of all is the abandonment of the mundane.

original: rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba ni gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba dang / mtshan ma'i 'ching ba las so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba ni gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba dang / mtshan ma'i 'ching ba las so //
translated: In every way means from the bondage of negative tendencies and the bondage of signs.

original: de lta bu ni re zhig spangs pa'i khyad par yin @110a * //
analyzed: de lta bu ni re zhig spangs pa'i khyad par yin @110a * //
translated: Such is the distinctive abandonment for the time being.

original: no ; / spangs pa'i khyad par de ni rnam par dag pa'i ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: no ; / spangs pa'i khyad par de ni rnam par dag pa'i ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: That distinctive abandonment is called the wisdom of purification.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate omniscience,🔽it says,

original: khams thams cad dang / dngos po thams cad dang / rnam pa thams cad dang / dus thams cad du shes pa gang yin pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khams thams cad dang / dngos po thams cad dang / rnam pa thams cad dang / dus thams cad du shes pa gang yin pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of all aspects, bases, and times is called omniscience.

original: de ni khams dang ; dngos po dang / rnam pa'i dbye ba thams cad dang / dus gsum po kun shes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ni khams dang ; dngos po dang / rnam pa'i dbye ba thams cad dang / dus gsum po kun shes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That means the knowledge of all the divisions of aspects, bases, and the three times.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams rnams kyi yang ming dang khyad par la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin yang dag par rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams rnams kyi yang ming dang khyad par la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin yang dag par rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He also knows the names, distinctions, and so forth of the world systems just as they are.

original: sems can gyi 'jig rten yang ming dang rigs la sogs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: sems can gyi 'jig rten yang ming dang rigs la sogs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He also knows the world of sentient beings, their names, their clans, and so on, just as they are.

original: khams de dag tu 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi ngos po rnams kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: khams de dag tu 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi ngos po rnams kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He also knows the conditioned and unconditioned things that exist in those realms just as they are.

original: dngos po rnams kyi phyi ma'i rigs kyi rnam pa'i dbye ba yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi phyi ma'i rigs kyi rnam pa'i dbye ba yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He also knows the classification of the future states of those things just as they are.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba rnams kyang ngo //
translated: The classification of their individual characteristics, their general characteristics, and their characteristics as causes and effects.

original: khams dang / 'gro ba dang / skye gnas la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i dbye ba yang ngo //
analyzed: khams dang / 'gro ba dang / skye gnas la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i dbye ba yang ngo //
translated: The classification of their realms, destinies, birth processes, and so on.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus rnams kyi dbye ba yang mkhyen pas thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus rnams kyi dbye ba yang mkhyen pas thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: And he knows the classification of the past and so on, so he is called omniscient.

original: dgongs pa tsam dang rab tu 'brel bar 'jug pa'i ye shes ni chags pa med pa'i ye shes so// dgongs pa tsam dang 'brel ba nyid ni phyi ma phyi ma'i tshig gis ston par byed pas so //
analyzed: dgongs pa tsam dang rab tu 'brel bar 'jug pa'i ye shes ni chags pa med pa'i ye shes so// dgongs pa tsam dang 'brel ba nyid ni phyi ma phyi ma'i tshig gis ston par byed pas so //
translated: The connection with only intention is shown by the subsequent phrases.

original: thogs pa med cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: thogs pa med cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Unimpeded, etc.

original: de ma thag tu shes pas na thogs pa med do //
analyzed: de ma thag tu shes pas na thogs pa med do //
translated: It is unimpeded because it knows immediately.

original: des na smras pa /
analyzed: des na smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said to be

original: myur bar zhes bya ste /
analyzed: myur bar zhes bya ste /
translated: swift.

original: bsgribs pa med par 'jug pas na chags pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bsgribs pa med par 'jug pas na chags pa med pa'o //
translated: It is unattached because it engages without obstruction.

original: de lta bu'i ye shes ni dgongs pa tsam gyis grub pa'i ye shes zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: de lta bu'i ye shes ni dgongs pa tsam gyis grub pa'i ye shes zhes kyang bya /
translated: Such wisdom is also called wisdom that is accomplished by mere intention.

original: lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: It is also called spontaneously accomplished wisdom.

original: lan cig dgongs pa dang 'brel pas dgongs pa tsam gyis grub ye zhes so //
