analyzed: lan cig dgongs pa dang 'brel pas dgongs pa tsam gyis grub ye zhes so //
translated: It is called wisdom that is accomplished by mere intention because it is accomplished by mere intention once.

original: yang dang yang du dgongs par bya mi dgos pas lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dang yang du dgongs par bya mi dgos pas lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called spontaneously accomplished wisdom because it does not need to be intentionally accomplished again and again.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said

original: ye shes de yang dang yang du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes de yang dang yang du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: That intuition is also repeated, and so on.

original: rnam grangs gsum pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad nyid byang chub ces bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam grangs gsum pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad nyid byang chub ces bstan pa yin no //
translated: The third alternative teaches that all the qualities of a Buddha are enlightenment.

original: yangs na gzugs kyi skud dang ming gi sku ni sangs rgyas nyid kyi byang chub po zhes bstan pa @110b yin no //
analyzed: yangs na gzugs kyi skud dang ming gi sku ni sangs rgyas nyid kyi byang chub po zhes bstan pa @110b yin no //
translated: The fourth alternative teaches that the form body and the name body are the enlightenment of Buddhahood.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa la sogs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi nang du ma gtogs pas tha dad kyi tshig gis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa la sogs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi nang du ma gtogs pas tha dad kyi tshig gis bstan pa yin no //
translated: The fifth alternative teaches that the unentangled qualities of a Buddha are distinct from the other qualities, since they are not included among them.

original: rgyu'i gnas skabs na chen bdun dang ldan pas theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i gnas skabs na chen bdun dang ldan pas theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the Great Vehicle because it possesses seven greatnesses in the causal stage.

original: yang de'i 'bras bu ni dam pa rnam pa bdun dang ldan pas mchog tu bla na med pa'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: yang de'i 'bras bu ni dam pa rnam pa bdun dang ldan pas mchog tu bla na med pa'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Again, it is taught that its result is supreme and unsurpassed because it possesses seven kinds of supremacy.

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: To demonstrate this, he says:🔽Therein, the supremacy of the support is due to the perfection of the two kinds of body of the Buddha, the Dharma Body and the Bliss Body.

original: yang na rnam pa bdun gyis nyan thos la sogs pa'i byang chub rnam par spyad nas byang chub chen po khyad par du bstan pa'i phyir de la byang chub dam pa 'di ni zhes bya ba ni khyad par rnam pa bdun po 'di dag nyid kyi dam pa
analyzed: yang na rnam pa bdun gyis nyan thos la sogs pa'i byang chub rnam par spyad nas byang chub chen po khyad par du bstan pa'i phyir de la byang chub dam pa 'di ni zhes bya ba ni khyad par rnam pa bdun po 'di dag nyid kyi dam pa
translated: Or else, after analyzing the enlightenments of the Sravakas, etc. by way of the seven aspects, he teaches the supremacy of the great enlightenment.

original: dang / bla na med pa dang ; rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang / byang chub chen po zhes kyang brjod do //
analyzed: dang / bla na med pa dang ; rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang / byang chub chen po zhes kyang brjod do //
translated: In this regard, this supreme enlightenment is also called the highest, the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, and great enlightenment.

original: dam pa bdun zhes bya ba ni de'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: dam pa bdun zhes bya ba ni de'i rnam grangs so //
translated: The seven aspects of supremacy are synonyms for it.

original: dam pa rnam pa bdun rnam par gzhag pa las byang chub kyi rten gyi dbang du byas pa ni dang po'o //
analyzed: dam pa rnam pa bdun rnam par gzhag pa las byang chub kyi rten gyi dbang du byas pa ni dang po'o //
translated: The seven aspects of supremacy are established in terms of the basis of enlightenment, etc. The first is in terms of the basis of enlightenment.

original: de yang gang las 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang las 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: And from what does it arise?

original: sgrub pa'i khyad par las yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i khyad par las yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to show that it is from the supremacy of practice, he says:

original: sgrub pa dam pa nyid do //
analyzed: sgrub pa dam pa nyid do //
translated: The supremacy of practice.

original: de ltar 'di gnyis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'di gnyis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: Thus, these two are established as cause and effect.

original: de lta bu'i rten dam pa la gnas pa ni phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan bar 'gyur gyi rgud par ni mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rten dam pa la gnas pa ni phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan bar 'gyur gyi rgud par ni mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that one who abides in such a holy support becomes endowed with perfection and does not decline,

original: de'i rjes la phun sum tshogs pa dam pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la phun sum tshogs pa dam pa'o //
translated: after that, the holy perfection is explained.🔽In order to show that from such perfection, the distinctive wisdom arises,

original: de lta bu'i phun sum tshogs pa las ni ye shes kyi khyad par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir ye shes dam nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i phun sum tshogs pa las ni ye shes kyi khyad par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir ye shes dam nyid do //
translated: the holy wisdom is explained.🔽In order to show that one who is endowed with distinctive wisdom has such power,

original: ya shes khyad par can dang ldan pa la 'di lta bu'i mthu 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir de nas mthu dam pa nyid do //
analyzed: ya shes khyad par can dang ldan pa la 'di lta bu'i mthu 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir de nas mthu dam pa nyid do //
translated: the holy power is explained.🔽Since one who is powerful abandons the afflictions,

original: mthu dang ldan na kun nas nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur bas des na spangs pa dam pa nyid do //
analyzed: mthu dang ldan na kun nas nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur bas des na spangs pa dam pa nyid do //
translated: the holy abandonment is explained.🔽Since one who is endowed with abandonment abides without afflictions,

original: spangs pa dang ldan na kun nas nyon mongs pa med par gnas par 'gyur bas des gnas pa dam pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: spangs pa dang ldan na kun nas nyon mongs pa med par gnas par 'gyur bas des gnas pa dam pa nyid bstan to //
translated: the holy abiding is explained.

original: dam pa 'di dag tsam zhig smos pa ni gshegs pa thams cad kyis bstan pa ni dam pa rnam pa bdun po dag tu 'dus par bstan pa yin te /🔽gtso bor bstan pas 'dus par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam pa 'di dag tsam zhig smos pa ni gshegs pa thams cad kyis bstan pa ni dam pa rnam pa bdun po dag tu 'dus par bstan pa yin te / gtso bor bstan pas 'dus par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The teaching of all the Buddhas is included in these seven topics, because they are the principal teaching.

original: sems can thams cad kyi rten las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir sku dam pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi rten las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir sku dam pa'o //
translated: The body is the highest, because it transcends the support of all sentient beings.

original: yang de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rten du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rten du rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it should be known as the inconceivable support.

original: yang na shin tu mthar thug pa'i pha rol tu phyin par gyur pa ni dam pa zhes bya ste /🔽sems can thams cad kyi shes pa'i spyod yul las @111a * //
analyzed: yang na shin tu mthar thug pa'i pha rol tu phyin par gyur pa ni dam pa zhes bya ste / sems can thams cad kyi shes pa'i spyod yul las @111a * //
translated: Or, it is called the highest because it has gone to the other shore of the perfection of the highest.

original: yang dag par shin tu 'das bar byur pa'i sku yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par shin tu 'das bar byur pa'i sku yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the body that has gone to the other shore of the sphere of cognition of all sentient beings.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, it should be applied to the others.

original: gzhan su yang gnyi ga la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa dam pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan su yang gnyi ga la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa dam pa'o //
translated: There is no one else who has entered for the benefit of both, which is the highest practice.

original: tshul khrims bsam gyis mi khyab ba'i phyir tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims bsam gyis mi khyab ba'i phyir tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: It is the perfection of morality because morality is inconceivable.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang rig par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for the others.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi ni theg pa chen po'i mdo'i rjes su 'brangs nas gong na med pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi ni theg pa chen po'i mdo'i rjes su 'brangs nas gong na med pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: The four right discriminations should be understood as unexcelled in the Universal Vehicle.

original: mthu'i le'ur ji skad bstan pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas mngon par shes pa la sogs pa rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mthu'i le'ur ji skad bstan pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas mngon par shes pa la sogs pa rig par bya'o //
translated: The superknowledges, etc. should be understood as taught in the chapter on the powers.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i 'jug pa dang / gnas pa dang / ldang pa dang ldan pa ni gnas pa gong na med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i 'jug pa dang / gnas pa dang / ldang pa dang ldan pa ni gnas pa gong na med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Possessing the inconceivable entry, abiding, and emergence, it is the unexcelled abiding.

original: yang na dmigs pa dang / rnam pa'i dbye bas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: yang na dmigs pa dang / rnam pa'i dbye bas kyang rung ste /
translated: Or else, it is also by the classification of objective supports and aspects,

original: ji ltar rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: ji ltar rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: as is appropriate.

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal 'jug pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs nyid kyis 'phags pa'i gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal 'jug pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs nyid kyis 'phags pa'i gnas pa'o //
translated: It is the noble abiding because it is the antidote to the entry of the suffering of conditioned existence.

original: yul gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pas na lha'i gnas pa'o //
analyzed: yul gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pas na lha'i gnas pa'o //
translated: It is the divine state because it is the antidote to the defilement-related and painful aspects of the object.

original: sems can gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pas na tshangs pa'i gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pas na tshangs pa'i gnas pa'o //
translated: It is the Brahmā state because it is the antidote to the defilement-related suffering of sentient beings.

original: re re la yang rnam pa bzhi bzhir dbye ba byas nas gnas pa rnam pa bcu gnyis su 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: re re la yang rnam pa bzhi bzhir dbye ba byas nas gnas pa rnam pa bcu gnyis su 'gyur ro ;
translated: Each of these is divided into four aspects, making twelve states.

original: / de dag las de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir smras pa gnas pa gsum po de dag las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: / de dag las de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir smras pa gnas pa gsum po de dag las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The Tathāgata’s state is established among these, and so he says, “And among these three states,” and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa stong pa nyid kyi gnas pas gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa stong pa nyid kyi gnas pas gnas pa yin te /
translated: The Tathāgata is the state of emptiness,

original: stong pa nyid kyi gnas pas mang du gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi gnas pas mang du gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: because he is the state of emptiness, and because he abides in the state of emptiness.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni spros pa dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol ba nyid kyi phyir 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la gnas pa dang / yon tan thams cad kyi rten du gyur pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni spros pa dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol ba nyid kyi phyir 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la gnas pa dang / yon tan thams cad kyi rten du gyur pa'i phyir dang /
translated: Because he is the support of all virtues and because he is a clear and serviceable samadhi, he abides in the unshakable.

original: gsal zhing las su rung ba'i ting nge 'dzin yin pa'i phyir mi g-yo bas gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs nas thugs rje chen po dang ldan pas snying rje chen po la mang du gnas pa dang /
analyzed: gsal zhing las su rung ba'i ting nge 'dzin yin pa'i phyir mi g-yo bas gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs nas thugs rje chen po dang ldan pas snying rje chen po la mang du gnas pa dang /
translated: Because he surveys the world with the eye of a Buddha and because he abides in great compassion with his great compassion,

original: bar du zhes bya ba'i sgras dad pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / gtong ba dang / tshul khrims dang / shes rab phun sum tshogs pas rgyun du @111b zhugs pa la sogs pa nas bzung pa'o //
analyzed: bar du zhes bya ba'i sgras dad pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / gtong ba dang / tshul khrims dang / shes rab phun sum tshogs pas rgyun du @111b zhugs pa la sogs pa nas bzung pa'o //
translated: the word “also” indicates that he abides in the stream-enterer and so on, with his perfect faith, generosity, morality and wisdom.

original: skyes bu chen po nyid kyis ni de'i rnam grangs rig par bya ste /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po nyid kyis ni de'i rnam grangs rig par bya ste /
translated: The greatness of the person should be understood as a synonym for these.

original: skyes bu mchog dang / skyes bu gtso bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu mchog dang / skyes bu gtso bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The term supreme being and foremost being are examples of this.

original: thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir rjes su brtse ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir rjes su brtse ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The term compassionate and so on are examples of the enumeration of great compassion.

original: tshul khrims chen po nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir bla na med pa'i tshul khrims la sogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims chen po nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir bla na med pa'i tshul khrims la sogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The term unsurpassed morality and so on are examples of the enumeration of great morality.

original: ye shes dam pa'i rnam grangs ni shes rab chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes dam pa'i rnam grangs ni shes rab chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The term great wisdom and so on are examples of the enumeration of supreme wisdom.

original: mthu dam pa ni grags pa chen po la sogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mthu dam pa ni grags pa chen po la sogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The term great fame and so on are examples of the enumeration of supreme power.

original: spangs pa dam pa na rnam par grol ba'i sems la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: spangs pa dam pa na rnam par grol ba'i sems la sogs pa'o //
translated: The term liberated mind and so on are examples of the enumeration of supreme abandonment.

original: gnas pa dam pa ni bde bar gnas pa dang / reg par gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa dam pa ni bde bar gnas pa dang / reg par gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsdus pa'o //
translated: The term pleasant abiding and comfortable abiding and so on are examples of the enumeration of supreme abiding.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi yon tan thams cad kyi ming bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi yon tan thams cad kyi ming bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the terms for all the qualities of the Tathagatas should be understood as explained.

original: mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis kyis byang chub chen po zhes brjod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis kyis byang chub chen po zhes brjod par rig par bya ste /
translated: In brief, it should be understood that great enlightenment is described in two ways:

original: ngo bo nyid dang / bye brag nyid do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang / bye brag nyid do //
translated: in terms of its nature and in terms of its varieties.

original: de la ngo po nyid kyi rnam pa ni gsum du bstan to //
analyzed: de la ngo po nyid kyi rnam pa ni gsum du bstan to //
translated: In this regard, its nature is described in three ways.

original: bye brag gi rnam pa ni bzhir bstan to //
analyzed: bye brag gi rnam pa ni bzhir bstan to //
translated: Its varieties are described in four ways.

original: dam pa nyid dang ste dam pa rnam pa bdun dang ldan pa nyid do //
analyzed: dam pa nyid dang ste dam pa rnam pa bdun dang ldan pa nyid do //
translated: It is supreme, in that it is endowed with seven kinds of supremacy.

original: yang de'i rnam pa bdun dang ldan pa'i rnam pa ni bstan cing brjod zin pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: yang de'i rnam pa bdun dang ldan pa'i rnam pa ni bstan cing brjod zin pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The seven varieties of supremacy have already been described and discussed in the above passages that describe the nature of enlightenment.

original: da ni yon tan mngon par brjod cing dran pa'i rnam pa bstan par 'dod nas smras pa /
analyzed: da ni yon tan mngon par brjod cing dran pa'i rnam pa bstan par 'dod nas smras pa /
translated: Now, wishing to teach and describe the varieties of the recollection of its excellences, he says:

original: rnam pa bcus de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽de lta bu'i tshul du nyan thos la sogs pa rnams byang chub chen po de dag dang yid kyis yang dag par sgrub par byed pa'am /
analyzed: rnam pa bcus de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / de lta bu'i tshul du nyan thos la sogs pa rnams byang chub chen po de dag dang yid kyis yang dag par sgrub par byed pa'am /
translated: By these ten aspects, the tathāgatas are to be recollected.

original: bsod nams 'phel ba'i sgo nas kyang dran par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsod nams 'phel ba'i sgo nas kyang dran par bya ba'o //
translated: In this way, the disciples and so forth should recollect the great enlightenment of the tathāgatas by way of their mind, or by way of the increase of their merit.

original: rnam pa bcus zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bcu'i bye brag gis yon tan bstan pa rnams te /
analyzed: rnam pa bcus zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bcu'i bye brag gis yon tan bstan pa rnams te /
translated: The ten aspects are the tenfold distinctions in the teaching of the virtues.

original: rnam pa bcu po nyid kyis yongs su bsdus par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu po nyid kyis yongs su bsdus par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They are included in the ten aspects themselves.

original: mdor bsdu na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi yon tan brjod cing dran pa ni gnas skabs rnam pa gsum gyis bsdus par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi yon tan brjod cing dran pa ni gnas skabs rnam pa gsum gyis bsdus par 'gyur te /
translated: In brief, the expression and recollection of the virtues of the transcendent lords, the buddhas, is included in three circumstances:🔽the circumstance of the cause, the circumstance of the effect, and the circumstance of the activity of benefiting sentient beings.🔽In brief, the expression and recollection of the virtues of the transcendent lords, the buddhas, is included in three circumstances:

original: rgyu'i gnas skabs dang / 'bras bu'i gnas skabs dang / sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i bya ba'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: rgyu'i gnas skabs dang / 'bras bu'i gnas skabs dang / sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i bya ba'i gnas skabs so //
translated: the circumstance of the cause, the circumstance of the effect, and the circumstance of the activity of benefiting sentient beings.

original: ji skad du /🔽shin tu dka' ba'i tshogs bsags pas //
analyzed: ji skad du / shin tu dka' ba'i tshogs bsags pas //
translated: As it is said:🔽Having attained the unsurpassed Dharma of buddhahood

original: bla med sangs rgyas chos thob nas //🔽'gro ba'i don gyi bya ba nyid //
analyzed: bla med sangs rgyas chos thob nas // 'gro ba'i don gyi bya ba nyid //
translated: through the accumulation of the extremely difficult collection,🔽the buddhas consider the activity

original: sangs rgyas rjes su dgongs pa mdzad //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dgongs pa mdzad //
translated: of benefiting migrating beings.

original: ces bya bas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya bas bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is taught.

original: @112a * // 'dir ni mngon par byang chub pa bstan pa'i dbang du byas nas 'bras bu'i gnas skabs nyid kyi skabs bstan pa /
analyzed: @112a * // 'dir ni mngon par byang chub pa bstan pa'i dbang du byas nas 'bras bu'i gnas skabs nyid kyi skabs bstan pa /
translated: Here, in terms of the teaching of manifest enlightenment, the circumstance of the effect itself is taught.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni mtshan bstan pa yin gyi yon tan bstan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni mtshan bstan pa yin gyi yon tan bstan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The Blessed One is so called because he is endowed with the ten powers, the four forms of fearlessness, and the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddhas.

original: de bzhin te phyin ca ma log par ro //🔽gshegs pa ni gsung ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin te phyin ca ma log par ro // gshegs pa ni gsung ba ste /
translated: The word “thus” indicates that he is not mistaken.🔽The word “gone” indicates that he is a speaker.🔽He is a speaker who is not mistaken.

original: phyin ci ma log par gsung ba ni gshegs pa ste /🔽yi ge de ltar byas nas so //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log par gsung ba ni gshegs pa ste / yi ge de ltar byas nas so //
translated: The word “gone” is used in this sense because he has gone to the state of being a speaker who is not mistaken.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /

analyzed: mkhas pas bdag nyid 'dul bar byed //
translated: the wise one tames himself.

original: ces bya bas de ltar na bdag tu gyur pa dang / skyes bur gyur pa'i sems 'dul bar byed pa'i thabs shes pa ni skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba zhes bcom ldan 'das la brjod do //
analyzed: ces bya bas de ltar na bdag tu gyur pa dang / skyes bur gyur pa'i sems 'dul bar byed pa'i thabs shes pa ni skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba zhes bcom ldan 'das la brjod do //
translated: Thus, the one who knows the means of taming the mind, which is the self and the person, is called the “tamer of persons” and the “charioteer” in regard to the Blessed One.

original: bla na med pa ni gdul bar dka' ba'i sems 'dul bar byed pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa'i bde ba'i thabs dang / shin tu yang don gyi mchog mya ngan las 'das pa la 'dul bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa ni gdul bar dka' ba'i sems 'dul bar byed pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa'i bde ba'i thabs dang / shin tu yang don gyi mchog mya ngan las 'das pa la 'dul bar byed pa'o //
translated: “Unsurpassed” means that he tames the mind which is difficult to tame, and he tames it by means of the path which is free from sin and which is the supreme goal, nirvana.

original: yang dag par ston cing rnam par brjod pas na ston pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par ston cing rnam par brjod pas na ston pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called the “teacher” because he teaches and explains.

original: ci zhig ston zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig ston zhe na /
translated: What does he teach?

original: smras pa / sdug bsngal thams cad las 'byung ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: smras pa / sdug bsngal thams cad las 'byung ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: He teaches the “cessation of all suffering.”

original: sdug bsngal thams cad ni khams gsum pa'i ngan 'gro'i sdug bsngal dang / yang srid kyi sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad ni khams gsum pa'i ngan 'gro'i sdug bsngal dang / yang srid kyi sdug bsngal lo //
translated: “All suffering” refers to the suffering of the lower realms in the three realms and the suffering of rebirth.

original: de las nges par 'byung ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de las nges par 'byung ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The means of certain deliverance is twofold, according to the distinction between cause and effect.🔽It is the means of certain deliverance,

original: 'dis nges par 'byung bas sam /🔽'dir nges par 'byung bas zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: 'dis nges par 'byung bas sam / 'dir nges par 'byung bas zhes byas nas so //
translated: or it is certain deliverance itself.

original: de dag gis ni lam dang / lam gyi 'bras bu yang dag par bstan cing brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag gis ni lam dang / lam gyi 'bras bu yang dag par bstan cing brjod pa yin te /
translated: By these two verses, the path and the result of the path are taught and explained.

original: lam ston cing 'bras bu rnam par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: lam ston cing 'bras bu rnam par brjod pa yin no //
translated: The path is taught and the result is explained.

original: yang thob par bya ba ston zhing thob par byed pa'i thabs rnam par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: yang thob par bya ba ston zhing thob par byed pa'i thabs rnam par brjod pa'o //
translated: Or else, the means of attaining is taught and the method of attaining is explained.

original: yang na don de nyid yin no //
analyzed: yang na don de nyid yin no //
translated: Or else, the very same meaning is expressed in a different way.

original: de ltar na yang dag par phyin ci ma log pa ston pas na ston pa zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na yang dag par phyin ci ma log pa ston pas na ston pa zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, the Teacher is shown to be the one who teaches correctly and without error.

original: lha dang mi smos pa ni rtogs pa'i snod yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha dang mi smos pa ni rtogs pa'i snod yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The words “gods and men” are used because they are the vessels of understanding.

original: ston pa nyid mdo'i tshig gis rgyas phar rab tu bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /🔽mig ltar gyur pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ston pa nyid mdo'i tshig gis rgyas phar rab tu bstan pa'i phyir smras pa / mig ltar gyur pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In order to demonstrate the very same teaching by the words of the sutra, he says:🔽“It is like an eye,” and so on.

original: mig ltar @114a * //
analyzed: mig ltar @114a * //
translated: “It is like an eye” means that it is like an eye for the world.

original: gyur ba'i phyir dang / ye shes su gyur pa'i phyir dang / don du gyur pa'i phyir dang / chos su gyur pa'i phyir dang zhes pa'i rtsa ba'i tshig bzhi'o //
analyzed: gyur ba'i phyir dang / ye shes su gyur pa'i phyir dang / don du gyur pa'i phyir dang / chos su gyur pa'i phyir dang zhes pa'i rtsa ba'i tshig bzhi'o //
translated: The four basic terms are: because of being the eye, because of being the eye-faculty, because of being the eye-consciousness, because of being the eye-element.

original: de la mig ltar gyur pa bshad pa'i phyir don gsal ba gtan la 'bebs pa'i phyir zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: de la mig ltar gyur pa bshad pa'i phyir don gsal ba gtan la 'bebs pa'i phyir zhes bya bas so //
translated: In order to explain the eye-like nature, it says: because of determining the clear object.

original: gsal ba dang / rtogs sla ba dang / de kho na nyid ni don gcig pa'o //
analyzed: gsal ba dang / rtogs sla ba dang / de kho na nyid ni don gcig pa'o //
translated: Clear, easy to understand, and reality have the same meaning.

original: de nyid bstan pa ni gtan la 'bebs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa ni gtan la 'bebs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching of that is called “determining.”

original: gdul bya rnams la de kho na nyid ston pa'i thabs su gyur pas na mig ltar gyur pa zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gdul bya rnams la de kho na nyid ston pa'i thabs su gyur pas na mig ltar gyur pa zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is taught that because it is the means of teaching reality to those to be trained, it is the eye-like nature.

original: ji skad du bstod pa mkhan gyis /
analyzed: ji skad du bstod pa mkhan gyis /
translated: As the Praises says:

original: khyod kyis bstan la ma brten par //
analyzed: khyod kyis bstan la ma brten par //
translated: Without relying on your teaching,

original: 'gas kyang de nyid mi mthong bas //🔽'jig rten long ba lta bu yi //
analyzed: 'gas kyang de nyid mi mthong bas // 'jig rten long ba lta bu yi //
translated: No one can see reality.🔽You are the eye of the world,

original: mig tu gyur pa khyod la 'dud //🔽ces bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mig tu gyur pa khyod la 'dud //🔽ces bstan pa yin no //
translated: Which is like a blind person.🔽I bow to you.

original: ye shes su gyur pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ye shes su gyur pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is gnosis, he says:

original: don thams cad rtogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: don thams cad rtogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it realizes all objects.

original: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi don thams cad ston pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de la ston pa'o ;
analyzed: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi don thams cad ston pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de la ston pa'o ;
translated: Because it teaches all objects, both conditioned and unconditioned.

original: / de yang dag par gtan la 'bebs pa ni de sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //🔽de ltar re zhig phyin ci log gi shes pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa yang dag pa'i ye shes nye bar sgrub pa'i phyir ye shes su gyur pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: / de yang dag par gtan la 'bebs pa ni de sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro // de ltar re zhig phyin ci log gi shes pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa yang dag pa'i ye shes nye bar sgrub pa'i phyir ye shes su gyur pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: It is the correct ascertainment of that, because it precedes that.🔽Thus, in this way, it is explained that it is gnosis because it establishes the side that is the antidote to mistaken consciousness.

original: da ni mi shes pa dang / the tshom za ba'i shes pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs yang dag pa'i ye shes nye bar sgrub pa'i phyir ye shes su gyur pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni mi shes pa dang / the tshom za ba'i shes pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs yang dag pa'i ye shes nye bar sgrub pa'i phyir ye shes su gyur pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that it is gnosis because it establishes the side that is the antidote to the consciousnesses of those who do not know and those who doubt, he says:

original: mi rtogs pa'i don rtogs par mdzad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mi rtogs pa'i don rtogs par mdzad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Because it causes the realization of the object that is not realized.

original: mi rtogs pa dang / khong du ma chud pa dang / mi shes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi rtogs pa dang / khong du ma chud pa dang / mi shes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the words “not understood,” “not penetrated,” and “not known” is the same.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: chos la blo gros ma byang ba //
analyzed: chos la blo gros ma byang ba //
translated: “When the mind is not trained in the Dharma,

original: phan pa'ang / phan par ma 'tshal zhing //
analyzed: phan pa'ang / phan par ma 'tshal zhing //
translated: one does not know what is beneficial as beneficial,

original: gnod pa'ang gnod par ma 'tshal la //
analyzed: gnod pa'ang gnod par ma 'tshal la //
translated: nor does one know what is harmful as harmful.

original: byang ba khyod la brten nas 'gyur //🔽zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: byang ba khyod la brten nas 'gyur // zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: But when it is trained, one knows both.”🔽In order to show the benefit,

original: don du gyur pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don du gyur pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: it is said:

original: zab mo'i gnas rnams la ste /
analyzed: zab mo'i gnas rnams la ste /
translated: “The profound points of the Dharma,🔽the path of the virtuous and the path of the brahmin,🔽are for the benefit of those who are not liberated,

original: dge sbyong gi lam dang / bram ze'i lam ma grol ba rnams 'grol ba dang / grol ba rnams rnam par sbyong bar mdzad pas don du gyur pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi lam dang / bram ze'i lam ma grol ba rnams 'grol ba dang / grol ba rnams rnam par sbyong bar mdzad pas don du gyur pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and for the purification of those who are liberated.”

original: de'i phyir bstod pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstod pa /
translated: Therefore, the praise:🔽“Most childish people reject what is harmful

original: byis pa phal cher gnod pa dag / dor bar 'tshal la phan ba spong //
analyzed: byis pa phal cher gnod pa dag / dor bar 'tshal la phan ba spong //
translated: and abandon what is beneficial.

original: phan pa gnyer yang ma 'tshal bas //
analyzed: phan pa gnyer yang ma 'tshal bas //
translated: Even when they seek what is beneficial,

original: gnod pa so sor ston par bgyid //
analyzed: gnod pa so sor ston par bgyid //
translated: they do not know it and are taught what is harmful.

original: de dag thabs ni ston mdzad phyir //
analyzed: de dag thabs ni ston mdzad phyir //
translated: In order to show them the means,

original: khyod la brten nas gnyi ga yang //
analyzed: khyod la brten nas gnyi ga yang //
translated: you teach both

original: yang dag ji bzhin rtogs gyur pas //
analyzed: yang dag ji bzhin rtogs gyur pas //
translated: because you have realized the perfect truth just as it is,

original: @114b sman par gyur pa khyod la 'dud //🔽ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: @114b sman par gyur pa khyod la 'dud // ces bya ba yin no //
translated: we bow to you, O Physician!

original: chos su gyur pa bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos su gyur pa bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain the Dharma,

original: chos thams cad kyi rtsa ba ni bcom ldan 'das so zhes bya ba'i tshig gis te /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rtsa ba ni bcom ldan 'das so zhes bya ba'i tshig gis te /
translated: he says, “The root of all dharmas is the Bhagavat.”

original: dge ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams des dang por bstan pa'i phyir de rtsa bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams des dang por bstan pa'i phyir de rtsa bar gyur pa'o //
translated: Because he first taught the dharmas of virtue, etc., he is their root.

original: nyan thos kyis bshad pa la sogs pa yang des rjes su gnang pa'i phyir dang / tshad mar gyur pa'i phyir dang / des 'dren par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos kyis bshad pa la sogs pa yang des rjes su gnang pa'i phyir dang / tshad mar gyur pa'i phyir dang / des 'dren par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The teachings of the śrāvakas, etc., are also his because he authorized them, because they are authoritative, and because he leads them.

original: de ston pa yin pa'i khyad par bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de ston pa yin pa'i khyad par bstan pa yin te /
translated: He shows the distinction of being the teacher:

original: don la brten par bya'o yi ge la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas de la brten par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: don la brten par bya'o yi ge la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas de la brten par bya ba nyid do //
translated: “One should rely on the meaning, not on the letter,” etc.🔽In order to show that one is called a Buddha because one has comprehended all the aspects of all dharmas,

original: chos thams cad kyi rnam pa mtha' dag thugs su chud pas sangs rgyas zhes bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rnam pa mtha' dag thugs su chud pas sangs rgyas zhes bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: he says,

original: don dang ldan pa'i chos kyis tshogs zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: don dang ldan pa'i chos kyis tshogs zhes bya ba la /
translated: The assembly of the Dharma that is endowed with meaning.

original: mdo las ni yang dag pa dang / phyin ci log la sogs pa'i sgo nas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ba'am /
analyzed: mdo las ni yang dag pa dang / phyin ci log la sogs pa'i sgo nas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ba'am /
translated: In the sutras, it should be understood that the Buddha is established from the perspective of the correct and the inverted, and so on.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos kyi rab tu dbye pa'i sgo nas kyang de lta bu rtogs pa ni sangs rgyas zhes brjod do //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos kyi rab tu dbye pa'i sgo nas kyang de lta bu rtogs pa ni sangs rgyas zhes brjod do //
translated: Or, one who realizes suchness in this way is called a Buddha from the perspective of the classification of virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral phenomena.

original: bdud rnams bcom pas na bcom ldan 'das zhes bstan pa'i phyir bdud bye ba phrag brgya'i dpung dang bcas pa rnams kyi g-yul ngo chen po bcom pas na bcom ldan 'das zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdud rnams bcom pas na bcom ldan 'das zhes bstan pa'i phyir bdud bye ba phrag brgya'i dpung dang bcas pa rnams kyi g-yul ngo chen po bcom pas na bcom ldan 'das zhes bya'o //
translated: Because he has conquered the demons, he is called the Blessed One. Because he has conquered the great battle of the armies of a billion demons, he is called the Blessed One.

original: de ltar re zhig brjod par bya ba'i khyad par nyid bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig brjod par bya ba'i khyad par nyid bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the distinction of what is to be expressed,

original: da ni skye ba'i khyad par nyid kyis byang chub bstan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'byung ba bar chad dang bcas pa dang / bar chad med par 'byung ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: da ni skye ba'i khyad par nyid kyis byang chub bstan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'byung ba bar chad dang bcas pa dang / bar chad med par 'byung ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: now, in order to teach enlightenment through the distinction of birth, he teaches the arising of the Buddhas with and without obstacles.

original: de la bar chad dang bcas par 'byung ba bstan pa'i phyir bar chad dang bcas pa'i 'byung ba ni bskal pa du mar yang 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu sangs rgyas gcig kyang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de la bar chad dang bcas par 'byung ba bstan pa'i phyir bar chad dang bcas pa'i 'byung ba ni bskal pa du mar yang 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu sangs rgyas gcig kyang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: In order to demonstrate that there is an occurrence of the Buddha with obstacles, he says: The occurrence of the Buddha with obstacles is that even in many eons, a single Buddha does not appear in a single world system.

original: res 'ga' ni bskal pa gcig la yang 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu sangs rgyas mang po yang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni bskal pa gcig la yang 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu sangs rgyas mang po yang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Sometimes, even in a single eon, many Buddhas appear in a single world system.

original: de ltar na bar chad dang bcas pa dang / bar chad med par 'byung par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na bar chad dang bcas pa dang / bar chad med par 'byung par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Thus, there is an occurrence of the Buddha with obstacles and without obstacles.

original: dus gcig tu 'byung ba dang / dus gcig ma yin par 'byung ba bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: dus gcig tu 'byung ba dang / dus gcig ma yin par 'byung ba bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that there is an occurrence of the Buddha at one time and not at one time, he says:

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med grangs med pa de dang de dag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med grangs med pa de dang de dag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In this and that world system in the ten directions, which are innumerable and measureless.

original: mang por mang po dus gcig tu 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni dus gcig tu 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu gnyis dus @115a * //
analyzed: mang por mang po dus gcig tu 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni dus gcig tu 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu gnyis dus @115a * //
translated: The many Buddhas who appear simultaneously in many worlds is called the simultaneous appearance of many in many places.

original: gcig tu 'byung ba ni med kyi rim gyis ni 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gcig tu 'byung ba ni med kyi rim gyis ni 'byung ngo //
translated: But two Buddhas do not appear simultaneously in one world; they appear successively.

original: mang po dus gcig tu 'byung ba la rigs pa dang 'gal ba med pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: mang po dus gcig tu 'byung ba la rigs pa dang 'gal ba med pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: To show that there is no logical contradiction in the simultaneous appearance of many, he says:

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Why is that?

original: smon lam mnyam par btab pa dang / tshogs mnyam par nye bar bsgrubs pa rnams 'jig rten gyi khams tha dad pa rnams su dus gcig tu 'byung bar 'gyur ba la rigs pa dang 'gal ba ni ci yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: smon lam mnyam par btab pa dang / tshogs mnyam par nye bar bsgrubs pa rnams 'jig rten gyi khams tha dad pa rnams su dus gcig tu 'byung bar 'gyur ba la rigs pa dang 'gal ba ni ci yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: There is no logical contradiction in the simultaneous appearance of those who have made the same aspiration and accomplished the same collection in different worlds.

original: sngon de dag nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing so sor gzung zhing smon lam btab pa'i phyir zhing gcig nyid du ni gnyis kyang 'byung ba ma yin na mang po dag ni shin tu 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon de dag nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing so sor gzung zhing smon lam btab pa'i phyir zhing gcig nyid du ni gnyis kyang 'byung ba ma yin na mang po dag ni shin tu 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: Because they themselves have taken up and prayed for individual buddha-fields in the past, two buddhas do not appear in one buddha-field, much less many.

original: tshogs yongs su rdzogs par ya'o //
analyzed: tshogs yongs su rdzogs par ya'o //
translated: The completion of the accumulations is the cause.

original: tham ni rim gyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba yang mi rigs la /
analyzed: tham ni rim gyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba yang mi rigs la /
translated: It is not reasonable that they appear gradually,

original: gtan 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba yang mi rigs pas des na 'jig rten gyi khams tha dad pa rnams su nges par 'byung bar 'gyur bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: gtan 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba yang mi rigs pas des na 'jig rten gyi khams tha dad pa rnams su nges par 'byung bar 'gyur bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: nor is it reasonable that they never appear. Therefore, one should understand that they appear in different world-realms.

original: gal te dus gcig tu sangs rgyas rnams 'byung bar 'gyur na sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig tu yang dus gcig tu ci'i phyir mi 'byung zhes gzhan dag smra ba yongs su spang ba'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gal te dus gcig tu sangs rgyas rnams 'byung bar 'gyur na sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig tu yang dus gcig tu ci'i phyir mi 'byung zhes gzhan dag smra ba yongs su spang ba'i phyir smras pa /
translated: If buddhas appear at the same time, why do they not appear at the same time in one buddha-field? To completely eliminate such questions from others, it is said:

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Why is that?

original: zhing gcig tu gnyis dus gcig tu 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: zhing gcig tu gnyis dus gcig tu 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: Two do not appear in one realm at the same time.

original: sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gi phyir dang / dgos pa med pa'i phyir dang / gdul bya rnams gus pa dang bcas pas bsgrub par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gi phyir dang / dgos pa med pa'i phyir dang / gdul bya rnams gus pa dang bcas pas bsgrub par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because of the power of former aspirations, because there is no need for two, and because disciples would not practice with devotion.

original: ci nas bdag 'dren pa med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ci nas bdag 'dren pa med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: To demonstrate this, it says:

original: 'dren pa med pa'i 'jig rten du yongs su 'dren par gyur nas yongs su mya ngan las zlo bar gyur cig ces smon lam btab ba de dag de bzhin du yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'dren pa med pa'i 'jig rten du yongs su 'dren par gyur nas yongs su mya ngan las zlo bar gyur cig ces smon lam btab ba de dag de bzhin du yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur zhing /
translated: May I become a leader in a world without a leader and lead them to nirvana.

original: bsod nams chen po yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur bas de'i phyir gcig tu dus cig car 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bsod nams chen po yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur bas de'i phyir gcig tu dus cig car 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Those who make this aspiration will accomplish it just as they have aspired and will possess great merit. Therefore, two do not appear at the same time.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig tu ni gcig nyid kyi sa mdzad pa thams cad kyang mdzad par spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig tu ni gcig nyid kyi sa mdzad pa thams cad kyang mdzad par spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in one buddha realm, one buddha performs all the deeds of a buddha.

original: sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba ni 'jig rten la phan pa'i phyir yin la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba ni 'jig rten la phan pa'i phyir yin la /
translated: The appearance of buddhas is for the benefit of the world.

original: des na gnyis pa 'byung ba la dgos pa med do zhes bya bas dus gcig tu gnyis 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: des na gnyis pa 'byung ba la dgos pa med do zhes bya bas dus gcig tu gnyis 'byung ba med do //
translated: Therefore, since the second appearance would be purposeless, two buddhas do not appear at the same time.

original: sangs rgyas mang po byung bar gyur na gdul bya rnams rang gi don sgrub pa'i phyir shin tu gus par sgrub par mi @115b 'gyur la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas mang po byung bar gyur na gdul bya rnams rang gi don sgrub pa'i phyir shin tu gus par sgrub par mi @115b 'gyur la /
translated: If many buddhas appeared, disciples would not strive to accomplish their own goal with great respect.

original: myur du nan tan byed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: myur du nan tan byed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: They would not strive quickly.

original: gcig mya ngan las 'das par gyur kyang gzhan dag kyang bzhugs so snyam pa'i blos dus gzhan la ltos par yang 'gyur ro //🔽de las bzlog pas ni 'jig rten kun la sangs rgyas gcig nyid do zhes shes nas gzhan dag tu ljongs rgyur gshegs sam /
analyzed: gcig mya ngan las 'das par gyur kyang gzhan dag kyang bzhugs so snyam pa'i blos dus gzhan la ltos par yang 'gyur ro // de las bzlog pas ni 'jig rten kun la sangs rgyas gcig nyid do zhes shes nas gzhan dag tu ljongs rgyur gshegs sam /
translated: They would think, “Even if one buddha passes into nirvāṇa, others remain,” and they would rely on other times.

original: mya ngan las 'das na bdag cag mgon med par 'gyur ro zhes bsams nas myur ba myur bar sgrub pa la 'jug par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das na bdag cag mgon med par 'gyur ro zhes bsams nas myur ba myur bar sgrub pa la 'jug par 'gyur zhing /
translated: The opposite of that is the case. Knowing that there is only one buddha for the entire world, they think, “If he goes to other lands or passes into nirvāṇa, we will be without a protector,” and they strive quickly.

original: chos mnyan ba dang / tshangs par spyod pas gnas ba mos pa drag po dang / ro gcig tu gyur bas 'bad par byed do //
analyzed: chos mnyan ba dang / tshangs par spyod pas gnas ba mos pa drag po dang / ro gcig tu gyur bas 'bad par byed do //
translated: He listens to the Dharma, and he lives the holy life with intense aspiration, and he makes an effort with one-pointed mind.

original: de ltar na gcig cig byung nas sems can mang po'i phan pa dang don du 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na gcig cig byung nas sems can mang po'i phan pa dang don du 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, when one arises, it is for the benefit and welfare of many beings.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam pa dang mi mnyam par yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam pa dang mi mnyam par yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: All buddhas are said to be both equal and not equal.

original: mnyam pa nyid ni tshogs dang / chos kyi sku dang / 'gro ba'i don kun du spyod pas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid ni tshogs dang / chos kyi sku dang / 'gro ba'i don kun du spyod pas rig par bya'o //
translated: Their equality should be understood in terms of their spiritual community, their Dharma body, and their performance of benefit for beings.

original: rnam pa bzhis mi mnyam pa nyid bstan pa yin te ;
analyzed: rnam pa bzhis mi mnyam pa nyid bstan pa yin te ;
translated: They are shown to be not equal in four ways:

original: dus kyi dbye bas sku tshe dus ring por bzhugs pa dang / dus thung ngur bzhugs pas sku tshe'i dbye bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dus kyi dbye bas sku tshe dus ring por bzhugs pa dang / dus thung ngur bzhugs pas sku tshe'i dbye bar rig par bya'o //
translated: in their life spans, because some live long and others live short lives;

original: thams cad kyang mtshan mi 'dra bas mtshan tha dad par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: thams cad kyang mtshan mi 'dra bas mtshan tha dad par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: in their names, because their names are different;🔽in their clans, because some are of priestly clans and others are of aristocratic clans;🔽and in their worlds, because some appear in worlds of gold and others in worlds of silver, and so on.

original: bram ze dang / rgyal rigs la sogs pas rigs tha dad pa dang / sku'i tshad shin tu chung ba'am /
analyzed: bram ze dang / rgyal rigs la sogs pas rigs tha dad pa dang / sku'i tshad shin tu chung ba'am /
translated: and the Brahmins, Kshatriyas, etc.

original: shin tu che bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: shin tu che bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: are different castes, and the size of the body is very small or very large.

original: mi yin na yang skyes pa'i mtshan dang ldan pa nyid sangs rgyas su 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mi yin na yang skyes pa'i mtshan dang ldan pa nyid sangs rgyas su 'gyur gyi /
translated: Even if a human, only one who has the male sex would become a Buddha,🔽not a woman.

original: bud med ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bud med ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to teach this, he says:

original: bud med kyis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bud med kyis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “Even a woman” and so on.

original: bud med kyis sangs pa med de /
analyzed: bud med kyis sangs pa med de /
translated: A woman does not become a Buddha,

original: rten dman pa'i phyir dang / bud med la mtshan phun sum tshogs pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rten gyi lus med pa'i phyir dang / 'di ltar bud med kyi lus ni byang chub sems dpas dus ring po nas spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten dman pa'i phyir dang / bud med la mtshan phun sum tshogs pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rten gyi lus med pa'i phyir dang / 'di ltar bud med kyi lus ni byang chub sems dpas dus ring po nas spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the basis is inferior, because a woman does not have a body that is the basis for the perfect completion of the excellent marks, and because in this way the body of a woman has been abandoned by the Bodhisattva for a long time.

original: bsam pa yang dman pa yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa yang dman pa yin te /
translated: The intention is also inferior,

original: nyon mongs pa drags pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / brten pa dang shes rab dman pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa drags pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / brten pa dang shes rab dman pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of excessive affliction, and because of inferior effort, steadfastness, and wisdom.

original: de lta bu'i bsam pa dman pa dang / brtan pa dang brtson 'grus dang shes rab dman pas de lta bu'i phun sum tshogs pa bsgrub par nus pa ma yin no / zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bu'i bsam pa dman pa dang / brtan pa dang brtson 'grus dang shes rab dman pas de lta bu'i phun sum tshogs pa bsgrub par nus pa ma yin no / zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: One who has such a low disposition, and who is low in steadfastness, effort, and wisdom, is not able to accomplish such perfection.🔽In order to demonstrate this, he says,

original: rang bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa mang ba la sogs pas sangs rgyas par mi nus pa'i phyir ro shes bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽ji skad bstan pa'i rnam pa mdor @116a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa mang ba la sogs pas sangs rgyas par mi nus pa'i phyir ro shes bya ba la sogs pa'o // ji skad bstan pa'i rnam pa mdor @116a * //
translated: because of being naturally afflicted, etc.

original: bsdus nas bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsdus nas bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the above in brief, he says,

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de ltar na dam pa rnam pa bdun dang ldan pa ni byang chub ba chen po dam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de ltar na dam pa rnam pa bdun dang ldan pa ni byang chub ba chen po dam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, etc. Thus, one who has the seven kinds of excellence is called the best of the bodhisattvas.

original: yang de'i rnam pa gzhan yang de bzhin du mchog dang / gtso bo dang / dam pa dang / gya nom pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: yang de'i rnam pa gzhan yang de bzhin du mchog dang / gtso bo dang / dam pa dang / gya nom pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Moreover, in order to teach another aspect of that, he says,

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Moreover, etc.

original: rtog pa'i shes pa thams cad kyi yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa'i shes pa thams cad kyi yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: It is inconceivable because it is the object of all conceptual consciousnesses.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir mchog go zhes bya bar sbyar par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir mchog go zhes bya bar sbyar par bya'o //
translated: It is supreme because it is inconceivable.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yon tan bskyed par bya ba'i phyir dpag tu med pa'o//
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yon tan bskyed par bya ba'i phyir dpag tu med pa'o//
translated: It is immeasurable because it generates inconceivable qualities.

original: de'i phyir mchog go zhes bya ba nas gya nom pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mchog go zhes bya ba nas gya nom pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Therefore, it is supreme, and so on up to sublime.

original: byang chub thams cad kyi rtsa par gyur bas na de nyid ni bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub thams cad kyi rtsa par gyur bas na de nyid ni bla na med pa'o //
translated: It is unsurpassed because it is the root of all enlightenments.

original: de'i phyir mchog dang / gtso bo dang / gya nom pa'i bar du'o zhes bya pa'i dbang du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mchog dang / gtso bo dang / gya nom pa'i bar du'o zhes bya pa'i dbang du byas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is supreme, and so on up to sublime.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i rnal 'byor gyi gzhi'i gnas las byang chub chen po'i le'u bshad pa ste bdun pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i rnal 'byor gyi gzhi'i gnas las byang chub chen po'i le'u bshad pa ste bdun pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the seventh chapter of the Bodhisattvabhumi, called “Great Enlightenment.”

original: // / sngar bstan pa'i gang la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar dang / gang dag slob par byed ces bya ba la /
analyzed: // / sngar bstan pa'i gang la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar dang / gang dag slob par byed ces bya ba la /
translated: The above mentioned three topics are: what is to be learned, how it is to be learned, and who is to learn it.

original: gang la bslab par bya ba ni bstan zin to //
analyzed: gang la bslab par bya ba ni bstan zin to //
translated: What is to be learned has been explained.

original: de dag bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir khyad par du byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod tshol bar byed de /
analyzed: de dag bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir khyad par du byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod tshol bar byed de /
translated: In order to accomplish those, he seeks the Bodhisattva Canon,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to purify the Bodhisattva training.

original: gzhan dag la bstan par bya ba'i phyir nyan thos kyi sde snod kyang tshol te /
analyzed: gzhan dag la bstan par bya ba'i phyir nyan thos kyi sde snod kyang tshol te /
translated: He also seeks the Disciple Canon in order to teach it to others,

original: rang nyid slob pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang nyid slob pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: but not in order to train himself.

original: phyi rol gyi bstan bcos rig pa'i gnas gsum gyis bsdus pa yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi bstan bcos rig pa'i gnas gsum gyis bsdus pa yang rig par bya'o //
translated: The three outer sciences should be known as included in the three inner sciences.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams la grags pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams la grags pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa'o //
translated: They are mundane because they are known to the world.

original: de dag gi chos ji snyed yod pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gi chos ji snyed yod pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to show how many dharmas there are in them, he says:

original: rig pa'i gnas kyis yongs su bsdus pa de dag thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas kyis yongs su bsdus pa de dag thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: All of these are included within the branches of knowledge.

original: 'di dag gi rnam par gzhag pa ni snga ma bzhin du bstan to //
analyzed: 'di dag gi rnam par gzhag pa ni snga ma bzhin du bstan to //
translated: The presentation of these is taught in the same way as before.

original: gang gi phyir phyi rol pa rnams la yang bsam gtan dang / snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa yod na yang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyi rol pa rnams la yang bsam gtan dang / snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa yod na yang /
translated: Even though non-Buddhists attain meditative stabilization and meditative equipoise,

original: de ltar na yang de dag gi man ngag ni nang gi bstan bcos su rnam par gzhag par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na yang de dag gi man ngag ni nang gi bstan bcos su rnam par gzhag par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: nevertheless, their instructions are not to be presented in the treatise on inner science,

original: lta ba ngan pas kun nas bslang ba'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa can yin pa'i phyir dang / gnyen po'i phyogs yongs su ma rdzogs pa @116b yin pa'i phyir dang / gtan du ba ma yin pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba ngan pas kun nas bslang ba'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa can yin pa'i phyir dang / gnyen po'i phyogs yongs su ma rdzogs pa @116b yin pa'i phyir dang / gtan du ba ma yin pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are motivated by bad views, because they are afflicted, because they are not the complete antidote, and because they are not the antidote that is permanent.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: de la sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab ni nang gi bstan bcos zhes bya ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab ni nang gi bstan bcos zhes bya ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The Buddha’s scriptures are called the treatise on inner science.

original: nye bar zhi ba'i bstan bcos kyis bsdus pa'i phyir dang / ji skad bstan pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar zhi ba'i bstan bcos kyis bsdus pa'i phyir dang / ji skad bstan pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is included in the treatise on peace, and because it is the antidote to the side that is taught.

original: rig pa'i gnas 'di dag gi bya ba'i rnam pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas 'di dag gi bya ba'i rnam pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate the function of these branches of knowledge, he says:

original: de yang rnam pa dus 'jug ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa dus 'jug ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: And that is of two kinds, according to its engagement and its object.

original: rnam pa ni 'dir 'jug pa'i bye brag ste /
analyzed: rnam pa ni 'dir 'jug pa'i bye brag ste /
translated: Here, the kind is a particular engagement.

original: don gyi khyad par zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don gyi khyad par zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is a particular object.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab ni nyes pa dang bral bas bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab ni nyes pa dang bral bas bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Buddha's scriptures are included because they are free from faults.

original: nyes pa dang bral ba yang mi bslu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes pa dang bral ba yang mi bslu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And they are free from faults because they are non-deceptive.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i don gsal bar byed pa'i dbang du byas nas 'jug pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i don gsal bar byed pa'i dbang du byas nas 'jug pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate engagement from the point of view of clarifying the meaning that is not mistaken, he says:

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes smos pa ni sgrub pa'i snying por byed pa nyid rab tu bstan pa'i phyir dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i lam gyi dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes smos pa ni sgrub pa'i snying por byed pa nyid rab tu bstan pa'i phyir dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i lam gyi dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The terms cause and effect are mentioned in order to show that they are the essence of spiritual practice, and in order to take into account the path of training for the bodhisattva.

original: byas pa chud mi za ba'i rnam pa gsal bar bstan par zhes bya ba ni theg pa gsum gyi dbang du byas pa'i bya ba'i sbyor ba rnams mi nyams pa'i sbyor bas yang dang yang du byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byas pa chud mi za ba'i rnam pa gsal bar bstan par zhes bya ba ni theg pa gsum gyi dbang du byas pa'i bya ba'i sbyor ba rnams mi nyams pa'i sbyor bas yang dang yang du byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The expression “the manifestation of the non-wastage of action” means that the performance of actions in relation to the three vehicles is not lost through the application of non-wastage, because it is performed again and again.

original: ma byas pa dang phrad par mi 'gyur ba yang theg pa gzhan du byas pa dang ; gzhan dag gis byas pa gang yin pa des phan 'dogs par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ma byas pa dang phrad par mi 'gyur ba yang theg pa gzhan du byas pa dang ; gzhan dag gis byas pa gang yin pa des phan 'dogs par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: One does not encounter the results of actions not done, because what is done by one is not experienced by another.

original: pha rol ni gzhan dag klan ka tshol ba ni gzhan dag klan ka tshol du 'ong ba ste /
analyzed: pha rol ni gzhan dag klan ka tshol ba ni gzhan dag klan ka tshol du 'ong ba ste /
translated: Others are adversaries, because they come as adversaries.

original: gzhan gyi phyogs la nyes pa rjod par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs la nyes pa rjod par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are those who proclaim the faults of the position of others.

original: de nyid ni phan yon te /
analyzed: de nyid ni phan yon te /
translated: That itself is the benefit.

original: 'dis ni gzhan gyi phyogs sun 'byin pa'i don gsal bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni gzhan gyi phyogs sun 'byin pa'i don gsal bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: This clearly shows the meaning of refuting the position of others.

original: gzhan las byung ba de lta bur smra ba zhes bya ba la gzhan dag las byung ba'i 'dod pa ni de lta bu'o //🔽de'i 'dod pa ni 'di lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzhan las byung ba de lta bur smra ba zhes bya ba la gzhan dag las byung ba'i 'dod pa ni de lta bu'o // de'i 'dod pa ni 'di lta bu'o //
translated: The phrase such a speaker who arises from others means that the assertions of others are like this.🔽The phrase his assertions are like this means that the assertions of the speaker are like this.

original: de dag la skyon 'di dang 'di lta bu yod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag la skyon 'di dang 'di lta bu yod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase he has such and such faults means that the speaker has such and such faults.

original: de lta bas na de lta bu'i smra ba las thar pa ni de lta bu smra ba las thar pa'i phan yon ston pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na de lta bu'i smra ba las thar pa ni de lta bu smra ba las thar pa'i phan yon ston pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the phrase liberation from such a speaker shows the benefit of liberation from such a speaker.

original: de nyid ni phan yon no //
analyzed: de nyid ni phan yon no //
translated: That itself is the benefit.

original: de bzhin du rang gi phyogs kyi skyon spangs pa'i phyir dang / yon tan bsgrag pa'i phyir dang / rang gi phyogs bstan par gzhag pa'i phyir 'di skad bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rang gi phyogs kyi skyon spangs pa'i phyir dang / yon tan bsgrag pa'i phyir dang / rang gi phyogs bstan par gzhag pa'i phyir 'di skad bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, in order to abandon the faults of one's own position, in order to proclaim the good qualities, and in order to establish the presentation of one's own position, it is taught like this.

original: skad kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: skad kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The phrase the essence of verbal roots and so on.

original: @117a * // dbyings 'di las 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes rnam par gzhag pa'i don to //
analyzed: @117a * // dbyings 'di las 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes rnam par gzhag pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the statement is that this arises from that realm.

original: ma grags pa rab tu ston pa ni sgrub pa yin la /
analyzed: ma grags pa rab tu ston pa ni sgrub pa yin la /
translated: Proof is the demonstration of what is not well known.

original: sbyor ba'i bye brag gis nges par 'byed pa ni rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i bye brag gis nges par 'byed pa ni rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: The classification is the differentiation of the application.

original: yang na don gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang na don gcig pa nyid do //
translated: Or, they have the same meaning.

original: de dag gis sgra'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes pa'i don bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gis sgra'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes pa'i don bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: They teach the meaning of the knowledge of the characteristics of words.

original: tshig 'dus byas pa ni tshig legs par sbyar bas te /
analyzed: tshig 'dus byas pa ni tshig legs par sbyar bas te /
translated: The composition of the words is the proper arrangement of the words.

original: de nyid ni phan yon no //
analyzed: de nyid ni phan yon no //
translated: That itself is the benefit.

original: des sbyor ba la mkhas pa nyid bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: des sbyor ba la mkhas pa nyid bstan pa yin te /
translated: By that, the skill in composition is taught.

original: sgra'i mtshon bya mtshon byed kyi dbang du byas nas so //
analyzed: sgra'i mtshon bya mtshon byed kyi dbang du byas nas so //
translated: It is from the perspective of the indication and the means of indication of words.

original: gso ba'i bstan bcos ni mdo'i rjes su 'brangs nas rnam pa bzhir bstan te /
analyzed: gso ba'i bstan bcos ni mdo'i rjes su 'brangs nas rnam pa bzhir bstan te /
translated: The treatise on medicine is taught as fourfold following the sūtras:

original: nad dang / nad kyi rgyu dang / de bsal ba dang / de'i sman yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: nad dang / nad kyi rgyu dang / de bsal ba dang / de'i sman yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: the disease, the cause of the disease, the removal of that, and the complete knowledge of the medicine for that.

original: bzo'i gnas gang dang gang la legs par gnas pa des bya ba gang dang gang nges par 'grub pa de de'i rnam par yongs su gsal bar byed par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bzo'i gnas gang dang gang la legs par gnas pa des bya ba gang dang gang nges par 'grub pa de de'i rnam par yongs su gsal bar byed par rig par bya'o //
translated: Whatever the nature of the activity that is to be accomplished, that is the way in which the cause is made fully evident.

original: rgyu rnams ji snyed yod pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: rgyu rnams ji snyed yod pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: The causes are described in terms of the extent to which they exist.

original: rgyu bcu po 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rgyu bcu po 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The ten causes, etc.🔽It should be understood that all causes are included in these two.

original: rgyu thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rgyu thams cad mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rgyu thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rgyu thams cad mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: In brief, all causes are included in two types:

original: sems can gyi 'jig rten gyi rgyu dang / snod kyi 'jig rten gyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi 'jig rten gyi rgyu dang / snod kyi 'jig rten gyi rgyu'o //
translated: the causes of the world of sentient beings and the causes of the receptacle world.

original: sems can gyi 'jig rten gyi rgyu yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sems can gyi 'jig rten gyi rgyu yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The causes of the world of sentient beings are also of two types:🔽the cause of involvement and the cause of the distinction of what is involved.

original: gang gi phyir 'jug pa'i rgyu smras pa /🔽kun nas nyon mongs pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jug pa'i rgyu smras pa / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The cause of involvement is mentioned first.🔽It is the cause of the world of sentient beings because it is the cause of the world of sentient beings.

original: ldog pa'i rgyu ni gang gi phyir rnam par byang ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ldog pa'i rgyu ni gang gi phyir rnam par byang ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The cause of the distinction of what is involved is mentioned next.🔽It is the cause of the world of sentient beings because it is the cause of the distinction of what is involved in the world of sentient beings.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten gyi dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten gyi dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: The causes of the receptacle world are mentioned next.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba'o //🔽sde pa tha dad kyi gzhung las bstan pa'am /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba'o // sde pa tha dad kyi gzhung las bstan pa'am /
translated: of the world.

original: byed pa'i rgyu la sogs pa rnams kyi don yang 'di dag nyid du 'dus zhes bya bar smras pa /🔽bsdus pa yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byed pa'i rgyu la sogs pa rnams kyi don yang 'di dag nyid du 'dus zhes bya bar smras pa / bsdus pa yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of the other causes, such as the productive cause, is included in these three causes.🔽The three causes are included in the three conditions.🔽The ten causes are included in the three conditions.

original: rgyu bcu po rnams bsdus na rnam pa gsum du gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu bcu po rnams bsdus na rnam pa gsum du gzhag par bya ste /
translated: The three conditions are:🔽the causal condition,🔽the immediately antecedent condition,

original: ngo bo nyid dang / gnas skabs kyi khyad par nyid dang / bsdus pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang / gnas skabs kyi khyad par nyid dang / bsdus pa nyid kyis so //
translated: and the objective condition.

original: rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rgyu ni rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rgyu nyid de /
analyzed: rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rgyu ni rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rgyu nyid de /
translated: The causal condition is the ten causes.🔽The immediately antecedent condition is the immediately antecedent cessation of a factor.

original: sngon gyi skye ba rnams su spros pa la goms pa'i bag chags kyis phan tshun rjes su tha snyad 'dogs shing dngos po bsal bar byed pa'i ngag gis 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi skye ba rnams su spros pa la goms pa'i bag chags kyis phan tshun rjes su tha snyad 'dogs shing dngos po bsal bar byed pa'i ngag gis 'jug pa'o //
translated: The objective condition is the five sense objects and all factors.

original: de'i chos gsum ni rgyu zhes brjod de /
analyzed: de'i chos gsum ni rgyu zhes brjod de /
translated: The three conditions are included in the three causes.🔽The causal condition is included in the three causes, the efficient cause, the co-existent cause, and the homogeneous cause.

original: ming dang lhan cig dngos po so sor rig pa'o //🔽ji @117b skad du /
analyzed: ming dang lhan cig dngos po so sor rig pa'o //🔽ji @117b skad du /
translated: The immediately antecedent condition is included in the immediately antecedent cause.🔽The objective condition is included in the five causes, with the exception of the productive cause.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pas sngon po la 'di ni sngon po'o zhes sngon po nyid du shes so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pas sngon po la 'di ni sngon po'o zhes sngon po nyid du shes so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: and the mental consciousness, which is associated with them, knows blue as blue, as “this is blue.”

original: gang yang ming dang zhes bya ba la /🔽ji ltar tshor ba de bzhin du mtshon par byed de /
analyzed: gang yang ming dang zhes bya ba la / ji ltar tshor ba de bzhin du mtshon par byed de /
translated: And the passage that begins “Name is that which . . .🔽. . . is the means of expression, just as feeling is.”🔽. . . is the means of expression, just as feeling is.🔽. . . is the means of expression, just as feeling is.

original: ji ltar tshor ba de bzhin du kun du shes par bya ba'i tshig gis so //🔽gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: ji ltar tshor ba de bzhin du kun du shes par bya ba'i tshig gis so // gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: . . . is the means of expression, just as feeling is.

original: 'du shes dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'du shes dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: . . . is the means of expression, just as feeling is.🔽. . . is the means of expression, just as feeling is.🔽. . . is the means of expression, just as feeling is.🔽. . . is the means of expression, just as feeling is.🔽. . . is the means of expression, just as feeling is.

original: gang kun du shes pa de rjes su tha snyad 'dogs so zhes bya bas 'du shes sngon du 'gro ba'i brjod pa gang yin pa'o //🔽chos gsum po 'di dag ni phan tshun dngos po rnams gsal bar byed pa'i dbang du byas nas 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba'am /
