original: rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa nyid rgyu yin pas rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa ste /
analyzed: rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa nyid rgyu yin pas rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa ste /
translated: . . . is the means of expression, just as feeling is.🔽. . . is the means of expression, just as feeling is.🔽. . . is the means of expression, just

original: de'i yul can gyi shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yul can gyi shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of the consciousness that has that as its object.

original: ltos nas rgyu yin pas ltos pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: ltos nas rgyu yin pas ltos pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: The causal condition is so called because it is the cause in dependence.

original: bya ba ni byed pa la ltos pa nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽gang la ltos shing zhes bya ba ni de'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bya ba ni byed pa la ltos pa nyid kyi phyir ro // gang la ltos shing zhes bya ba ni de'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the action depends on the agent.🔽In order to demonstrate the meaning of “in dependence,” he says,

original: rgyu gang las byung ba zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: rgyu gang las byung ba zhes bya ba la ;
translated: “that from which a cause arises.”

original: de yod pa las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yod pa las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: from the existence of that.

original: lus kyi las kyi rgyu can sngon du bstan nas /
analyzed: lus kyi las kyi rgyu can sngon du bstan nas /
translated: Having previously taught the cause of bodily action,

original: yang na ni yid kyi las kyang lus kyi las kyi rgyu can du bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: yang na ni yid kyi las kyang lus kyi las kyi rgyu can du bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: he says, “or else,” in order to teach that even mental action has bodily action as its cause.

original: 'dod pa dang / len par 'gyur ba 'di ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / len par 'gyur ba 'di ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: “This is the origin of desire and grasping.”

original: de'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In order to demonstrate an example of that, he says, “for example,” and so on.

original: de ltar re zhig lus kyi las kyi phyogs kyi dpe bstan pas don gyis yid kyi las kyang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig lus kyi las kyi phyogs kyi dpe bstan pas don gyis yid kyi las kyang rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, having taught an example of the category of bodily action, he teaches the example of mental action by implication.

original: lag pa la ltos shing lag pa'i rgyu las byung ba ni len pa'i las so zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: lag pa la ltos shing lag pa'i rgyu las byung ba ni len pa'i las so zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The action of grasping is that which depends on the hand and arises from the cause of the hand.

original: de ltar rgyu de dag gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rgyu de dag gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the characteristics of both causes should be understood as taught.

original: gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyis rgyu'i rnam par gzhag pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyis rgyu'i rnam par gzhag pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to teach the presentation of the cause by way of the distinction of states, he says:

original: de la sa bon ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de la sa bon ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Among them, the seed is the projecting cause of the sprout, etc.

original: zhing dang chu dang sa bon la sogs pa nye bar gyur pa las myu gu la sogs pa nas me tog la sogs pa'i rim gyis 'bras bu'i bar du 'phel ba ni yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu yin la /🔽sa bon ni 'phen pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: zhing dang chu dang sa bon la sogs pa nye bar gyur pa las myu gu la sogs pa nas me tog la sogs pa'i rim gyis 'bras bu'i bar du 'phel ba ni yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu yin la / sa bon ni 'phen pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: The cause of possession is the increase of the sprout, etc., up to the fruit by way of the continuum of the sprout, etc., through the proximity of the field, water, seed, etc.

original: sa bon des myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun gyis rim gyis rang gi ngo bo dang 'dra ba skyed pa'i nus pa gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bon des myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun gyis rim gyis rang gi ngo bo dang 'dra ba skyed pa'i nus pa gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The seed is the projecting cause because that seed establishes the capacity to generate its own nature through the continuum of the sprout, etc.

original: gang gi phyir de'i rgyud yongs su smin pa 'byung ba'i khyad par thob pa las me tog gi rjes la 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i rgyud yongs su smin pa 'byung ba'i khyad par thob pa las me tog gi rjes la 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the seed has obtained a special transformation of its continuum that is conducive to the production of the fruit, the fruit arises after the flower.

original: de lta bur brgyud pa'i sbyor bas 'dzin pa ni 'bras bu de'i @118a * //
analyzed: de lta bur brgyud pa'i sbyor bas 'dzin pa ni 'bras bu de'i @118a * //
translated: The seed is the cause of that fruit through a process of transmission.

original: rgyu yin pas 'phen pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu yin pas 'phen pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the projected fruit.

original: zhing dang chu la sogs pa'i rkyen ni 'bras bu'i yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: zhing dang chu la sogs pa'i rkyen ni 'bras bu'i yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: The conditions such as the field, water, etc., are the cause of the fruit’s possession.

original: thams cad kyis 'bras bu de yongs su 'dzin par byed pas zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: thams cad kyis 'bras bu de yongs su 'dzin par byed pas zhes byas nas so //
translated: Because all of them possess the fruit.

original: sa bon de nyid ni rang gi 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: sa bon de nyid ni rang gi 'bras bu ste /
translated: That very seed is the cause of its own fruit,🔽the establishment of the sprout.

original: myu gu mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: myu gu mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de'i rjes thogs la de skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes byas nas so //🔽mngon par te gsar du'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes thogs la de skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes byas nas so // mngon par te gsar du'o //
translated: Because it arises immediately after that.🔽The establishment is the first establishment of the fruit.

original: 'grub pa ni kun gyi dang por 'grub pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'grub pa ni kun gyi dang por 'grub pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: sa bon gyis mngon par bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni myu gu'o //🔽sa bon gyis 'phangs pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu phyi ma rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sa bon gyis mngon par bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni myu gu'o // sa bon gyis 'phangs pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu phyi ma rnams kyi'o //
translated: The effect that is accomplished by the seed is the sprout.🔽The seed is the projecting cause of the subsequent effects.

original: rang gi 'bras bu phyi ma 'dren pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: rang gi 'bras bu phyi ma 'dren pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: It is the cause that attracts the subsequent effects.

original: rim gyis de'i 'bras bu 'dren par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rim gyis de'i 'bras bu 'dren par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It attracts the subsequent effects gradually.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag rigs mi mthun pa yin pa ni bden na yang thams cad las thams cad 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag rigs mi mthun pa yin pa ni bden na yang thams cad las thams cad 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Although the cause and effect are of different types, everything does not arise from everything.

original: 'o na ji lta bur 'byung ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bur 'byung ba yin zhe na /
translated: How then does it arise?🔽It arises from a specific cause.

original: rgyu so sor nges pa las 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni so sor nges pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu so sor nges pa las 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni so sor nges pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
translated: A specific cause is a cause that is not common to others.🔽The potency of entities that are different in nature is also different.

original: chos kyi ngo bo tha dad pa rnams kyi nus pa yang tha dad pa yin no zhes byas nas rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos kyi ngo bo tha dad pa rnams kyi nus pa yang tha dad pa yin no zhes byas nas rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pa nyid do //
translated: Having said that, it is the cause that produces an effect that is similar to itself.

original: rgyu dang rkyen gyi gzhan dbang du gyur pa 'dus byas kyi chos bya ba dang bral ba rnams tshogs par gyur pas bya ba sgrub pa nyid de dag thams cad ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyi gzhan dbang du gyur pa 'dus byas kyi chos bya ba dang bral ba rnams tshogs par gyur pas bya ba sgrub pa nyid de dag thams cad ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
translated: The cause of karmic maturation is that which is the cause of the karmic maturation of a factor.

original: skye ba la bar du gcod pa zhes bya ba ni bar du gcod par byed pas na skye ba la gags byed pa dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba'i don te /🔽so sor nges par gnas pa dang 'gal bar gnas pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba la bar du gcod pa zhes bya ba ni bar du gcod par byed pas na skye ba la gags byed pa dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba'i don te / so sor nges par gnas pa dang 'gal bar gnas pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
translated: The universal cause is that which is the cause of the universal factors.🔽The cause of the similar outcome is that which is the cause of the similar outcome of a factor.

original: bar du gcod pa'i rgyu dang bral ba ni mi mthun pa med pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: bar du gcod pa'i rgyu dang bral ba ni mi mthun pa med pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: The cause of separation is that which is the cause of the separation from defilements.🔽The cause of the special is that which is the cause of the special qualities of the form realm and the formless realm.

original: mngon du phyogs pa'i rgyu gang yin pa yang mi mthun pa med pa'i rgyu yin gyi /🔽med pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon du phyogs pa'i rgyu gang yin pa yang mi mthun pa med pa'i rgyu yin gyi / med pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /
translated: The cause of the arising of the special is that which is the cause of the arising of the special qualities of the form realm and the formless realm.

original: med pa ni rgyur rnam par gzhag par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa ni rgyur rnam par gzhag par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: The cause of the arising of the special is that which is the cause of the arising of the special qualities of the form realm and the formless realm.🔽The cause of the arising of the special is that which is the cause of the arising of the special qualities of the form realm and the formless realm.🔽The cause of the arising of the special is that which is the cause of the arising of the special qualities of the form realm and the formless realm.🔽The cause of the arising of the special is that which is the cause of the arising of the special qualities of the form realm and the formless realm.🔽The cause of the arising of the special is that which is the cause of the arising of the special qualities of the form realm and the formless realm.🔽The cause of the arising of the special is that which is the cause of the arising of the special qualities of the form realm and the formless realm.🔽The cause of the arising of the special is that which is the cause of the arising of the special qualities of the form realm and the formless realm.🔽The cause of the arising of the special is that

original: de yang de'i dus su nyams pa med pa yin pas nus pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya brag rnam par gzhag pas 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang de'i dus su nyams pa med pa yin pas nus pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya brag rnam par gzhag pas 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, since it is not impaired at that time, it becomes endowed with the capacity.

original: 'di dang 'gal zhing 'di mi gsal bar byed pas na mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dang 'gal zhing 'di mi gsal bar byed pas na mi mthun pa'o //
translated: It is incompatible because it contradicts this and does not clarify this.

original: mi mthun pa nyid rgyur gyur pa ni mi mthun pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa nyid rgyur gyur pa ni mi mthun pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of incompatibility is the cause of incompatibility.

original: mi mthun pa'i rgyu'i dbang du byas nas mi mthun par 'byung ba rab tu bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i rgyu'i dbang du byas nas mi mthun par 'byung ba rab tu bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: With reference to the cause of incompatibility, he says:

original: mdor bsdu na @118b rnam pa drug ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na @118b rnam pa drug ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: In brief, there are six types.

original: tshig nyid mi mthun pa ni tshig mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: tshig nyid mi mthun pa ni tshig mi mthun pa'o //
translated: The incompatibility of words is the incompatibility of words.

original: rigs pa dang 'gal ba nyid dang / skye ba dang / mi mthun pa dang / lhan cig gnas pa mi mthun pa dang / mi 'phrod pa'i mi mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i phyogs kyi mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa dang 'gal ba nyid dang / skye ba dang / mi mthun pa dang / lhan cig gnas pa mi mthun pa dang / mi 'phrod pa'i mi mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i phyogs kyi mi mthun pa'o //
translated: It is the incompatibility of reason, the incompatibility of arising, the incompatibility of co-existence, the incompatibility of unsuitability, and the incompatibility of the adverse side and the counteragent.

original: de la rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba ni tshig mi mthun pa ste /
analyzed: de la rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba ni tshig mi mthun pa ste /
translated: Among them, the incompatibility of words is the incompatibility of words.

original: de nyid kyi tshig snga ma dang phyi ma mi mthun pa'o zhes byas nas te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshig snga ma dang phyi ma mi mthun pa'o zhes byas nas te /
translated: The words of that scripture are inconsistent with each other,

original: dper na bdag gi pha gzhon nu nas tshangs par spyod pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //🔽phyi rol pa'i bstan bcos las ni sngon dang phyi ma mi mthun pa mang du 'byung ngo zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: dper na bdag gi pha gzhon nu nas tshangs par spyod pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o // phyi rol pa'i bstan bcos las ni sngon dang phyi ma mi mthun pa mang du 'byung ngo zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir smras pa /
translated: for example, My father was a celibate from youth, and so on.

original: dge sbyong dang bram ze kha cig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong dang bram ze kha cig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: In order to demonstrate that many inconsistencies between the former and latter [statements] occur in the treatises of the non-Buddhists, it is said, Some śramaṇas and brāhmaṇas...

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i don gtan tshigs kyis rab tu 'jog pa na tshad ma rnam pa gsum gyis bsdus pa nye bar gzhag pa gang yin pa'i rigs pa la ma tshang pa la sogs pa'i skyon dang bcas pa ni rigs pa dang 'gal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i don gtan tshigs kyis rab tu 'jog pa na tshad ma rnam pa gsum gyis bsdus pa nye bar gzhag pa gang yin pa'i rigs pa la ma tshang pa la sogs pa'i skyon dang bcas pa ni rigs pa dang 'gal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When the meaning to be established is well-founded by the reason, and the three types of valid cognition are included in the presentation, the fault of incompleteness, etc. in the reasoning is called contradictory to reasoning.

original: yan lag gnyis nye bar gyur pa dang nye bar ma gyur pa las dngos po 'byung bar 'gyur ba las de dag las gang yang rung ba cig ma tshang pa ni skye ba dang mi mthun pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag gnyis nye bar gyur pa dang nye bar ma gyur pa las dngos po 'byung bar 'gyur ba las de dag las gang yang rung ba cig ma tshang pa ni skye ba dang mi mthun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The arising of a thing from the conjunction or non-conjunction of two members is called “the incompatibility of arising.”

original: snang ba dang mun pa dag kyang lhan cig gnas par 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: snang ba dang mun pa dag kyang lhan cig gnas par 'gal ba yin te /
translated: Light and darkness are mutually incompatible,

original: phan tshun byed pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun byed pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their actions are mutually exclusive.

original: mun pa'i byed pa ni sgrib pa yin la /
analyzed: mun pa'i byed pa ni sgrib pa yin la /
translated: The action of darkness is to conceal,

original: snang ba'i byed pa ni gsal ba ston pa yin pas so //🔽'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag ni dga' ba dang zhum pa'i rnam pa can yin pas so //🔽bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag ni len pa dang 'dor bar 'dod pa'i rnam pa can yin pas so //
analyzed: snang ba'i byed pa ni gsal ba ston pa yin pas so // 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag ni dga' ba dang zhum pa'i rnam pa can yin pas so // bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag ni len pa dang 'dor bar 'dod pa'i rnam pa can yin pas so //
translated: and the action of light is to reveal.🔽Desire and hatred are mutually incompatible, because the former has the aspect of delight and the latter has the aspect of depression.

original: gsod pa dang gsad bya ni mi 'phrod pa'i 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: gsod pa dang gsad bya ni mi 'phrod pa'i 'gal ba'o //
translated: Pleasure and pain are mutually incompatible, because the former has the aspect of wanting to take up and the latter has the aspect of wanting to put down.🔽The killer and the killed are mutually incompatible, because the former has the aspect of wanting to kill and the latter has the aspect of not wanting to die.

original: gzhan dag gcig tu dgrar gyur pa dag la yang bstan par bya ba'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag gcig tu dgrar gyur pa dag la yang bstan par bya ba'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that even those who are enemies should be shown compassion, it is said:

original: gcig la gcig phyir rgol zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gcig la gcig phyir rgol zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and they fight with each other, etc.

original: gnyis las gang lhag par bsgoms pas gzhan spong ba'am 'byung ba'i gegs byed pa ni mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i phyogs kyi mi mthun pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis las gang lhag par bsgoms pas gzhan spong ba'am 'byung ba'i gegs byed pa ni mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i phyogs kyi mi mthun pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The antidote that is the opposite of the one that is cultivated in excess, or that obstructs the arising of the other, is called the opposite of the side of the antidote.

original: bye brag gi gnyen po'i phyogs kyi dbang du byas nas mi sdug pa la sogs pa dper byas pa'o //
analyzed: bye brag gi gnyen po'i phyogs kyi dbang du byas nas mi sdug pa la sogs pa dper byas pa'o //
translated: The examples of the repulsive, etc. are from the point of view of the specific antidote.

original: spyi'i gnyen po'i phyogs kyi dbang du byas nas ni byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam yan lag brgyad pa dper byas pa'o //🔽don gyi @119a * //
analyzed: spyi'i gnyen po'i phyogs kyi dbang du byas nas ni byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam yan lag brgyad pa dper byas pa'o // don gyi @119a * //
translated: The examples of the factors of enlightenment and the eightfold noble path are from the point of view of the general antidote.🔽In this context, the meaning is

original: skabs 'dir ni zhes bya ba la rgyu'i dbang du byas nas don de nyid rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni zhes bya ba la rgyu'i dbang du byas nas don de nyid rigs pa yin no //
translated: in terms of the cause, and that meaning is reasonable.

original: de ltar rgyas par bstan pa'i don rnams bsdus nas mdor bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de ltar rgyas par bstan pa'i don rnams bsdus nas mdor bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of the extensive explanation in brief, he says,

original: yang rgyu 'di dag thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: yang rgyu 'di dag thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Moreover, all these causes are the causes of the arising of the wholesome.

original: rgyu mang po rnams las gang dang 'dra bar 'bras bu skyed par byed pa ni bskyed pa'i rgyu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu mang po rnams las gang dang 'dra bar 'bras bu skyed par byed pa ni bskyed pa'i rgyu zhes bya ste /
translated: The cause that generates an effect in accordance with a particular cause is called the generating cause.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i dbye ba yin pa'i phyir dang / de'i 'bras bu de yin par grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i dbye ba yin pa'i phyir dang / de'i 'bras bu de yin par grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is a specific division and because its effect is well known to be that.

original: gzhan thams cad yongs su 'dzin pa tsam gyis phan 'dogs pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: gzhan thams cad yongs su 'dzin pa tsam gyis phan 'dogs pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: All other causes are merely assisting causes,

original: de dag med par yang mi 'byung ba'i phyir thabs kyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de dag med par yang mi 'byung ba'i phyir thabs kyi rgyu yin no //
translated: because the effect does not occur in the absence of those causes.

original: rgyu de dag nyid rkyen rnam pa bzhir gzhag go zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: rgyu de dag nyid rkyen rnam pa bzhir gzhag go zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that those very causes are posited as the four conditions, he says:

original: bskyed pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: That which is the generating cause is the efficient condition.

original: rgyu dang rkyen ni rgyu dang rkyen te /🔽'bras bu de rgyu dang mthun par 'byung bar byed pa ni rgyu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen ni rgyu dang rkyen te / 'bras bu de rgyu dang mthun par 'byung bar byed pa ni rgyu zhes bya'o //
translated: Cause and condition are cause and condition.🔽The cause that generates an effect in accordance with a particular cause is called the generating cause.🔽That which is the generating cause is the efficient condition.🔽That which is the generating cause is the efficient condition.

original: de ni 'di dag las 'byung bar 'gyur bas na rkyen zhes bya ste /🔽so so'i sbyor ba dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: de ni 'di dag las 'byung bar 'gyur bas na rkyen zhes bya ste /🔽so so'i sbyor ba dang ldan pas so //
translated: That which is the generating cause is the efficient condition.🔽That which is the generating cause is the efficient condition.🔽That which is the generating cause is the efficient condition.🔽That which is the generating cause is the efficient condition.🔽That which is the generating cause is the efficient condition.🔽That which is the generating cause is the efficient condition.🔽That which is the generating cause is the efficient condition.🔽That which is the generating cause is the efficient condition.🔽That which is the generating cause is the efficient condition.🔽That which is the generating cause is the efficient condition.🔽That which is the generating cause is the efficient condition.🔽That which is the generating cause is the efficient condition.🔽That which is the generating cause is the efficient condition.🔽That which is the generating cause is the efficient condition.🔽That which is the generating cause is the efficient condition.🔽That which is the generating cause is the efficient condition.🔽That which is the generating cause is the efficient condition.🔽That which is the generating cause is the efficient condition.🔽That which is the generating cause is the efficient condition.🔽That which is the generating cause is the efficient condition.🔽That which is the generating cause is the efficient condition.🔽That which is the generating cause is the efficient condition.🔽That which is the generating cause is the efficient condition.🔽That which is the generating cause is the efficient condition.🔽That which is the generating cause is the efficient condition.🔽That which is the generating cause is the efficient condition.🔽That which is the generating cause is the efficient condition.🔽That which is the generating cause is the efficient condition.🔽That which is the generating cause is the efficient condition.🔽That which is the generating cause is the efficient condition.🔽That which is the generating cause

original: thabs kyi rgyu yang ji ltar rigs par bdag po'i rkyen yin gyi /
analyzed: thabs kyi rgyu yang ji ltar rigs par bdag po'i rkyen yin gyi /
translated: The causal condition of the means of knowledge is the dominant condition, as appropriate.

original: ma lus pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma lus pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not all of that.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos dmigs pas yongs su bsdus pa rnams rab tu 'byung ba'i dus su ni 'dra bar 'byung bar 'gyur zhing 'jug par 'gyur ba ni mi 'dra ba 'byung ba'i dus su'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos dmigs pas yongs su bsdus pa rnams rab tu 'byung ba'i dus su ni 'dra bar 'byung bar 'gyur zhing 'jug par 'gyur ba ni mi 'dra ba 'byung ba'i dus su'o //
translated: When the phenomena of mind and mental factors are included in the object, they arise in a similar way at the time of arising and in a dissimilar way at the time of engagement.

original: de dag ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir des na dmigs pa'i rkyen zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir des na dmigs pa'i rkyen zhes bya'o //
translated: Because they have an object and have aspects, they are called the objective condition.

original: des na de nyid ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: des na de nyid ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: Therefore, that is also called the immediately preceding condition.

original: mnyam du skye zhing rdzas mtshungs par 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mnyam du skye zhing rdzas mtshungs par 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Because they arise together and engage in a similar substance.

original: sems dang sems byung bzhi las so zhes pa'i nges pas so //
analyzed: sems dang sems byung bzhi las so zhes pa'i nges pas so //
translated: Because of the restriction that four arise from mind and mental factors.

original: de lta bu'i rnam grangs kyis yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyus bsdus pa ni rkyen gnyis su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam grangs kyis yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyus bsdus pa ni rkyen gnyis su rig par bya'o //
translated: By such a method, the two conditions should be understood as included in the cause of grasping.

original: sngar bstan pa'i rgyu thams cad kyis bsdus pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / 'jig rten pa rnams kyi lo tog la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i rgyu thams cad kyis bsdus pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / 'jig rten pa rnams kyi lo tog la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of “all the causes previously explained, the afflictions, purification, and the crops, etc. of worldly people,” it is said:

original: 'jig rten pa'i dngos po thams cad ni ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dngos po thams cad ni ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “How do all worldly things arise?” up to

original: rnam par byang ba'i bar ni ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i bar ni ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: “How does purification arise?”

original: phyi'i dngos po rnams ji ltar rigs par rgyu bcu las 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan @119b pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: phyi'i dngos po rnams ji ltar rigs par rgyu bcu las 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan @119b pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to teach that external things arise from the ten causes as appropriate, it is said:

original: 'di ltar na 'jig rten na 'bru'i grangs su gtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar na 'jig rten na 'bru'i grangs su gtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, what is included in the number of grains in the world, etc.

original: lo tog rnams kyi ming 'bru zhes bya bar brjod pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: lo tog rnams kyi ming 'bru zhes bya bar brjod pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to explain that the name of crops is called “grains,” it is said:

original: tshig tu brjod pa rnam pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba la de nyid ni gnas pa 'dzin par byed pas 'bru zhes bya ste /
analyzed: tshig tu brjod pa rnam pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba la de nyid ni gnas pa 'dzin par byed pas 'bru zhes bya ste /
translated: The various verbal expressions are called “seeds” because they hold the place of the seeds.

original: de dag gi ming gis 'jig rten pa rnams tha snyad du byed pa'i phyir tha snyad kyi rgyu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi ming gis 'jig rten pa rnams tha snyad du byed pa'i phyir tha snyad kyi rgyu zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called “causes of conventional expressions” because worldly people use them conventionally.

original: de dag gi longs spyod ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de dag gi longs spyod ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of enjoyment of those seeds:

original: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: those who are not free from passion and those who are free from passion.

original: de la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i ni rnam pa bzhis ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: de la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i ni rnam pa bzhis ltos pa yin no //
translated: Those who are free from passion have four kinds of enjoyment.

original: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba rnams kyi ni kha zas la sred pa yang ngo //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba rnams kyi ni kha zas la sred pa yang ngo //
translated: Those who are not free from passion have a craving for food.

original: de la 'dod pa ni zas la sogs pa la mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa ni zas la sogs pa la mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: Here, “desire” is the desire for food, etc.

original: tshol ba ni de thob par bya ba'i thabs thams cad la nan tan byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshol ba ni de thob par bya ba'i thabs thams cad la nan tan byed pa'o //
translated: “Seeking” is the effort to obtain it by any means.

original: len pa ni rnyed pa la'o //
analyzed: len pa ni rnyed pa la'o //
translated: “Taking” is the acquisition of it.

original: rnyed pa rnams kha dang sna nas khong du btang zhing spyad pa ni longs spyod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: rnyed pa rnams kha dang sna nas khong du btang zhing spyad pa ni longs spyod par byed pa ste /
translated: “Enjoyment” is the use of what has been acquired by putting it in the mouth and nose.

original: de ltar 'bru rnams la bya ba rnam pa lnga yod pas na ltos pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'bru rnams la bya ba rnam pa lnga yod pas na ltos pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, since the seeds have five kinds of activity, they are called the causal condition.

original: de dag rang rang gi rgyu las nges par skyes pas na 'phen pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag rang rang gi rgyu las nges par skyes pas na 'phen pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
translated: Since they are definitely produced from their own causes, they are called the projecting cause.

original: lhan cig byed pa'i bya ba dang ldan pas yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa'i bya ba dang ldan pas yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
translated: Since they possess the activity of the cooperating causes, they are called the supporting cause.

original: sa bon gyi rjes thogs su myu gu 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni mngon par grub pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: sa bon gyi rjes thogs su myu gu 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni mngon par grub pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The arising of the sprout immediately after the seed is the cause of actualization.

original: myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun gnas skabs gzhan du gyur pa dang ldan pa'i rgyud yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par gyis 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa ni 'dren par byed pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun gnas skabs gzhan du gyur pa dang ldan pa'i rgyud yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par gyis 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa ni 'dren par byed pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
translated: The seed continuum that possesses the transformation of the state of the continuum of the sprout and so on, which produces the effect through the distinction of transformation, is called the leading cause.

original: tha mi dad pa'i sa bon las so sor nges pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba ni so sor nges pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i sa bon las so sor nges pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba ni so sor nges pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
translated: The arising of a specific effect from a specific seed that is not different from it is called the specific cause.

original: lo tog la ji lta ba bzhin du shing rnams dang / rtsva rnams la yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lo tog la ji lta ba bzhin du shing rnams dang / rtsva rnams la yang rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as with crops, trees and grass should be understood in the same way.

original: rgyu de dag tshogs nas byed pa nyid ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu de dag tshogs nas byed pa nyid ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
translated: The collection of those causes is called the “cooperating cause.”

original: ser ba bab pa dang / lo tog gi nad kyis de skye ba la bar du gcod pa ni mi mthun pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ser ba bab pa dang / lo tog gi nad kyis de skye ba la bar du gcod pa ni mi mthun pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
translated: The falling of hail and the disease of crops are called the “opposing cause” because they obstruct the arising of the crop.

original: de dag dang bral ba ni mi mthun pa med pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag dang bral ba ni mi mthun pa med pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
translated: The absence of those is called the “non-opposing cause.”🔽The three types of afflictions become the ten causes as appropriate.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum ni ji ltar rigs par rgyu bcur 'gyur ro zhes rang nyid kyis sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum ni ji ltar rigs par rgyu bcur 'gyur ro zhes rang nyid kyis sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to connect this with the text, he says:

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The three types of afflictions, etc.

original: sred pa sngon du song ba las kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sred pa sngon du song ba las kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: All afflictions arise from craving that precedes them.

original: yul gyi ro myong bas 'phangs pa'o zhes bya bar smras pa /
analyzed: yul gyi ro myong bas 'phangs pa'o zhes bya bar smras pa /
translated: They are impelled by the taste of the object.

original: ma rig @120a * //
analyzed: ma rig @120a * //
translated: Ignorance is the root of all afflictions.

original: pa la sogs pa'i sa bon gyis 'phangs pa'i yang srid pa dang ldan pas ma 'ongs pa'i skye bas bsdus pa'i rga shi'i 'phen pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: pa la sogs pa'i sa bon gyis 'phangs pa'i yang srid pa dang ldan pas ma 'ongs pa'i skye bas bsdus pa'i rga shi'i 'phen pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: and so on, which is projected by the seeds, is the projecting cause of the future birth and aging and death that are included in birth.

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa rnams ni ji ltar rigs par yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa rnams ni ji ltar rigs par yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Ignorance and so on are the embracing cause, as is appropriate.

original: yang sa bon ni de ma thag tu 'bras bu mngon par 'grub par byed pas mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang sa bon ni de ma thag tu 'bras bu mngon par 'grub par byed pas mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the seed is called the establishing cause because it immediately establishes the effect.

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa de dag nyid phyi ma phyi ma'i phan tshun gyi yan lag dang ldan pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba dang rga shi rnams 'dren par byed pas 'dren pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa de dag nyid phyi ma phyi ma'i phan tshun gyi yan lag dang ldan pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba dang rga shi rnams 'dren par byed pas 'dren pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
translated: Those very things such as ignorance that possess the mutual characteristics of the future birth and aging and death are called the leading cause because they lead to future birth and aging and death.

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa 'gro ba lnga'i rgyur so sor nges pa ni so sor nges pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa 'gro ba lnga'i rgyur so sor nges pa ni so sor nges pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o ;
translated: The individual determination of ignorance and so on as the causes of the five destinies is called the individually determined cause.

original: / de dag kun tshogs pa'i bya ba byed pas lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: / de dag kun tshogs pa'i bya ba byed pas lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
translated: The performance of the function of the aggregation of all of those is called the co-operating cause.

original: thar pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mi mthun pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: thar pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mi mthun pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the very cause of liberation is the cause of the incompatibility of affliction, he says:

original: rigs dang ldan pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs dang ldan pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “endowed with the lineage” and so on.

original: thar pa'i rgyu dang bral ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang mi mthun pa med pa'i rgyu'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: thar pa'i rgyu dang bral ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang mi mthun pa med pa'i rgyu'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the absence of the cause of liberation is the cause of the absence of incompatibility of affliction, he says:

original: ji skad bstan pa'i chos de dag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i chos de dag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “the very factors that were taught” and so on.

original: rnam par byang ba'i yang rgyu bcu po nyid ji ltar rigs par rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu dang / skye ba'i rgyu dang / 'thob pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i yang rgyu bcu po nyid ji ltar rigs par rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu dang / skye ba'i rgyu dang / 'thob pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the very ten causes of purification are the cause of establishment, the cause of arising, and the cause of attainment, as is appropriate, he says:

original: de la rnam par byang ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnam par byang ba yang gnyis te rnam par byang ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la rnam par byang ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnam par byang ba yang gnyis te rnam par byang ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: “purification” and so on. Purification is twofold: the cause of purification and the result of purification.

original: lam yang rnam par byang ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lam yang rnam par byang ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The path is also called “purification” because it is the cause of purification.

original: gang yang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa rnams rnam par byang bar byed pas na rnam par byang ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang yang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa rnams rnam par byang bar byed pas na rnam par byang ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Moreover, since the applications of mindfulness, etc. are purified, they are called purification.

original: gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: Why is that?

original: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi chos thams cad dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi chos thams cad dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: He says, “because they are the dharmas on the side of purification, etc.

original: rnam par byang ba'i 'bras bu yang rnam par byang ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i 'bras bu yang rnam par byang ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The result of purification is also called purification.

original: 'dir rnam par byang bar 'gyur bas na zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: 'dir rnam par byang bar 'gyur bas na zhes byas nas so //
translated: Here, it is because they are purified.

original: gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'gog pa mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'gog pa mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: He says, “cessation, nirvana, etc.

original: de lta bu ni re zhig rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu yin no //🔽rgyu 'di dag gis rnam par byang ba rnam par 'jog par byed /🔽rab tu 'dogs par byed /
analyzed: de lta bu ni re zhig rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu yin no // rgyu 'di dag gis rnam par byang ba rnam par 'jog par byed / rab tu 'dogs par byed /
translated: Such is the cause of the establishment of purification.

original: nges par spyod par byed pas so zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: nges par spyod par byed pas so zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that purification is established, imputed, and ascertained by these causes, he says:

original: tshig tu brjod pa gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshig tu brjod pa gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Whatever is expressed in words, etc.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa @120b gsum log par gyur pa'i mtshan nyid ni tha snyad du rnam par byang bzhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa @120b gsum log par gyur pa'i mtshan nyid ni tha snyad du rnam par byang bzhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: The characteristic of the reversal of the three kinds of all-pervading spiritual unruliness is called “purification” conventionally.

original: ma rig pa 'gags pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa 'gags pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is said: “When ignorance ceases, then the karmic forces cease. ”

original: 'du byed kyi nyes dmigs la ltos nas zhes bya ba ni 'du byed ni khams gsum du ji ltar 'os par nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga dang bzhir rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi nyes dmigs la ltos nas zhes bya ba ni 'du byed ni khams gsum du ji ltar 'os par nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga dang bzhir rig par bya'o //
translated: “In relation to the danger of the karmic forces” means that the karmic forces should be understood as the five appropriative aggregates or the four appropriative aggregates, as is appropriate, in the three realms.

original: de'i nyes dmigs kyi rnam pa yang dag par mthong pas skyon de la ltos nas skyo ba dang bcas pa'i yid kyis 'khor ba la yid byung zhing /
analyzed: de'i nyes dmigs kyi rnam pa yang dag par mthong pas skyon de la ltos nas skyo ba dang bcas pa'i yid kyis 'khor ba la yid byung zhing /
translated: “In relation to the danger of the karmic forces” means that, having seen the various aspects of the danger of the karmic forces, one becomes disgusted with that danger, and with a mind that is disgusted, one becomes disenchanted with cyclic existence.

original: sems mya ngan las 'das pa 'dod pas thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: sems mya ngan las 'das pa 'dod pas thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa nas brtsams nas /
translated: From the time that one generates the roots of the wholesome that are conducive to liberation,

original: yongs su smin par 'gyur gyi bar du ni /
analyzed: yongs su smin par 'gyur gyi bar du ni /
translated: up to the time that one becomes fully matured,

original: rnam par byang ba tshol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba tshol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: one is said to be “seeking purification. ”

original: yongs su smin pa'i khyad par thob par gyur pas /
analyzed: yongs su smin pa'i khyad par thob par gyur pas /
translated: Because he has attained the special excellence of complete maturation,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsgom pa ni rnam par byang ba yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsgom pa ni rnam par byang ba yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: the cultivation of the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment is called the “grasping of purification.”

original: de ltar lam bsgom pa dang ldan pa des 'bras bu bzhi yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba ni rnam par byang ba yongs su 'grub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar lam bsgom pa dang ldan pa des 'bras bu bzhi yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba ni rnam par byang ba yongs su 'grub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The completion of the four fruits by one who is endowed with the cultivation of the path is called the “accomplishment of purification.”

original: rnam par byang ba rnam pa gsum po 'di dag la 'jug pa yang sngar bstan pa'i nyes dmigs mthong bas ltos pa med par gyur pa na'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba rnam pa gsum po 'di dag la 'jug pa yang sngar bstan pa'i nyes dmigs mthong bas ltos pa med par gyur pa na'o //
translated: Moreover, the entry into these three purifications occurs when one becomes independent through the insight into the disadvantages previously explained.

original: rigs dang ldan pa nyan thos la sogs pa'i ris su lhung ba dus gzhan du gyur pa na rgyud yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par dang ldan pas mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir 'phen pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rigs dang ldan pa nyan thos la sogs pa'i ris su lhung ba dus gzhan du gyur pa na rgyud yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par dang ldan pas mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir 'phen pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The cause of projection is the possession of the lineage, the falling into the class of śrāvaka, etc., the transformation at another time, and the possession of the excellence of the transformation of the basis, because it precedes the going to nirvāṇa.

original: srid pa tha ma pa skyes bu dam pa la brten pa la sogs pas sngon gyi skye bar dbang po yongs su smin pa ni yongs su smin pa'i rgyu zhes bya ste /🔽rnam par byang ba 'dod pa rnams kyis blang par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / de dag gis rnam par byang ba blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa tha ma pa skyes bu dam pa la brten pa la sogs pas sngon gyi skye bar dbang po yongs su smin pa ni yongs su smin pa'i rgyu zhes bya ste / rnam par byang ba 'dod pa rnams kyis blang par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / de dag gis rnam par byang ba blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause of full maturation is the full maturation of the faculties in former lives through reliance on holy persons, etc.🔽, in the final life.

original: rgyas pa las byung ba'i rigs kyi gnas skabs la gnas pa la zag pa med pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad kyi sa bon yongs su rgyas pa'i gnas skabs na rgyun mi 'chad par lam bskyed pa ni mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu zhes bya ste
analyzed: rgyas pa las byung ba'i rigs kyi gnas skabs la gnas pa la zag pa med pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad kyi sa bon yongs su rgyas pa'i gnas skabs na rgyun mi 'chad par lam bskyed pa ni mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu zhes bya ste
translated: The cause of actualization is the uninterrupted generation of the path in the state of the seed of all the uncontaminated elements of the path to enlightenment being fully developed in the state of the lineage that has been expanded.

original: / de ma thag tu lam bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / de ma thag tu lam bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called the cause of actualization because the path is generated immediately.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos de dag rim gyis bsgom pa las mya ngan las 'das pa thob par nus par gyur pa ni 'dren par byed pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos de dag rim gyis bsgom pa las mya ngan las 'das pa thob par nus par gyur pa ni 'dren par byed pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
translated: The cause of guidance is the ability to attain nirvana through the gradual cultivation of those elements that lead to enlightenment.

original: rigs gsum dang so sor 'brel pa'i rim pa ji @121a * //🔽lta ba bzhin du byang chub gsum gyi rigs kyang rnam pa gsum gang yin pa de ni so sor nges pa'i rgyu yin te /
