original: brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid la bskal pa brgya stong mang po'i mthar thug par gnas pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid la bskal pa brgya stong mang po'i mthar thug par gnas pas ni ma yin no //
translated: He has no pride, no conceit, no arrogance, no haughtiness, no vanity, no self-satisfaction, no self-conceit, no conceit of superiority, no conceit of equality, no conceit of inferiority.

original: de la la la zhig gal te 'di skad zer te /
analyzed: de la la la zhig gal te 'di skad zer te /
translated: He has no pride, no

original: khyod kyis me'i dong chen por lus bor te sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i phung po chen po rang gi lus kyis nyams su blang bar nus na ngas khyod la chos kyi tshig yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs🔽su sbyor bar byed pa 'di bshad par bya'o zhes zer na yang /
analyzed: khyod kyis me'i dong chen por lus bor te sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i phung po chen po rang gi lus kyis nyams su blang bar nus na ngas khyod la chos kyi tshig yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su sbyor bar byed pa 'di bshad par bya'o zhes zer na yang /
translated: If you say this,

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /🔽chos kyi tshig yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su sbyong ba'i don du ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams mes yongs su gang bar yang tshangs pa'i 'jig rten nas bdag gis bdag 'dor🔽bar mos na @124a * //
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te / chos kyi tshig yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su sbyong ba'i don du ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams mes yongs su gang bar yang tshangs pa'i 'jig rten nas bdag gis bdag 'dor bar mos na @124a * //
translated: then think as follows:🔽For the sake of the words of the Dharma taught by the perfect Buddha that purify the bodhisattva deeds, I would throw myself from the Brahma world into a great trichiliocosm world system filled with fire.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: For the sake of the words of the Dharma taught by the perfect Buddha that purify the bodhisattva deeds, I would throw myself from the Brahma world into a great trichiliocosm world system filled with fire.

original: de dag thams cad bsdus nas phyi nas gus bar nan tan bya ba'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de dag thams cad bsdus nas phyi nas gus bar nan tan bya ba'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Having summarized all of those, he says, in order to show his respect for them later on:

original: tsha zhing 'bar ba la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: tsha zhing 'bar ba la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Even if it were to be burning and blazing.

original: ji ltar chos don du byed pa de ltar bdag gi lus kyi dngos po gang gis sangs rgyas kyi chos dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba mang du 'grub pa'i lus kyi dngos po de lta bu la yang sred cing dang du len par mi byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar chos don du byed pa de ltar bdag gi lus kyi dngos po gang gis sangs rgyas kyi chos dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba mang du 'grub pa'i lus kyi dngos po de lta bu la yang sred cing dang du len par mi byed do //
translated: Just as he acts for the sake of the Dharma, he does not crave or accept even such a physical existence as would accomplish much for the sake of the Buddha-qualities and for the full maturity of sentient beings.

original: bdag la sred pa'i sgo nas ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /🔽brgya'i char yang mi phod do //
analyzed: bdag la sred pa'i sgo nas ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir / brgya'i char yang mi phod do //
translated: In order to show that he does not do so out of craving for himself, he says:🔽It does not amount to even a hundredth part.

original: stong gi cha dang / grangs dang / cha dang / bgrang ba dang / rgyur yang mi phyod do zhes bya ba la grangs kyi gnas bcu bcu lhag pa'i rnam grangs su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: stong gi cha dang / grangs dang / cha dang / bgrang ba dang / rgyur yang mi phyod do zhes bya ba la grangs kyi gnas bcu bcu lhag pa'i rnam grangs su rig par bya'o //
translated: It does not amount to a thousandth part, or to a calculation, or to a fraction, or to a reckoning, or to a comparison.

original: de ltar re zhig gus par rab tu nye bar gzhag pa nyid kyis nye bar 'gro ba phun sum tshogs pa'i bya ba bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig gus par rab tu nye bar gzhag pa nyid kyis nye bar 'gro ba phun sum tshogs pa'i bya ba bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Thus, in order to demonstrate the activity of perfect going in the sense of perfect placement of devotion, he says:

original: skyo bar yang mi 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: skyo bar yang mi 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: He does not become weary, etc.

original: chos nyan par byed pa na lus la yang gnod pa med cing /🔽sems nyams par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: chos nyan par byed pa na lus la yang gnod pa med cing / sems nyams par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: When listening to the Dharma, he does not harm his body.🔽He does not become mentally exhausted.

original: dran pa brjed par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dran pa brjed par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He does not forget.

original: chu bo rnams kyi rgya mtsho bzhin du thos pas mi ngoms shing chog pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu bo rnams kyi rgya mtsho bzhin du thos pas mi ngoms shing chog pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Like the ocean with its rivers, he is insatiable and never satisfied with listening.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' thos pa'i rgya mtsho zhes brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' thos pa'i rgya mtsho zhes brjod pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva is called the ocean of listening,

original: thos pas gang ba yang med /
analyzed: thos pas gang ba yang med /
translated: because he is not filled by listening,

original: ma thos pas bri ba yang med pa'o //
analyzed: ma thos pas bri ba yang med pa'o //
translated: nor is he diminished by not listening.

original: legs par gsungs shing legs par rnyed pa don chen po dang ldan par yid ches pa ni dad pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: legs par gsungs shing legs par rnyed pa don chen po dang ldan par yid ches pa ni dad pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called faithful because he has confidence in the great meaning of the well-spoken and well-obtained.

original: de'i sgo nas dga' ba dang rab tu dga' ba thob pa ni dang ba mang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas dga' ba dang rab tu dga' ba thob pa ni dang ba mang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The attainment of joy and gladness through that is called “abundant clarity.”

original: legs par gsungs pa la sdang ba med pa ni rgyud mnyen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa la sdang ba med pa ni rgyud mnyen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The absence of hostility toward the well-spoken is called “pliancy of mind.”

original: chos dang chos smra ba la lus kyis gzhan du byed pa med pa ni drang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos dang chos smra ba la lus kyis gzhan du byed pa med pa ni drang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The absence of physical distraction in regard to the Dharma and its teacher is called “uprightness.”

original: sems la g-yo med pa ni drang por lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems la g-yo med pa ni drang por lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The absence of deceit in the mind is called “straightforwardness.”

original: 'di dag thams cad gus pa rab tu nye bar gzhag pa'i 'bras bu yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad gus pa rab tu nye bar gzhag pa'i 'bras bu yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that all of these are the fruits of the establishment of respect.

original: nye bar 'gro ba phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu yang yin no //
analyzed: nye bar 'gro ba phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu yang yin no //
translated: They are also the causes of the perfection of going.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang bral ba'i nye bar 'gro ba phun sum tshogs pa'i rnam pa bzhi bstan pa'i phyir thos pa'i shes pa'i yon tan don du gnyer ba nyid gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang bral ba'i nye bar 'gro ba phun sum tshogs pa'i rnam pa bzhi bstan pa'i phyir thos pa'i shes pa'i yon tan don du gnyer ba nyid gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate the four kinds of perfection of going that are free of resistance, he says, “because of his desire for the virtues of learning and knowledge,” etc.

original: de yon tan 'dod pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yon tan 'dod pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He is one who desires the virtues of learning and knowledge.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs bstan ba'i @124b phyir /
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs bstan ba'i @124b phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the resistance to that, he says,

original: klan ka tshol ba'i sems kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: klan ka tshol ba'i sems kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Not with a mind seeking for faults.

original: skyon tshol ba'i sems kyis ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skyon tshol ba'i sems kyis ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Not with a mind seeking for faults.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la ston pa'i 'du shes kyis 'dud cing nye bar 'gro ba yin pas gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la ston pa'i 'du shes kyis 'dud cing nye bar 'gro ba yin pas gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: With the perception of the spiritual teacher as the Teacher, one bows down and approaches. Therefore it is said:

original: gus pa dang bcas pas 'gro'o zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: gus pa dang bcas pas 'gro'o zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: With respect, one approaches.

original: / mi mthun pa'i phyogs med par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /🔽nga rgyal gyis khengs pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / mi mthun pa'i phyogs med par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa / nga rgyal gyis khengs pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: In order to show the absence of adverse factors, it is said:🔽Not with a mind inflated with pride.

original: nga rgyal gyis khengs pa'i sems med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyis khengs pa'i sems med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Not with a mind inflated with pride.

original: dge ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams yongs su btsal ba'i bsam pa ni de dge ba la ji lta bu zhig btsal zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams yongs su btsal ba'i bsam pa ni de dge ba la ji lta bu zhig btsal zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The intention to seek wholesome dharmas, etc. is: How does one seek the wholesome?

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching of its adverse factors is:

original: bdag nyid bsgrags pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag nyid bsgrags pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: Not for the sake of self-promotion.

original: nga lta bu'i skyes bu ga la yod ces mi zer ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nga lta bu'i skyes bu ga la yod ces mi zer ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: How could there be a person like me?

original: thos nas chos dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrub pa'i phyir gang yang smras pa /
analyzed: thos nas chos dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrub pa'i phyir gang yang smras pa /
translated: Having heard, in order to practice the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma, he said:

original: bdag dang gzhan dag ces bya ba'i bar du gcod par byed pa'i skyon rnams kyi chos nyan pa phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa bcu drug dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan dag ces bya ba'i bar du gcod par byed pa'i skyon rnams kyi chos nyan pa phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa bcu drug dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Up to for the sake of myself and others. The perfection of listening to the Dharma has sixteen aspects.

original: rnam pa de dag gi mdor bsdus pa bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de dag gi mdor bsdus pa bstan par bya'o //
translated: The summary of those aspects will be taught.

original: mdor na thos pa'i bar du gcod par byed pa'i skyon ni gnyis te /
analyzed: mdor na thos pa'i bar du gcod par byed pa'i skyon ni gnyis te /
translated: In brief, there are two faults that obstruct listening:

original: bsam pa ma dag pa nyid kyis khyi ltar ngan ngon tshol zhing zhen pas chos nyan pa'i dus su rnam par rtog pa ngan pa la mngon du phyogs nas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ma dag pa nyid kyis khyi ltar ngan ngon tshol zhing zhen pas chos nyan pa'i dus su rnam par rtog pa ngan pa la mngon du phyogs nas gnas pa'o //
translated: Due to impure intention, like a dog seeking scraps, one is attached and, when listening to the Dharma, one dwells facing bad thoughts.

original: de'i gnyen po'i phyogs bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po'i phyogs bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to teach the antidote to that, it is said:

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Without affliction and so on.

original: rjes su mi 'dzin pa'i skyon ni dmigs pa gzhan dag la rnam par 'phro ba ste /
analyzed: rjes su mi 'dzin pa'i skyon ni dmigs pa gzhan dag la rnam par 'phro ba ste /
translated: The fault of not holding on to the meaning is the scattering of the mind to other objects.

original: de'i gnyen po'i phyogs bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po'i phyogs bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to teach the antidote to that, he said:

original: rnam par g-yeng ba med par chos nyan to zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba med par chos nyan to zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “He listens to the Dharma without distraction.”

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum rnam par spangs pa las kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa rnam par dbye bar bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum rnam par spangs pa las kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa rnam par dbye bar bya'o //
translated: The absence of defilement should be understood as the avoidance of the three kinds of defilement.

original: rnam pa drug gis bdag nyid khengs par byed pa ni khengs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa drug gis bdag nyid khengs par byed pa ni khengs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The defilement of pride should be understood as the six kinds of pride.🔽The pride of thinking “I am superior” because of belonging to a high caste,

original: rigs mthon po dang ldan pas khengs pa'i nga rgyal dang / de'i gnyen po'i phyogs smras pa /🔽dus su nyam pa dang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rigs mthon po dang ldan pas khengs pa'i nga rgyal dang / de'i gnyen po'i phyogs smras pa / dus su nyam pa dang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In order to teach the antidote to that, he said:🔽“He listens to the Dharma without pride.”

original: chos smra ba'i rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽dbang phyung dang// @125a * //
analyzed: chos smra ba'i rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don to // dbang phyung dang// @125a * //
translated: The meaning is that he follows the Dharma teacher.🔽He listens to the Dharma without being distracted by the thought of his own body,

original: bdag po la sogs pas kyang ste /
analyzed: bdag po la sogs pas kyang ste /
translated: or by the thought of his own possessions,🔽or by the thought of his own life.

original: de'i gnyen po'i phyogs smras pa /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po'i phyogs smras pa /
translated: In order to teach the antidote to that, he said:🔽“He listens to the Dharma without distraction.”

original: bkur sti byed pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bkur sti byed pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and respect.

original: gzugs kyis khengs pa dang / de'i gnyen po'i phyogs smras pa /
analyzed: gzugs kyis khengs pa dang / de'i gnyen po'i phyogs smras pa /
translated: One is puffed up with pride because of one's physical beauty. The antidote to that is stated:

original: legs par nyan par 'dud pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: legs par nyan par 'dud pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: One is humble in listening.

original: gzhan mang du thos pa dang ldan pa mi bzod pas bdag nyid mtho bar bya ba'i phyir 'ga' zhig nyan par byed pa srid pa'i phyir de'i gnyen po'i phyogs smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan mang du thos pa dang ldan pa mi bzod pas bdag nyid mtho bar bya ba'i phyir 'ga' zhig nyan par byed pa srid pa'i phyir de'i gnyen po'i phyogs smras pa /
translated: One is puffed up with pride because of one's own learning, not being able to bear the great learning of others. The antidote to that is stated:

original: phrag dog med pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phrag dog med pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: One is free from envy.

original: shes rab kyi che ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi che ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The greatness of wisdom is twofold:

original: don so sor rig par nus pa nyid dang / skyon phra mo mthong bar nus pa nyid do //
analyzed: don so sor rig par nus pa nyid dang / skyon phra mo mthong bar nus pa nyid do //
translated: the ability to understand the meaning and the ability to see subtle faults.

original: shes rab kyi yon tan che ba de dag ldan pas khengs pa dang / de'i gnyen po'i phyogs smras pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi yon tan che ba de dag ldan pas khengs pa dang / de'i gnyen po'i phyogs smras pa /
translated: One is puffed up with pride because of those great qualities of wisdom. The antidote to that is stated:

original: go rims bzhin du rjes su sgrub pa dang / klan ka mi tshol ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du rjes su sgrub pa dang / klan ka mi tshol ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: One is in accord with the Dharma and one does not seek to find fault.

original: rjes su sgrub pa yang rnam pa gzhan gyi don go bar gsal bar bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su sgrub pa yang rnam pa gzhan gyi don go bar gsal bar bstan par bya'o //
translated: Later, the practice should be taught clearly so that the meaning of the other aspects is understood.

original: chos dang chos smra ba la rnam pa bzhis khyad du gsod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos dang chos smra ba la rnam pa bzhis khyad du gsod par 'gyur te /
translated: One becomes contemptuous of the teaching and the teacher in four ways:

original: chos la legs par gsungs pa dang / don che bar yid la mi byed pa nyid dang / chos smra ba la dge ba'i bshes gnyen du yid la mi byed pa dang / yang chos la tshig dang don sna tshogs med par yid la byed pa dang /
analyzed: chos la legs par gsungs pa dang / don che bar yid la mi byed pa nyid dang / chos smra ba la dge ba'i bshes gnyen du yid la mi byed pa dang / yang chos la tshig dang don sna tshogs med par yid la byed pa dang /
translated: One does not think of the teaching as well-spoken, nor as having great meaning; one does not think of the teacher as a spiritual teacher; and one thinks of the teaching as having no variety of words and meanings.

original: chos smra ba la rigs dang / tshul khrims dang / gzugs dang ; ngag la sogs pa dman pa yin par yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos smra ba la rigs dang / tshul khrims dang / gzugs dang ; ngag la sogs pa dman pa yin par yid la byed pa'o //
translated: One thinks of the teacher as inferior in social class, morality, physical appearance, speech, and so on.

original: de dag gi gnyen po'i phyogs rnam pa bzhi dang ldan na khyad du gsod pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi gnyen po'i phyogs rnam pa bzhi dang ldan na khyad du gsod pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one has the four counteragents to these, one is free from the defilement of contempt.

original: bdag nyid la nus pa med par sems pa ni zhum pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i //
analyzed: bdag nyid la nus pa med par sems pa ni zhum pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i //
translated: The defilement of faintheartedness is the thought that one is incapable.

original: de'i gnyen po'i phyogs kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa de dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po'i phyogs kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa de dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and one becomes free from the defilement that is the opposite of the remedy for that.

original: de ltar rnam par bcu gcig po de dag gis kun nas nyon mongs par rnam pa gsum dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par bcu gcig po de dag gis kun nas nyon mongs par rnam pa gsum dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, one becomes free from the three kinds of defilement through these eleven aspects.

original: rnam pa bcu gcig gis bsdus pa'i mdo'i tshig gi dbang du byas nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gcig gis bsdus pa'i mdo'i tshig gi dbang du byas nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the eleven aspects that are included in the words of the sutra,

original: dus su nyan pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dus su nyan pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa yin no //
translated: he says, “listening at the proper time,” and so on.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of distraction:

original: don la rnam par g-yeng ba dang / yi ge la rnam par g-yeng ba dang / dran pa rnam par g-yeng ba dang / yid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
analyzed: don la rnam par g-yeng ba dang / yi ge la rnam par g-yeng ba dang / dran pa rnam par g-yeng ba dang / yid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
translated: distraction regarding the object, distraction regarding verbal expression, distraction regarding memory, and distraction regarding mental activity.

original: don la rnam par g-yeng ba ni nang du bsdus par gyur bas 'bad pa med par @125b 'jug pa yang yin te /
analyzed: don la rnam par g-yeng ba ni nang du bsdus par gyur bas 'bad pa med par @125b 'jug pa yang yin te /
translated: Distraction regarding the object is the mental state that is not focused on the object of meditation because the mind is drawn outward by the power of signs.

original: de'i gnyen por kun shes par bya ba'i sems dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por kun shes par bya ba'i sems dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The remedy for that is the mental state that is focused on the object of meditation.🔽Distraction regarding verbal expression is the mental state that is focused on the object of meditation but is drawn outward by the power of verbal expression.🔽The remedy for that is the mental state that is focused on the object of meditation and is not drawn outward by the power of verbal expression.🔽Distraction regarding memory is the mental state that is focused on the object of meditation and is not drawn outward by the power of verbal expression, but is drawn outward by the power of memory of past enjoyments of sense objects.🔽The remedy for that is the mental state that is focused on the object of meditation and is not drawn outward by the power of verbal expression or by the power of memory of past enjoyments of sense objects.🔽Distraction regarding mental activity is the mental state that is focused on the object of meditation and is not drawn outward by the power of verbal expression or by the power of memory of past enjoyments of sense objects, but is drawn outward by the power of mental activity that is directed toward the formless realm.🔽The remedy for that is the mental state that is focused on the object of meditation and is not drawn outward by the power of verbal expression or by the power of memory of past enjoyments of sense objects or by the power of mental activity that is directed toward the formless realm.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa rang yul las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa rang yul las 'das pa ste /
translated: The mental consciousness is beyond its own object.

original: de'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa ni sems rtse gcig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa ni sems rtse gcig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The side that is the antidote to that is called “one-pointed mind.”

original: yi ge la rnam par g-yeng ba ni phyi rol gyi yul gzhan la mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: yi ge la rnam par g-yeng ba ni phyi rol gyi yul gzhan la mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rgyu ba'o //
translated: Distraction to syllables is the movement of the eye faculty and so forth to other external objects.

original: de'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa smras pa ni /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa smras pa ni /
translated: The side that is the antidote to that is stated:

original: rna blags pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rna blags pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Ears pricked up.”

original: gnyis po de dag ni gzhan nas nang gi rnam par g-yeng ba dang / phyi'i rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gnyis po de dag ni gzhan nas nang gi rnam par g-yeng ba dang / phyi'i rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bshad do //
translated: Those two are explained elsewhere as internal distraction and external distraction.

original: dran pa rnam par g-yeng ba ni gus par ma bzung bas 'dzin par mi nus ba ste /
analyzed: dran pa rnam par g-yeng ba ni gus par ma bzung bas 'dzin par mi nus ba ste /
translated: Distraction to mindfulness is not being able to hold the object of meditation because of not holding it with respect.

original: de'i gnyen po'i phyogs smras pa /🔽yang dag par sems btud pa dang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po'i phyogs smras pa / yang dag par sems btud pa dang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The side that is the antidote to that is stated:🔽“The mind is well bent.”

original: legs par yid la byed pa ni yang da par sems btud pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: legs par yid la byed pa ni yang da par sems btud pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Proper mental activity is called “the mind is well bent.”

original: yid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba ni dgongs pa dang / bsam pa yid la mi byed par yi ge dang don phyin ci log tu bzung bas so //
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba ni dgongs pa dang / bsam pa yid la mi byed par yi ge dang don phyin ci log tu bzung bas so //
translated: Distraction of mental orientation is due to the absence of the intention and the absence of the mental orientation of reflection.

original: de'i gnyen po'i phyogs smras pa /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po'i phyogs smras pa /
translated: The remedy for that is stated:

original: sems kyis bsams nas chos nyan te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sems kyis bsams nas chos nyan te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: One listens to the Dharma with a mind that is attentive, etc.

original: shin tu yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called mental orientation.

original: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi nan tan gyis sangs rgyas kyi chos tshol gyi /
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi nan tan gyis sangs rgyas kyi chos tshol gyi /
translated: One seeks the Buddha-Dharma by means of the practice of Dharma that is in conformity with the Dharma.🔽One seeks the Buddha-Dharma in order to perfect the practice, because it is said:

original: tshig 'ba' zhig rnam par dag pas ni ma yin no zhes bya bas bsgrub pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su tshol te /🔽de ni sgrub pa gtsor byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig 'ba' zhig rnam par dag pas ni ma yin no zhes bya bas bsgrub pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su tshol te / de ni sgrub pa gtsor byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One does not seek it with mere verbal purity.

original: gzhan dag la yang rgya cher yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yang dag par mthong bar bya ba la bskul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang rgya cher yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yang dag par mthong bar bya ba la bskul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to demonstrate it extensively to others is to incite others to see correctly.

original: de bzhin du rang gi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir dang / theg pa gsum la sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rang gi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir dang / theg pa gsum la sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, in order to ripen one's own qualities of a Buddha and in order to ripen sentient beings in the three vehicles.

original: rtsod pa'i bstan bcos ni nyes pa mang po'i skyon chags pa yin te /
analyzed: rtsod pa'i bstan bcos ni nyes pa mang po'i skyon chags pa yin te /
translated: The treatise on debate is flawed by many faults.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'byung gnas yin pa'i phyir nyes par bshad pa nyid de /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'byung gnas yin pa'i phyir nyes par bshad pa nyid de /
translated: It is badly explained because it is the source of afflictions.

original: de yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir yongs su tshol te /
analyzed: de yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir yongs su tshol te /
translated: One searches for it in order to understand it.

original: chos rnams thos na skyon dang yon tan gyi snod du gyur pa shes kyi /
analyzed: chos rnams thos na skyon dang yon tan gyi snod du gyur pa shes kyi /
translated: When one hears the Dharma, one knows whether one is a vessel for faults or for virtues.

original: ma thos par ni ma yin no zhes bstan pas so //
analyzed: ma thos par ni ma yin no zhes bstan pas so //
translated: One does not know without hearing.

original: rtsod pa la mkhas par ma byas na rigs par smra ba yin na yang phyin ci log gi rtsod pa la dga' ba rnams kyis chos 'dri bar 'gyur ba dang @126a * //
analyzed: rtsod pa la mkhas par ma byas na rigs par smra ba yin na yang phyin ci log gi rtsod pa la dga' ba rnams kyis chos 'dri bar 'gyur ba dang @126a * //
translated: If one is not skilled in debate, even if one speaks logically, those who delight in perverse debate will ask Dharma questions.

original: phas kyi rgol ba rnams tshar bcad pa'i phyir rtsod pa'i sbyor ba la mkhas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nges ba yin no //
analyzed: phas kyi rgol ba rnams tshar bcad pa'i phyir rtsod pa'i sbyor ba la mkhas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nges ba yin no //
translated: In order to defeat adversaries, one should be skilled in the composition of debates. This is the certainty.

original: de dag gis ni gzhan gyi phyogs sun dbyung bar bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gis ni gzhan gyi phyogs sun dbyung bar bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: By these, it is taught: One should refute the positions of others.

original: 'di dag gi gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba la gzhan dag gzu bor bzhag nas de kho na nyid kyi don shes par bya ba'i phyir gang smras pa /
analyzed: 'di dag gi gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba la gzhan dag gzu bor bzhag nas de kho na nyid kyi don shes par bya ba'i phyir gang smras pa /
translated: When one has established others in the composition of arguments for these, in order to make them understand the meaning of reality, one says:

original: bstan pa 'di la ma dad pa rnams dad par bya ba'i phyir dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bstan pa 'di la ma dad pa rnams dad par bya ba'i phyir dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to generate faith in those who have no faith in this teaching.

original: zhugs pa rnams phyir zhing 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: zhugs pa rnams phyir zhing 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to increase the faith of those who have entered, one says:

original: dad pa rnams kyang phyir zhing 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dad pa rnams kyang phyir zhing 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya'o //
translated: In order to further increase the faith of those who have faith.

original: 'di dag gis ni rang gi phyogs gnas par bya bar bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni rang gi phyogs gnas par bya bar bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: By these, it is taught: One should establish one's own position.

original: sbyar ba'i skad la mngon par dga' ba rnams bdag gi yon tan la yid ches pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir tshig dang yi ge nges pa'i tshig bzang po spyod pas legs par sbyar te zhes bya ba ni sgra legs par sbyar ba'i sbyor bas zhes bya ba'i
analyzed: sbyar ba'i skad la mngon par dga' ba rnams bdag gi yon tan la yid ches pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir tshig dang yi ge nges pa'i tshig bzang po spyod pas legs par sbyar te zhes bya ba ni sgra legs par sbyar ba'i sbyor bas zhes bya ba'i
translated: This means that he teaches them the science of grammar by means of good composition.

original: don to // 'di dag gis ni sbyor ba la mkhas par bya ba'i don bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don to // 'di dag gis ni sbyor ba la mkhas par bya ba'i don bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: By these [four], the meaning of skill in composition is taught.

original: nges pa'i tshig rnam pa sna tshogs kyis zhes bya ba ni sgra sna tshogs la ngon du ma nyid du 'gyur bas de la 'jug pa'i yi ge la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig rnam pa sna tshogs kyis zhes bya ba ni sgra sna tshogs la ngon du ma nyid du 'gyur bas de la 'jug pa'i yi ge la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
translated: By various etymologies, he teaches them the science of synonyms, saying I will teach them the science of synonyms.

original: 'di dag gis ni mtshan nyid la mkhas pa bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni mtshan nyid la mkhas pa bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: By these [four], the meaning of skill in characteristics is taught.🔽In order to pacify various diseases, he teaches them the science of medicine, saying I will teach them the science of medicine.

original: nad rnam pa sna tshogs rnam par zhi bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nad pa rnams kyi nad zhi bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nad rnam pa sna tshogs rnam par zhi bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nad pa rnams kyi nad zhi bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means in order to cure the sick.

original: phan gdags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nad med par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan gdags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nad med par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For the sake of benefit means for the sake of health.

original: gzhan yang bskyed pa'i nad rnams gso ba gang yin pa de ni rnam par zhi bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang bskyed pa'i nad rnams gso ba gang yin pa de ni rnam par zhi bar byed pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the healing of generated diseases is pacification.

original: ma skyes pa rnams gtan mi skye bar byed pa ni phan gdags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa rnams gtan mi skye bar byed pa ni phan gdags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The non-generation of those not yet arisen is benefit.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dbul por gyur na yang tshogs chung dus longs spyod bsgrub pa'i phyir dang / longs spyod kyis sems can rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir 'di lta bu'i bya bas phun sum tshogs pa thob par bya ba'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dbul por gyur na yang tshogs chung dus longs spyod bsgrub pa'i phyir dang / longs spyod kyis sems can rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir 'di lta bu'i bya bas phun sum tshogs pa thob par bya ba'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: Even when bodhisattvas are poor, they obtain the perfection of such activities through a small collection, for the sake of obtaining resources and for the sake of benefiting sentient beings with those resources.

original: gces par bya ba bskyed pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gces par bya ba bskyed pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: For the sake of generating affection means

original: bzo'i las kyi gnas kyi sgo nas grags pa chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzo'i las kyi gnas kyi sgo nas grags pa chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: through the door of the arts and crafts, one becomes greatly renowned.

original: nye bar mkho bas phongs pa'i sems can rnams la longs spyod sgrub pa'i thabs dang man ngag bslabs shing bstan pas ni phan 'dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye bar mkho bas phongs pa'i sems can rnams la longs spyod sgrub pa'i thabs dang man ngag bslabs shing bstan pas ni phan 'dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: And they benefit beings who are in need of necessities by teaching and instructing them in the means and methods for acquiring enjoyments.

original: rig pa'i gnas lnga po 'di dag bsdus pa'i 'bras bu @126b gcig nyid bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas lnga po 'di dag bsdus pa'i 'bras bu @126b gcig nyid bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to show that the result of collecting all five sciences is a single one, he says:

original: rig pa'i gnas lnga po 'di dag thams cad tshol ba yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas lnga po 'di dag thams cad tshol ba yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The pursuit of all these five sciences, etc.

original: rig pa'i gnas lnga po 'di dag la sbyor ba goms par ma byas par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes shes bya thams cad la thogs pa med par mi 'gyur ro zhes byas nas rig pa'i gnas lngas bsdus pa'i chos tshol bar byed cing /
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas lnga po 'di dag la sbyor ba goms par ma byas par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes shes bya thams cad la thogs pa med par mi 'gyur ro zhes byas nas rig pa'i gnas lngas bsdus pa'i chos tshol bar byed cing /
translated: Without having cultivated familiarity with the five sciences, the knowledge of omniscience will not become unobstructed with regard to all objects of knowledge.

original: de nas de gzhan dag la yang ston par byed do //
analyzed: de nas de gzhan dag la yang ston par byed do //
translated: Having understood this, they pursue the Dharma that is included in the five sciences and then teach it to others.

original: de ltar na gang btsal ba'i sangs rgyas kyi gsung de gzhan dag kyang chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la nan tan byed du gzhug pa'i phyir ston par byed cing gzhan dag la yang ston du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na gang btsal ba'i sangs rgyas kyi gsung de gzhan dag kyang chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la nan tan byed du gzhug pa'i phyir ston par byed cing gzhan dag la yang ston du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the Buddha's speech, which is sought in this way, is taught in order to cause others to practice the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma, and it is taught in order to cause others to teach it.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang rig par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for others.🔽The twenty aspects of discourse should be expressed.

original: rnam pa nyi shus gtam brjod par bya'o zhes mdo'i rjes su 'brangs nas bstan pa de dag nyid bstan par 'dod pas de dag gi bsdus pa'i don nges par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shus gtam brjod par bya'o zhes mdo'i rjes su 'brangs nas bstan pa de dag nyid bstan par 'dod pas de dag gi bsdus pa'i don nges par bstan pa ni /
translated: The one who wishes to teach these very topics in accordance with the sutra teaches their summarized meaning with the words:

original: rnam pa gnyis kyis ston te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyis ston te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: It is taught by two aspects.

original: gzhan gyi don thams cad la rjes su mthun pas na mthun pa'i gtam brjod pas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don thams cad la rjes su mthun pas na mthun pa'i gtam brjod pas so //
translated: It is said to be 'in accordance with the Dharma' because it is in accordance with all the aims of others.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pas na yongs su dag pas so zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pas na yongs su dag pas so zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said to be 'pure' because it is not defiled.

original: dus su dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dus su dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In a timely manner, etc.🔽What is the time?

original: don bstan pa'i phyir yang dus gang zhe na /
analyzed: don bstan pa'i phyir yang dus gang zhe na /
translated: For the sake of teaching the meaning, it is said:

original: spyod lam gyi tshul dang mthun par gnas pa la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: spyod lam gyi tshul dang mthun par gnas pa la zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should live in accordance with the rules of proper behavior.

original: tshul dang mthun pa'i spyod lam yang so sor thar pa'i mdo'i rjes su 'brangs nas bstan te /🔽stan ches mthon po la 'dug pa la ma yin /
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa'i spyod lam yang so sor thar pa'i mdo'i rjes su 'brangs nas bstan te / stan ches mthon po la 'dug pa la ma yin /
translated: Proper behavior is taught in accordance with the Sutra of the Vows of Individual Liberation.🔽One should not sit on a very high seat,

original: mgo g-yogs pa la ma yin /
analyzed: mgo g-yogs pa la ma yin /
translated: one should not sit with one's head covered,

original: mdun du 'gro ba la ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽bdag nyid las khyad par du 'phags par gyur pa'i gang zag gzhan med pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi chos nyid la bkur sti mdzad de /
analyzed: mdun du 'gro ba la ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // bdag nyid las khyad par du 'phags par gyur pa'i gang zag gzhan med pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi chos nyid la bkur sti mdzad de /
translated: one should not sit in front of one's teacher, etc.🔽One should not disparage the Dharma, saying, This is not the Dharma, or This is not the teaching of the Teacher.🔽 One should not disparage the Dharma, because there is no other person who is superior to oneself.

original: chos nyid kyis gnas khyad par can thob par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos nyid kyis gnas khyad par can thob par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One should honor the Dharma of the Blessed One, because one has attained a special status through the Dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang chos la bla mar byas pas khyad par du 'gro zhing 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang chos la bla mar byas pas khyad par du 'gro zhing 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattvas also progress and advance by honoring the Dharma, thinking, I will honor the Dharma.

original: bdag nyid kyis chos la bkur sti byas nas gzhan dag kyang chos la shas cher chos la gus pa bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis chos la bkur sti byas nas gzhan dag kyang chos la shas cher chos la gus pa bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having honored the Dharma oneself, one also generates great respect for the Dharma in others.

original: gus pas bsnyen bkur byed bas na khyad du gsod par mi byed do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gus pas bsnyen bkur byed bas na khyad du gsod par mi byed do zhes bya'o //
translated: One does not despise them because one reveres and honors them.

original: bkur sti dang zhes bya ba'i don ni thams cad la ston cing zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bkur sti dang zhes bya ba'i don ni thams cad la ston cing zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of respect is as follows: One teaches all.

original: gus pas yin gyi ma gus pas ni ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: gus pas yin gyi ma gus pas ni ma yin pa ste /
translated: One teaches with reverence, not with disrespect.

original: seng ge mchod ba bzhin no //🔽thams cad ston to zhes bya ba dang / rgyun mi @127a * //
analyzed: seng ge mchod ba bzhin no // thams cad ston to zhes bya ba dang / rgyun mi @127a * //
translated: It is like the worship of the lion.

original: 'chad par zhes bya ba ni bar du bcad cing mi ston pa ste /
analyzed: 'chad par zhes bya ba ni bar du bcad cing mi ston pa ste /
translated: One teaches all and continuously means that one does not teach intermittently.

original: chos la ser sna med pas thams cad la ston cing //
analyzed: chos la ser sna med pas thams cad la ston cing //
translated: One teaches all because one is not stingy with the Dharma.

original: slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud med pas thams cad ston pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud med pas thams cad ston pa'o //
translated: One teaches all because one is not parsimonious like a bad teacher.

original: go rims dang zhes bya ba ni tshig dang yi ge go rims bzhin du ston pa'o //
analyzed: go rims dang zhes bya ba ni tshig dang yi ge go rims bzhin du ston pa'o //
translated: Order means teaching in the order of the words and syllables.

original: gang gi phyir mdor bstan pa'i tshig bkod pa bzhin du 'chad par byed pa ni go rims bzhin du 'chad par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mdor bstan pa'i tshig bkod pa bzhin du 'chad par byed pa ni go rims bzhin du 'chad par byed pa'o //
translated: One teaches in order because one explains in accordance with the order of the words in the summary.

original: tshig de dag bshad pa'i go rims kyang rnam pa bzhir rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshig de dag bshad pa'i go rims kyang rnam pa bzhir rig par bya'o //
translated: The order of the explanation of those words should be understood in four ways.

original: ji ltar skye ba nyid ni dper na bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar skye ba nyid ni dper na bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa lta bu'o //
translated: As for the order of their arising, it is like that of the meditative concentrations and formless states.

original: ji ltar gnyen po'i phyogs nyid yin pa ni dper na phyin ci log rnams kyi gnyen po'i phyogs nyid dran pa nye par gzhag pa rnams lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gnyen po'i phyogs nyid yin pa ni dper na phyin ci log rnams kyi gnyen po'i phyogs nyid dran pa nye par gzhag pa rnams lta bu'o //
translated: As for their being the side of the counteragent, it is like the applications of mindfulness being the side of the counteragent to the perversions.🔽As for their order of grossness, it is like that of the aggregates, i.e., form is the grossest of all the aggregates, and consciousness is the most subtle.🔽As for their order of superiority, it is like that of the truths, i.e., the truth of origination is superior to the truth of suffering, and the truth of the path is superior to the truth of cessation.

original: rags pa'i go rims nyid ni brjod pa la sogs pa bde bas ji ltar phung po rnams bzhin no //
analyzed: rags pa'i go rims nyid ni brjod pa la sogs pa bde bas ji ltar phung po rnams bzhin no //
translated: As for their order of teaching, it is like that of the aggregates, etc.

original: ji ltar so sor rig pa ni bden pa rnams ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar so sor rig pa ni bden pa rnams ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: As for their order of realization, it is like that of the truths, i.e., one realizes the truth of suffering first, and the truth of the path last.🔽As for their order of connection, it is like that of the words of the teaching, i.e., the words of the teaching are explained in the same order in which they are connected.

original: mtshams sbyor ba dang zhes bya ba ni rim gyis bstan par bya ba'i tshig rnams mdor bstan pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'chad par byed pa ste /
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba dang zhes bya ba ni rim gyis bstan par bya ba'i tshig rnams mdor bstan pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'chad par byed pa ste /
translated: The order of the elements is in accordance with the order of their grossness, etc.

original: rim pa bzhin du don rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: rim pa bzhin du don rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: The order of the faculties is in accordance with their order of realization.🔽The order of the dependent origination is in accordance with the order of their connection.

original: chos kyang don dang nye bar ldan pa ni rjes su mthun pa dang zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyang don dang nye bar ldan pa ni rjes su mthun pa dang zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The order of the truths is in accordance with the order of their realization.🔽The order of the perfections is in accordance with the order of their superiority.🔽The order of the meditative development of the applications of mindfulness, etc. is in accordance with the order of their teaching.

original: brjod par bya ba'i don phyin ci ma log pa dang ldan pa'i phyir don dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba'i don phyin ci ma log pa dang ldan pa'i phyir don dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is meaningful because it is endowed with the unerring meaning of what is to be expressed.

original: gang gis legs par bshad pa zhes brjod par bya ba'i brjod bya phun sum tshogs pa go bar byed pa nyid ni chos dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis legs par bshad pa zhes brjod par bya ba'i brjod bya phun sum tshogs pa go bar byed pa nyid ni chos dang ldan pa ste /
translated: It is endowed with the Dharma because it causes one to understand the excellence of the content that is to be expressed, which is called “well-spoken.”

original: gang gis tshig 'bru bzang po zhes brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis tshig 'bru bzang po zhes brjod pa'o //
translated: It is endowed with good words because it is called “well-spoken.”

original: yang shes rab 'phel bar byed pas na don dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: yang shes rab 'phel bar byed pas na don dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is meaningful because it causes wisdom to increase.

original: bsod nams 'phel bar byed pas na chos dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams 'phel bar byed pas na chos dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is endowed with the Dharma because it causes merit to increase.

original: thar pa'i rten du gyur pa'i dkon mchog gsum dang / thar pa'i dmigs pa bden pa bzhi la mi shes pa dang / the tshom za ba dang / phyin ci log gi shes par dang ldan pas rmongs pa de rnams kyis dkon mchog gsum gyi yon tan thos pa dang /
analyzed: thar pa'i rten du gyur pa'i dkon mchog gsum dang / thar pa'i dmigs pa bden pa bzhi la mi shes pa dang / the tshom za ba dang / phyin ci log gi shes par dang ldan pas rmongs pa de rnams kyis dkon mchog gsum gyi yon tan thos pa dang /
translated: Those who are confused about the three jewels, which are the support for liberation, and about the four noble truths, which are the object of liberation, because they possess ignorance, doubt, and mistaken knowledge, generate great joy by hearing about the qualities of the three jewels

original: bden pa'i rnam par dbye ba thos pas rab tu dga' ba bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bden pa'i rnam par dbye ba thos pas rab tu dga' ba bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: and by hearing about the divisions of the truths.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: dga' bar byed pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dga' bar byed pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and gladdens.

original: le lo can dang / 'dun pa med pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba'i nyes pas dge ba'i chos la bag med par gyur pas dge ba'i chos la nan tan mi byed pa de dag dge ba'i chos de dag la yang dag par sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: le lo can dang / 'dun pa med pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba'i nyes pas dge ba'i chos la bag med par gyur pas dge ba'i chos la nan tan mi byed pa de dag dge ba'i chos de dag la yang dag par sbyor ba dang /
translated: Those who are lazy, who have no desire, who are distracted, who are negligent about wholesome actions, who do not practice wholesome actions, he causes them to apply themselves to those wholesome actions.

original: rab tu dgod @127b pas mngon par mos pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: rab tu dgod @127b pas mngon par mos pa skyed par byed do //
translated: By causing them to apply themselves, he causes them to generate enthusiasm.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: 'dod par byed pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod par byed pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: he delights.

original: sems can zhum pa dang dman pa bdag nyid la nus pa med par sems pa dang / 'gyod pa mang ba dang / bya ba mang ba rnams dang / 'jigs pa dang ldan pa rnams sems can de dag brtson 'grus brtsams pa la yang dag par sbyor bar byed /
analyzed: sems can zhum pa dang dman pa bdag nyid la nus pa med par sems pa dang / 'gyod pa mang ba dang / bya ba mang ba rnams dang / 'jigs pa dang ldan pa rnams sems can de dag brtson 'grus brtsams pa la yang dag par sbyor bar byed /
translated: Those sentient beings who are timid, who are inferior, who think themselves incapable, who have much regret, who have many duties, who are fearful, he causes them to apply themselves to the practice of effort.

original: gzengs stod par byed do //
analyzed: gzengs stod par byed do //
translated: He encourages them.

original: des de dag khyad par du 'gro bar 'gyur bas rab tu dga' ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des de dag khyad par du 'gro bar 'gyur bas rab tu dga' ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of that, they generate enthusiasm, as they progress.

original: des na smras pa /
analyzed: des na smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:🔽he encourages.

original: mgu par byed pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mgu par byed pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and to please.

original: spro bar bya bar 'os pa ni yang dag par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: spro bar bya bar 'os pa ni yang dag par zhugs pa'o //
translated: Those who are worthy of being encouraged are those who have entered correctly.

original: sma dbab par 'os pa ni phyin ci log tu zhugs pa rnams so //
analyzed: sma dbab par 'os pa ni phyin ci log tu zhugs pa rnams so //
translated: Those who are worthy of being reproved are those who have entered perversely.

original: de dag la spro ba yang mi bskyed /
analyzed: de dag la spro ba yang mi bskyed /
translated: One should neither encourage them

original: sma yang mi 'bebs te /
analyzed: sma yang mi 'bebs te /
translated: nor reprove them.

original: de lta bus 'dul ba'i gdul bya mngon par mi shes pas des 'dul ba ma yin pa rnams khong khro ba skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir chos 'ba' zhig bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bus 'dul ba'i gdul bya mngon par mi shes pas des 'dul ba ma yin pa rnams khong khro ba skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir chos 'ba' zhig bshad par bya'o //
translated: Because those who are not to be disciplined by such means will generate aversion toward the teaching, one should only explain the Dharma.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:
